author: {'steamid': '76561198038484993', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 803, 'last_played': 1666147422}
review:
TLDR:  Enjoyable tower defense game that doesn't take itself too seriously.

When the old master war mage suffers an accidental--and embarrassing--death, it's up to his apprentice to turn back the tides and stuff the orcs back in their hole ... only, he has no idea what he's doing.

Orcs Must Die is a tower defense game like many others, of twenty-some levels split into three acts, with some amusing cinematics between them. The levels consist of barred doors with the orcs beating at the other side, and long castle corridors leading to the mysterious rifts. The player has time to lay traps, assign guardians, and so on before launching the assault--and then when the orcs come, blast them down in 3rd-person shooter-style perspective. Head shots do extra damage, as they should.

The concept is simple but the strategy can be surprisingly deep. Some of the castles have multiple approaches to multiple rifts (one wonders who designed these things) and the player may have to deal with simultaneous assaults from different angles. This is where the strategy comes in; there are various traps to inflict damage, slow the enemy, or spring-loaded panels to fling them away. The player will also earn fire, ice, and wind attacks. Some levels feature environmental aids (hot oil cauldrons, chandeliers to be dropped, spiked logs that roll down steps) that can be used one or more times. Archer or sword guardians can be summoned. After the first act, the player will be contacted by the weavers, powerful sorceresses who offer buffs--for a price, of course.

With limited coin (and time between most waves) to place traps, planning and forethought to build a cohesive defense is key. Attempt different set-ups and don't be afraid to blow a round or two to test a strategy.The player won't get the ceiling mace (swings back and forth, crushing everything underneath it) until after the halfway point, but the mace angled along the orc approach (meaning it swings parallel to the hallways, not across) with barricades to channel the orcs under it, and tar traps to slow down attackers and keep them under the mace, are incredibly effective.

Against this will come warrior orcs (bearing shields in later levels, that nullify the first hit), archer orcs, kobald runners (who don't attack but run fast for the rift) and sappers (who detonate barricades), ogres (slow but hard to put down), hobgoblin shamans (they resurrect dead enemies), and gnoll hunters (who ignore the rift but are fast, jump barricades, and track the player and guardians). Later levels introduce flying mobs, which add a new dimension of complexity to the defenses.

All of this will take practice to perfect and no one trap will account for all enemies. The ceiling mace I mentioned, for example, won't swing fast enough to catch every kobold and ogres can survive the hits and keep coming. Again, I recommend you experiment and take chances on different defenses. The nice thing is that the levels are relatively short. I think I did all of them in under 25 minutes, and they only took that long because I spent several minutes planning my defenses. It's n easy game if you just want to play for a few minutes and mow down a horde of bad guys. There are three difficulty levels: Apprentice, War Mage, and Nightmare, with scaling difficulty.

The game loads quick and I didn't encounter any glitches, save a few odd instances enemy corpses getting tossed into the environment, where they got stuck. The graphics are animated and clean, but smooth. Sound is good and provides key notices, such as if orcs break through a certain point, or faint howls when the gnoll hunters enter the map. Also, the player's war mage has some humorous lines at the start of each level. The whole thing, in fact, has a fairly tongue in cheek feel, and I enjoyed the humor.

If the game has a failing, it is that, like most tower defense games, it can get very repetitive. Also, the deeper into the campaign you go, the less margin for error there is and the harder it is to control all the lanes of attack. One viable option is to play all the way through on Apprentice, in order to get all the traps and spells available (once granted, they remain for replays of earlier maps or other difficulties).

Steam achievements are mostly doable by players of any skill and other than those directly tied to difficulty level, they can be done on the easiest settings.

All in all, Orcs Must Die is a fun time-waster, with some good humor and interesting strategic set-ups. Recommended!

Pros
- Good mix of strategy and action
- Smooth graphics, textures, and sounds

Cons
- Can get repetitive, and difficult before having all available traps

Final Score: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198068174012', 'num_games_owned': 690, 'num_reviews': 384, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1665760188}
review:
Orcs Must Die! (2011)

Extremely fun game to play with a simple premise - orcs swarm the portal, you place traps to kill the orcs and that stops them from swarming the portal, permanently. Your Warmage character can use different weapons to help in the slaughter but they tend to drain your mana with each use, so strong and great to have around but best used sparingly. The traps you can use involve stuff like spike traps, grinders that suck orcs in and... well grind them to dust, archers that can shoot flying enemies and orcs, spikes that shoots from the walls, sticky tar that slows orcs. Get sadistic and creative with the traps, you have plenty of options. About halfway through the game you unlock these fine ladies who will help either your traps, your weapons and mage abilities or a good mix of great non trap related defences. I prefer the trap upgrades, it always felt for me it had the most inpact. Each level you complete unlocks skulls based on how well you performed, you use these skulls to permanently upgrade your traps before starting a new mission.

There are a lot of levels to this game, I do not know if the dlc content adds any maps to the game but I have all the content for the game so for me it's just one big game. Lots of maps with different layouts and certain traps works better with certain maps. Its a great game to play, but I found myself finishing a few levels at a time instead of one big push to finish the game. It worked better for me, gave me a refreshed insight to each level. Its a very creative game to play and I highly recommend you give this game a go.

8/10

review: After beating OMD2 three times and being very let down by OMD3, I went back and played the original orc slaying, action tower defense game that started the franchise. The formula still works well and it's a really fun game. That said 2 improves on everything that is good in this game. The rankings very clearly go 2 > 1 > 3. Get your fill on 2 before trying 1 and just go back and play 2 if you're considering playing 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198357137407', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 1079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1079, 'last_played': 1663512376}
review:
Even a smartphone tower difference game is better than this. poor map designs, useless traps/weapons, and countlessly meaningless battles. I would hardly find what good this game is as a tower difference.

No fun to explore a map. Each map is designed to use traps in specific places, like even if the map is complicatedly huge, the best strategy is always choosing a small space to set accurate traps against enemies.

Most traps are useless or used for a very specific case especially in the hard difficulty. So in the later game, most people use a similar type of traps/weapons unless they follow some own challenging rule.

So since you had limited choices of your traps and areas, the fight is also critically boring. Early waves are fine, you still have to get a point to develop your traps gradually. However after 5 waves, setting your traps are most likely done and still you have over 5 waves to complete a level which means you just attack enemies or watch your traps in the same way over and over in the rest of waves because enemies are also same. This is painfully boring especially in the later game.

$10 is not expensive but also you have a choice to use your $10 in another way. No need to play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198371476698', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1035, 'last_played': 1662915836}
review:
[b]Итак, орки пляшут под дамочкину штуковину, которая заставляет их плясать... 
Но и у меня они попляшут, и этот танец с моим посохом станет для них последним![/b]

[i]*Фраза главного героя, которая меня крайне повеселила[/i] :)

[h1]Об игре[/h1]
Так что перед нами?
Эта игра представляет собой крайне любопытную смесь тавердефенса и нарезку орков от третьего лица. В арсенале для этого у главного героя имеется больше количество ловушек, магия, арбалет / посох, хотя последний больше похож на меч. Конечно, не всё доступно с самого начала, но нужно признать, что это было сделано для того, чтобы игрок чувствовал рост! - что... приемлимо :)
Играется весьма динамично, особенно на высоком уровне сложности, когда нет времени на подумать, что, кстати, не очень любит делать главный герой, но мы это любезно делаем за него :)
На этой ноте перейду к сюжету.

[h1]Сюжет[/h1]
Эта история о не очень умном ученике, которому приходится продолжать дело своего учителя, а именно: искоренять орков любыми способами и не давать им проникнуть в портал. Любопытно, что "Хранители" за защиту получают? Еду, проживание? :)
Увы, но эти вопросы так и останутся без ответа. 
В целом история интересненькая, хотя вообще не глубокая и не проработанная в плане какого-то прям ЛОРА. Она проста как пять пальцев. 
Главная цель сюжета - разбавлять процесс аннигиляции недругов. С чем он отлично справляется. Без него игровой процесс стал бы пресноватым. Тем более с некоторых диалогов можно улыбнуться. И очень жаль, что их в игре не так много :)

[h1]О недостатках[/h1]
Минус для меня был лишь один: Очень тихие диалоги. 
Получается разговоров и так кот наплакал, так еще они заглушаются боевой музыкой, которая весьма неплоха, и шумом нарезки или прожарки мясца.
И единственное решение тут, это убирать музыку в ноль и дополнительно прожимать "ESC" во время разговоров, чтобы хотя бы что-то разобрать.
[i] *Кстати, стоит подметить, что игра полностью переведена на русский язык, озвучка в наличии.[/i] 

[h1]Вывод[/h1]
Но не смотря на этот небольшой минус, я определенно советую попробовать данную игру. Особенно если вам нравится процесс защиты своей базы с помощью ловушек, и параллельно вручную нарезать толпы противников.

Спасибо за внимание к данному обзору :)
Хорошего дня и приятнейших игр!
И помните, орки должны умереть! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198407267502', 'num_games_owned': 628, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1663174890}
review:
[h1] Жахнуть ( так, чтоб [u]ВСЕХ[/u] снесло!!! ) - его военное ремесло!)[/h1]

Даже в 2022 году первая часть "Orcs Must die!" остаётся на удивление визуально приятной и залипательной, затягивающей игрой, которая не оставит равнодушными даже привередливых игровых гурманов) 

Геймплей - простой, "в доску свой" и предельно понятный даже для школяров из младших классов. Звук и музыка органично вписываются в геймплей и ни на секунду не дают заскучать) Игра проходится на одном дыхании, залог победы - простейшая логика ( [i]ну какой смысл строить наносящие урон ловушки рядом с пропастью, когда можно понаставить пружин и все орки толпой полетят вниз? )[/i] 

При этом присутствует полная русская локализация с весьма искромётным юмором ( [i]который я последний раз видел давным-давно пацаном в книгах Дмитрия Емца о Тане Гроттер[/i] ), а в противостоянии ОРДЫ орков и подмастерья, гордо относящего себя к АЛЬЯНСУ, без всякого труда угадывается одна большущая отсылка на серию Warcraft. Что меня, ветерана World of Warcraft с 16-летним стажем, практически сразу же заставило улыбнуться) 

Недостатки у игры есть, но они незначительные. Например нельзя перераспределить очки, которые тратишь на апгрейды ловушек ( [i]об этом сразу же предупреждают перед покупкой и за это разработчикам спасибо, но такая возможность в игре бы смотрелась весьма неплохо[/i] ). Голос героя очень часто сливается с музыкой и ты просто не разбираешь, что именно он сказал, хотя искромётными шутками товарищ сыплет направо и налево) Приходится выбирать - или музыку оставить, или шутейки послушать) 

Для игры 2011 года выпуска это более чем простительно.

Ну и цена/доступность в Steam...О чём вообще говорить? Стоит копейки ( 64 рубля ) на распродаже, а страницу игры никто закрывать до сих пор не планирует. Тот случай, когда маленькая инди-компания относится к русским людям гораздо более по-человечески, чем гиганты вроде EA или WB, закрывшие по первому же окрику клинических идиотов-русофобов доступ к своим играм.

Так что делайте выводы и спасибо Robot Entertainment за чудесную, залипательную времяубивалку) А я побежал добивать финальные уровни) Ведь не все орки ещё убиты) 

9.5 орков, улетевших со свистом в кипящую лаву, из 10 :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198042838100', 'num_games_owned': 740, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1661924813}
review:
[h1]TL;DR brand new to the series, and it's really good[/h1]
I haven't played the second or third game, and decided to start from the beginning. It's a remarkably solid game with a lot of different ways to play. It strikes the perfect balance between being able to set up a fully-automatic meat grinder and having your plans fail, forcing you into a final stand at the rift without a trap in sight. You might be tempted to skip this and go straight into the newer games, but this game is absolutely worth playing if you're looking to get into the series. I went into it assuming I'd rush through it to quickly get to the sequels, but I was blown away with how fun it was as its own experience.

[h1]The perfect challenge[/h1]
I went through the game in about 8 hours, playing leisurely and sometimes restarting levels to get a better score. I haven't played a game with the PERFECT level of challenge in a while. On the normal difficulty, you need to use a combination of traps and weapons to get high scores on each level. If you have a smooth brain like I do, you'll rely on your weapon almost as much as your traps when the orcs start getting dangerously close to the rift. One round you might not fire a single arrow because your traps are doing all the work, and the next round you could be fighting for your life because the orcs found a flaw in your plan.

[h1]An addictive gameplay loop[/h1]
You lay traps and shoot orcs to prevent them from getting to your rift. The more orcs that survive your setup and make it to the rift, the less [b]skulls[/b] you get. These [b]skulls[/b] are spent on persistent upgrades for your traps which makes it really fun to come up with an efficient solution for each level. After every level you unlock something, which is a new trap or weapon 90% of the time.

[h1]Creative freedom[/h1]
One of the best parts about the game is the amount of traps/weapons/units, and the many viable ways to play. Whether it's building a maze filled with tar that forces the orcs to slowly inch through a hall of saws and spikes, or leading an army of archers and warriors to defend a chokepoint, you really can play however you like and succeed. This is enhanced by the upgrade system because you can choose your favorite traps and make them stronger. Upgraded traps and units are noticeably better, but not enough to leave your other ones useless, so you really can experiment without being punished.

[h1]This game is very well-designed and a must play for tower defense fans[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198119807017', 'num_games_owned': 839, 'num_reviews': 640, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1661460352}
review:
[h1] Если коротко игра это tower defense с видом от третьего лица и юморным сюжетом[/h1]

👉В принципе заголовок обзора говорит об игре 90% информации. Но давайте чуть поподробнее.

👉В игре вам предстоит защищать порталы от орд орков, портал имеет определенное количество брони, жизней, пропускной способности, портальных очков - называйте как хотите. Порталов может быть несколько, точек респауна орков тоже может быть несколько. 

👉Орков кстати несколько видов, есть летающие чудища , есть орки охотники цель которых убить солдат и вас, есть орки которые разминируют ловушки, есть те которым нужен только портал. В зависимости от пропущенного орка вы теряете разное количество портальных очков, при смерти так же теряете портальные очки. 

[quote=самореклама] Добавив меня в друзья, ты получаешь неплохой контент, сойдет обзоры и адекватного человека в ленте, это одно из лучших предложений на рынке.[/quote]

👉Противостоять волнам орков вы будете использовав оружие,заклинания и ловушки. Ловушки бывают разные: настенные, потолочные, приманки, заграждения, солдаты лучники и воины, да вообще куча. Помимо этого есть прокачка на уровне, вы можете выбрать что усилить ловушки, оружие или заклинания.

👉Между уровнями нам показывают слайд шоу с историей/лором/сюжетом, сюжет прост - вы тупой маг последняя надежда человечества, а ваш учитель скоро склеит ласты.

👉Как итог игра неплохая, интересная, обладает реиграбельностью. Достаточно сложная на последних этапах даже на средней сложности. Показательный и отличный представитель своего жанра. Рекомендую.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2721158794

review: The game's a lot of fun, but also kinda gross sometimes. Nasty orcs. The game gets both easier and harder as you go on, because there will be more enemies, but you also unlock more traps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087410341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1657847741}
review:
The graphics look nice, controls straightforward and gameplay decent. Although, playing it alone feels lackluster.

The main problem is balance. Forget about close combat, because enemies deal too much damage up close. You'll find that sticking with the default crossbow and acid bottle is the best choice. You can do pretty creative things with the traps, but they all feel underpowered with how much cannon fodder slips through the cracks.

The most annoying part is the cringeworthy dance your character does at the end of each level.

The game is not my thing, but it's alright.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025317792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 6079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6079, 'last_played': 1657350924}
review:
I was going through a tough period in my life in 2021 and didn’t find pleasure in much of everything, including my enjoyment of video games that I had since I was a kid.  I’ve collected thousands of games and so never know what to play.  For some reason, I tried this—I think it’s because I liked Dungeon Defenders and so this was a single player version of it.  This idea of combining third-person shooting with strategically placing traps (note: I don’t like pure tower defense games because I don’t get to do anything) intrigued me.

This game brought back my enjoyment of gaming.  I played the first few levels and was hooked.  What enemies were there in this level?  Which traps would I select?  How would I combine them?  Where would I set up the kill box?  Which wave would I have to get to in order to earn enough points to make a kill box impenetrable?  If it wasn’t, how would I use my crossbow and spells to either hold them off or catch the stragglers?  I would try something, and it might work okay or I might lose.  The amazing thing: I DIDN’T MIND LOSING!  Every loss was another chance to change my strategy and learn something new about optimizing my strategy.  I never used a guide and beat the War Mage difficulty and felt so satisfied upon completion.

A year later, and I feel a little down again.  I remember the rush of playing this game and reinstall it—something I NEVER do because I have so many games that it’s not worth replaying.  I play it again on the Nightmare difficulty.  I die a lot.  I only occasionally barely get frustrated when I make a dumb mistake; the rest of the time, I enjoy learning what doesn’t work and why and then change my strategy next time.  After dozens of hours of gameplay, I beat nightmare mode 5-skull for all levels and even score top 1,500 in the world for some of the highest-difficulty levels (something that I usually don’t care about but am happy that I did it).  I did look up videos to see if I was missing any strategies that I’d like, and it was amazing to see someone take the level on in a completely different way and still being able to get 5 skulls, making your gameplay approach so diverse vs. one optimal strategy per se.

What an amazing game that I thoroughly enjoyed.  Love the learning process and experiment.  Enjoy the satisfaction of discovering a trap combination that makes your defenses impenetrable.  I only have one beef: the game has one bug where your crossbow shots go flying diagonally upward when your enemy is on a staircase.  It drove me nuts and cost me a few runs on the latter stages when seconds can mean the difference between success and failure.  But otherwise, it’s an amazing game that I highly recommend.  Just avoid the temptation that I succumbed to where I was up until 4am+ making sure I beat a level before I had to give up for the day and forget the enemy wave patterns I memorized for the level.  But I loved every minute of it, and games like this are what make gaming such a joy in life.  Cherish these games and these moments, as they remind you why it’s great to be alive.

Oh, one more minor beef: for the weaver upgrades, just tell us which traps the upgrades apply to.  “All physics traps” or “all piercing and cutting traps” didn’t help me—and the internet was even ambiguous about which ones they applied to.  Just tell me which traps get bonuses!

author: {'steamid': '76561198107212373', 'num_games_owned': 467, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1558894561}
review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156106597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 957, 'last_played': 1682925382}
review: Orcs Must Die! is a real gem to start off. Its a classic back in the xbox 360 generation and it holds up to this day on PC. Its simplistic and gets challenging along the way. I have to say the DLC could be better as the DLC campaign does not introduce anymore story or lore. The other trap DLC is lackluster and should have contained more items in my opinion. Even though this game is like a decade old or more, its a great start for anyone that is looking into this franchise. I recommend that you purchase the game when it is on sale. I bought the game and DLC back in summer sale of 2022. There are no bugs that I have experienced with this relic. When you download the game, it will ask you to download another piece of old software (DIRECTPLAY) for multiplayer I think but it is not vital. Its meant to be a good single-player strategy tower defense like game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092241169', 'num_games_owned': 820, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 5862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5862, 'last_played': 1656953254}
review:
Здесь перед нами трёхмерный пространственный шутер от третьего лица с элементами башенной защиты. Основное оружие - арбалет, ему ассистируют кольца для применения магии (огня, льда, кислоты, ветра). Фауна в игре довольна разнообразна - 12 видов врагов, среди них бегунки, стрелки, камикадзе (стремятся подорвать либо героя, либо баррикады), летуны, толстяки. Ловушек тоже немало, все различаются по типу установки (на стены, на потолки, напольные) и действию (замедлялки, стрелялки, сжигалки, жернова, толкалки, приманки, стражники и т.д.). На некоторых картах есть свои ловушки - баллисты, брёвна над лестницами, котлы с кислотой или лавой.

В игре 24 полностью независимые карты (и 5 в дополнении). Имеется сюжет, представленный видеороликами на некоторых картах и репликами героя (и антагонистки). Карты не очень долгие (по 4-12 волн врагов), на начальных уровнях сложности перед первой и после некоторых волн даётся пауза, чтобы изучить карту и спокойно расставить ловушки (убирать их можно только между волнами), на Ночном кошмаре пауз нет. С учётом трудности позиционирования ловушек и тряски камеры, а также дикой беготни героем, это действительно становится кошмаром.

Все ловушки дорогие (про кудрявые лабиринты можно забыть), барьеры ещё и разрушаемые. Из-за этого (а также недостатка мест под ловушки на некоторых картах и возможного множества входов для врагов) герою как правило приходится козликом носиться по всей карте, где-то расставляя ловушки по мере накопления монет, а где-то самому уничтожая врагов из арбалета и магией.

Графика в игре вполне приличная (единственное, не умеет в окно), этому помогает мультяшность. Текст и реплики полностью локализованы. В целом игра до сих пор [b]весьма неплоха[/b], но большим минусом является как отсутствие энциклопедии врагов и ловушек, так и полное отсутствие информации о распределении врагов по волнам и входам на карте, без чего невозможно планировать размещение ловушек.

PS: У игры есть продолжение - OMD2 ([url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198092241169/recommended/201790/]мой обзор[/url]).

author: {'steamid': '76561198018708499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 16696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16680, 'last_played': 1656578014}
review:
I just now realise I've never written a review for this awesome game, so let's fix that.

Orcs Must Die! is a simple game about killing orcs and killing lots of them. The game plays like a third-person shooter with tower defence mechanics that allows you to place different kinds of traps that will assist you in the killing of orcs. Whether you prefer to play more actively and shoot down as many orcs yourself, or invent trap combinations that will do most of the heavy lifting for you is up to you, and there is a good variety of weapons and traps to choose from to experiment with.

Despite being over 10 years old at this point, Orcs Must Die! holds up extremely well, visually, thanks to its cartoony aesthetic. The music, sounds and voice acting is all well done and adds greatly to the overall experience. My only complaints with this game would probably come from some missing settings I would have liked to see, such a windowed fullscreen mode and a separate audio slider for voices amongst some other things. There are also some quality of life features missing that have been implemented in the later entries, but none of these are dealbreakers in any way to me. In my opinion, the first Orcs Must Die! is a timeless classic and I'd still consider it the best game in the series, at least if you care more about the single-player experience. If you're looking to play this with a friend, this is not the game for you. Go get OMD2 or 3 instead, in that case.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166311646', 'num_games_owned': 1013, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1655712365}
review:
[quote=Боевой маг] Давайте проанализируем мои ошибки... Ха-ха, шутка, их нет! [/quote]
Заходя в эту игру впервые, я ожидал что мы реально будем строить башни или как то проводить лабиринты, по коротым и будем пускать врагов, однако в игре вместо стандартных башен присутствуют ловушки. В целом роль то они выполняют одинаковую, но все же это было немного необычно.
[h1] [i] Геймплей [/i] [/h1]
По сути геймплей этой игры сравним практически с любой другой игрой этого жанра: вы ставите ловушки, проходите уровень и в конце получаете награду в виде новой ловушки. Однако эта игра отличается тем, что здесь мы тоже принимаем участие в геноциде орков. По ходу игры мы будем открывать не только ловушки, но и новые заклинания для нашего мага, что в целом приятно для игрока, ведь вы можете выбрать для себя соответствующий билд: играть как полноценный маг или все же опираться на ловушки.
[h1] [i] Сюжет [/i] [/h1]
Ну...тут и сказать особо нечего. По сути нам рассказывают про глупого ученика, которому выпала честь покончить с орками, закрыв на своем пути все порталы. В целом наш гг отвешает пару шуточек в сторону своего учителя или врагов, да и все на этом. Заморачиваться с этим явно не стали.
[h1] [i] Саундтрек [/i] [/h1]
Как бы ни странно это не звучало, но в этой игре присутствует неплохой саундтрек в некоторых уровнях, который неплохо так поднимает боевой дух к прохождению локации. Прям все мелодии назвать качественными нельзя, но все же парочка из них реально годная для игры подобного плана.
[h1] От себя [/h1]
В целом это отличная игра в своем жанре за довольно скромный ценник. Уровней в игре вам хватит примерно на 9-10 часов, а при желании пройти ее на более сложном уровне или вовсе на максимальный результат, то очевидно больше.
Однако здесь и кроется один из главных минусов игры - в ней отсутствует кооперативный режим. Да игра сделана качественно, но желание пройти ее до конца отпадает чуть ли не на половине игры, ведь с другом такой формат заходит явно лучше. 
В любом случае рекомендую, игра вышла хорошей и без технических проблем.

author: {'steamid': '76561199112597923', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 1181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1181, 'last_played': 1655639020}
review:
Забавный юмор, еще более забавные орки и море веселья!
Очень увлекательная и затягивающая игра на пару десятков часов. Суть: не дать толпе орков дойти до портала, своего рода TowerDefence от третьего лица. Для борьбы с ордой у вас имеется арбалет, меч, разные заклинания и КУЧА ЛОВУШЕК. Ловушки можно комбинировать как между собой, так и с вашими заклинаниями. Отдельного упоминания стоят баррикады, которые блокируют проход оркам и позволяют задавать им маршрут.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203153899', 'num_games_owned': 1282, 'num_reviews': 290, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1655082904}
review:
武器と罠を使ってリフトという拠点をオークたちから守るTPS & TD ゲーム

刻命館シリーズを思い出すけどそれよりももっとアクティブに直接敵を攻撃しに行けるのが楽しい。ステージが進めば武器も罠の種類も豊富になっていくので配置を考えるのもワクワクする

ステージに出てくる敵の種類は開始前にわかるし、置いたトラップを回収して配置しなおせたり、プレイヤーの体力が尽きてもコストを払って復活できるしで難しさはあるけどそれ以上にゲームをクリアしてもらおうという作り方が凄く気持ちいゲームだった。

どうしてもクリアできない面があっても難易度を下げてクリアすることで、罠のアップグレードを出来るようになるまで通常難易度を後回しにすることもできるのでカジュアルに遊ぶことも出来るし、クリア後は上位の難易度に挑んだり、ノーミスクリアやハイスコアを目指してフレンド同士のランキングを競うことも出来るのでやり込むことも可能

凄く面白いのにセールで買うと200円程度なのでとんでもなくコスパも良い。おススメのゲーム

author: {'steamid': '76561197992880692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1655999789}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is an action third person shooter, tower defense hybrid. You use spells, weapons and traps to kill hordes of orcs as they make their way to your rift.

Unfortunately for this game, it has been all but overshadowed by its sequel Orcs Must Die! 2. Seriously, every mistake or misstep they make in this game they fix and do better in the next. There is almost no reason to get this game, just get 2. That said, on its own merits, its still a really fun and frantic game to play.

The core gameplay is you start a map that has one or more paths to one or more rifts. Creatures that range from basic orcs, to fast kobolds, to tanky ogres comes out in waves heading to the rift and you must stop them. While you do build a variety of traps, and can even eventually start determining their path by building barricades, there is more of a focus on twitchy, frantic orc killing with a variety of weapons and spells. Maps getting increasingly difficult, usually with you needing to monitor multiple paths, and there is a little bit of a story told in some cutscenes and dialogue. As you go along you unlock more spells, weapons and traps to use and can upgrade them as well.

This game really has a dynamite premise. It is immense fun to just mow down the hordes, and it is oh, so satisfying to watch a synergy of your devices really work and do their thing. I cannot overstate how good the core of this game is, they really hit on something here.  The game is even pretty funny at times with its doofus main protagonist who just lives for orc killing.

I have a lot of nitpicks though. There is only one real tileset for maps, so aesthetically they all look the same. There is not a huge amount of enemy variety, just enough. The enemy pathing does not function very well. I experienced a lot of buggy enemy animations. There are not many game modes. The weaver upgrade system is weak. The meta progression of skulls can't be refunded to try different things. The only women in the game are the 3 weavers who are overtly sexualized and they somehow messed up something in their recording their voices (there is also technically the bad guy who is also sexualized...). 

And all of these things are either fixed or at least improved in the sequel. Like literally every single negative thing I have to say about this game, every criticism, they address it. 

So this is basically an advertising for Orcs Must Die! 2. Go buy that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966597554', 'num_games_owned': 724, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 1191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1191, 'last_played': 1653266911}
review:
Orcs must die 1 is a fun tower defense/action hybrid.

This game acts as a map pack for the second game, while also having some different game mechanics and some unique maps that weren't ported over to the second. While lacking in some various but small quality of life improvements compared to the second game I'd say the gameplay is roughly the at a similar polish level as the second game.

It's a good time, it feels fun to play and experiment with different trap combinations to make the ultimate self sufficient meatorizor. Would reccomend playing with a controller, as with the PC version the repeating crossbow is not actually a repeating crossbow. For whatever reason this carries forward to the second game so yay RSI.

Certainly worth while grabbing on a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961169351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1915, 'last_played': 1652548848}
review:
Just finished Nightmare mode, and I gotta say I still love this game, and while I haven't tried OMD3, the sequel to this OMD2 just does not give the same satisfaction as the original. I come back to this game to feel out what a great Tower Defense Game is rly all about: Building a kill box and seeing what could actually possibly survive it, and then making a better kill box to eliminate the remainder.

If i had to guess what gives this one so much more magic compared to the sequel... I just think that the sequels rely too heavily on simply making the levels bigger or longer. Instead of figuring out how to best use the features of the room/building to put traps/towers on to defend, the Sequel has you filling too much of the damage with your own character's attacks. And when you design more of the levels to be longer, the design starts to be more about making more DPS per area as opposed to solving a room's limitations by using different traps. I.e. There's no walls, so you have to rely on ceiling and floor traps, or there's not much flat ground for floor traps, so you have to use ceiling traps. And don't get me wrong, the sequel has a little of that, but every trap feels so much weaker and that you have to add way more traps and add more character damage to compensate. The 1st game has levels designed like puzzles to be solved approximately with traps, with some room for error that you can cover with weapons, and the 2nd game feels like needing to cram as much damage on the field to kill incoming enemies, and if you don't use your weapons and weapon abilities everytime, you will lose.

Orcs Must Die! (the original) makes you feel powerful when you place your traps, and the second game, traps feel so weak.

I sincerely hope that the team behind these games changes their design philosophy. I want to change the room to solve a tower defense puzzle, not figure out how to best use my character's attack abilities to pair with the towers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034043263', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1662969965}
review:
Из плюсов:
*Количество ловушек - их не много, но и не мало, как по мне - просто идеально
*В игре есть юмор - не везде, да и звезд с неба не хватает
*Игра помогает отвлечься от рутины и некоторых проблем
*Приятная глазу графика и атмосфера
*Хорошее музыкальное сопровождение
*Получаешь удовольствие от игры в целом
*Разнообразные мобы

Из минусов:
*Некоторые фразы ГГ, за которые стыдно почему то именно тебе
*Голос ГГ звучит с заметной тупизной, чем меня подбешивал

Итог:
Веселое и незатейливое рубилово, которое не к чему не обязывает. В меру простое и в меру сложное, не растянутое на много много часов чего то монотонного и однообразного. Как бы ты не проходил эту игру - ты все равно будешь проходить каждый уровень как то чуть иначе, чем раньше.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002716193', 'num_games_owned': 716, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 1877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1877, 'last_played': 1651424996}
review:
*Warning: spoilers*

So much fun! 

Orcs Must Die! is a fun game full of action, tension, a great soundtrack, and a good sense of humour. On its own it is just a tower defence game with twenty-four levels where you fight off waves of bloodthirsty orcs and ogres. What makes it unique for me at least, is the real time action in which you can place your traps at any time, upgrade your skills, fight off orcs hand to hand and quickly navigating through the map all at once, unlike other tower defence games.

Orcs Must Die! has a little story which is good enough for such a simple game and is filled with lots of jokes and dry humour. It does not take itself too seriously and I like that.

Graphicly this game is not that amazing, but it does not need to. Like I mentioned before, the soundtrack is great. It really helps when playing and does add that glorious feeling to the battles. It is one of the better soundtracks I heard in a while.

The controls and mechanics for placing traps are smooth and work perfectly, this might be expected but there are lots of games where the controls ruin the game for you, luckily this is not the case here.

As much fun as this game was, the only problem I had with it, was that it was too easy. Once you master a specific strategy (like placing tar pits, grinders, and barricades) you can practically beat any level without many problems using this same strategy.

Overall, I would recommend Orcs Must Die! It is certainly worth a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063019144', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 993, 'last_played': 1649199196}
review:
На несколько веселых вечеров эта игра способно завлечь своей идейной простотой и широтой возможностей. Это 3D Tower Defense где нам нужно не допустить доставку пачек орков из точки А в точку Б, при этом в наш арсенал входят не только вариативные ловушки, но и личные артефакты боевого мага, которые позволяют разбираться с серьезными противниками или наносить массивный урон по толпищу клыкатых ребят. Боевая система тут выполнена плохо, особенно что касается стрельбы и регистрации попадания, но зато нету балансного перевеса в сторону персональных навыков игрока, как во второй части. Прокачка персонажа отсутствует, но есть система разнообразных бафов, которые можно покупать для отдельных уровней, такие улучшения незначительны, но если подбирать под конкретный билд нужные ловушки, тогда комбинации будут наиболее смертоносными. 

Дизайн уровней незамысловатый и простой, за исключением парочки последних в кампании, где мне пришлось попотеть, поскольку они требуют от игрока четких алгоритмов действий в короткий период времени. На уровнях разбросаны дополнительные фоновые ловушки, а кол-во извилистых путей хорошо работает на многозадачность и распределения ловушечных ресурсов. Некоторые уровни имеют множество ступенек без возможности установки засад, поэтому на помощь приходят паладины и лучники, которых можно хорошенько забафать. Стилистика легка́ для глаза и имеет вид около мультяшности, от этого мне так приятно было рассматривать здешние декорации, ведь в память возвращались воспоминания моего первого знакомства с этой франшизой на релизе, а это было уже больше 10 лет назад. 

Тогда я поверхностно воспринимал эту игру как потешную стрелялку, сейчас же с условием высокой сложности и при креативном подходе к выстраиванию ловушек - я смог для себя понять чем прекрасен жанр башенной защиты, а именно: просчитыванием маршрута противника, его корректировка и создание парочки страховочных ловушек и отходных путей. Благо разработчики "удобно" оставили игроку стены нужно размера, достаточно низкий потолок в проходе и пропасть в лаву/кислоту, соответственно мне оставалось лишь изучить карту, уловить послание разрабов и собрать из необходимых ловушек этот пазл. Если раньше считал баррикады дорогостоящим мусором, который все равно разрушат, то сейчас я смог понять их предназначение, а именно перенаправление толп орков в нужном направлении. Вещь очевидная, но для меня стала откровением и изменила мой подход к выстраиванию ловушек: теперь у меня была возможность не только выстраивать змееподобные проходы искусственно удлиняя путь орков, а создавать целые конструкции состоящие из системы ловушек, например, настенная перемалывающая ловушка очень могущественная, но имеет небольшой радиус действия - баррикады помогают его сократить, а с замедляющим маслом на полу эта комбинация будет самой смертоносной. В игре мало очевидно синергирующих ловушек, помимо смолы и огня я так и не заметил. 

С удовольствием провел в ней время, покупать лучше со всеми дополнениями, они дают много сильных артефактов и парочку новых незатейливых уровней, благо по скидке игра отдается практически за бесценок.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174621953', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1650459926}
review:
I give Orcs Must Die an Old-School Game/10
Orcs Must Die is simple, and that's a good thing. It's rather short compared to modern day games, but that's because of the replay value in getting 5 Skulls [Stars] in every level and using them for upgrades. Also, the writing is great, I love it.
Though when I give this game an Old-School Game/10 I also mean that in the game has aged somewhat. Like, it doesn't have rebinding and subtitles.
Orcs Must Die is like an Old-School Game you'd find on the SNES, it's short, simple fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116113043', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1648907148}
review:
Orcs Must Die! ist wie sein Nachfolger ein zweischneidiges Schwert.
Zunächst mal muss ich sagen, dass mir hier das Waffenhandling deutlich besser gefällt als im Nachfolger. Kopfschüsse sind etwas einfacher und das Feedback der einzelnen Waffen lässt nicht noch fast eine Sekunde auf sich warten.
Aber alles andere ist leider ebenso schlecht, wenn nicht sogar schlechter als in Teil 2.
Die ersten Level sind Kindergarten. Sie sind zu einfach und dadurch fast schon langweilig. Es kommt nie ein Siegesgefühl auf, weil das alles so geschenkt ist. Die Level im zweiten Akt sind da besser, mehrere Wege für die Orks und mehr das Gefühl, dass man gerade etwas geschafft hat. Allerdings zieht der Schwierigkeitsgrad von einem Moment auf den nächsten so stark an, dass es unverhältnismäßig wirkt. Man wird vollgeklatscht mit Ogern, die mehr aushalten als 300 Orks zusammen und die Level sind so designed, dass du am Anfang nichts anderes kannst, als zu verlieren. Nach etlichen Versuchen klappt es dann, aber es ist eher eine Hin und Her Hetzerei als ein spaßiges Erlebnis.
Nachdem ich mich dann im letzten Level hunderte Male geärgert habe, weil der Überblick fehlte und weil Gegner viel zu stark sind, habe ich dann doch noch den Nightmare-Mode ausprobiert. Der ist in den ersten Leveln wieder lächerlich einfach und zieht ebenso plötzlich den Regler hoch. Und damit du noch mehr von dieser schönen Hetzerei hast, bekommst du nicht einmal Vorbereitungszeit, sondern startest INSTANT in die erste Welle, ohne dass du was aufbauen konntest. Das hat mich häufig zur Weißglut gebracht, denn so kann man einfach nicht planen und der Anfang von jedem Level wird zur Tortur.
Zusätzlich kommt hinzu, dass Gegner mehr Leben haben und man selbst weniger. Außerdem teilen sie mehr Schaden aus. Das weiß ich aber nicht durch das Spiel - sondern aus dem Wiki. Das Spiel versagt nämlich darin, genau diese Daten mitzuteilen.
Wie viel Schaden machen ich und meine Fallen? Upgrades sagen dir, dass du 33% mehr Schaden machst. Aber 33% mehr von "Keine Ahnung" ist immer noch "Keine Ahnung".
Wie viel Leben haben ich und meine Gegner? Gerade bei den größeren Gegnern wäre es sinnvoll zu wissen, wie man am besten gegen die vorgeht. Das habe ich mir alles selbst zusammengelesen, außerhalb des Spieles.
Wie viel Schaden machen meine Gegner? Bzw: Welchen Gegnern sollte ich eher ausweichen und sie aus der Ferne erledigen, statt in den Nahkampf zu gehen?
Die meiste Zeit, während ich dieses Spiel gespielt habe, habe ich geflucht, gewütet und geragequittet. Spaß hatte ich zwar auch, aber nicht genug. Der einzige Grund, weshalb ich es durchgespielt habe ist, dass ich sowas schlecht auf mir sitzen lassen kann und es beenden muss.
Noch ein Wort zur Story: Die passiert so nebenbei und man kann sich während dem Orkgemetzel gar nicht auf die Gespräche der Charaktere konzentrieren. Was aber ultra-schade ist, denn die Grundidee klingt so genial. Ich würde gerne mehr über diese beiden Welten und die magische Verbindung über die Spalte erfahren. Aber es wird mir alles vorenthalten bzw. während ich mich konzentrieren muss an den Kopf geworfen.

review:
Un jeu qui se fait un petit vieux mais quel plaisir ! Je me suis investit pour le faire à 100% ce qui demande parfois un peu de challenge. Si on est un peu habitué au Tower Defence la plupart des succès se débloquent en cours de jeu.

Si on apprécie le TD en 3D ça vaut le coup de le prendre ( en plus s'il y a une promo ...)

Bref je recommende et puis je vous laisse, je part faire les suites ~

author: {'steamid': '76561198021433778', 'num_games_owned': 1029, 'num_reviews': 3681, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1660515773}
review:
타워디펜스를 3D로 만들고 유저가 직접 조작할 수 있도록 만든 게임.
게임 컨셉도 좋고 재미있다.
만들어진지 11년이나 지난 게임인데 요즘 나오는 다른게임들과 비교해도 전혀 손색없음.
단지 플레이어가 너무 쌘게 흠. 차라리 플레이어를 조금 약하게 만들고 함정들을 더 쌔게 만들었으면 좋겠다고 생각함. 업그레이드 할 수 있는 숫자를 늘려줬으면 좋더라. 타워디펜슨데 함정이 그리 안 쌤.

[h1]가격빼면 흠 잡을 부분이 없다. 정말 잘 만든 게임.[/h1]
할인도 자주 하니 할인할때를 노려서 ㄱㄱ!

author: {'steamid': '76561198812828103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3682, 'last_played': 1657297786}
review: 兽人必须死1这款游戏我最初接触时事一个汉化盗版，当时玩的很开心，之后开始用steam就入正版了，玩法很多样，很多武器和陷阱可以供玩家使用，也可以利用各种各样的地形的关节自带陷阱杀伤兽人，个人觉得豺狼人比较棘手，因为它只会追杀玩家和守卫，不会像其他人一样钻进裂缝，移动速度较快且攻击带有毒，能够减速，有些困难对局的时候往往会带给你意想不到的破坏性，不过也正是这些挑战性推动着我玩下去，周而复始挑战着某些困难关卡，争取拿到全五个骷髅头，算是比较肝，很遗憾没有办法和其他玩家联机玩，如果可以联机，可玩度会进一步增加，总体好评，非常推荐。

author: {'steamid': '76561198153216871', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 1096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1096, 'last_played': 1646035886}
review:
Ожидал получить средне-хорошую игру, а на деле окунулся в шедевральное и максимально балдежное крошилово орков

Буквально на днях играл в Dungeon Defenders, игру по концепции максимально схожую с OMD!, и даже вышедшую не то что в один год и месяц, а буквально с разницей в неделю

Так вот Орки это та же игра, только если выкинуть все ненужное и раздражающее дрочево из DD, и попутно залить это дело спидами, бодрым геймплеем, а также ненапряжной и веселой атмосферой

Самый крутой момент в игре наступает тогда, когда игроку открываются несколько небольших древ прокачки во время уровней, которые позволяют сфокусироваться на определенном стиле игры
Так вот я вам советую брать Элементальную ветку, которая превращает игру в максимально безбашенный и мясной слэшер - ты ставишь замедляющие ловушки, собираешь орков в одну пачку, кидаешь им под ноги огненную стену, переключаешься на посох И НАЧИНАЕШЬ КРОМСАТЬ

При этом игра не сказать что слишком сложная или комплексная, но в ней достаточно глубины чтобы проворачивать интересные и эффективные комбинации (например как ту, что я описал выше)

Итог - крайне советую, пускай и не на высшую позицию, но OMD! уверенно занимает место в списке моих любимых игр
Надеюсь сиквел не подкачает

author: {'steamid': '76561199055204376', 'num_games_owned': 1514, 'num_reviews': 635, 'playtime_forever': 1242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1646312510}
review:
It really pains me to say this but I can't recommend the game. The first few levels are fun but they are also ridiculously easy and you can't really get a sense of accomplishment. A few levels are challenging and a few are so increadlibly hard that they are no fun, especially when you want to get 5 skulls (no deaths, no enemies got through, make it in time). I can't get 5 skulls in the final level no matter how many times I try/ different strategies, etc, nothing will work. Most levels are doable with the right strategy but not the last one.
I could have looked past that but then the nightmare mode is even more frustrating. I am struggling even in the first act because not only are the enemies much harder to kill, I have less health and less money etc but I also have to fight the hardest enemies (armoured oger, 4 gnolls in one wave,...) you also have NO TIME to prepare for the enemies. 3 seconds is all you get and no breaks in between. The levels that were maybe challenging in normal are just not doable anymore.

In general the game is much harder than the second one and not in a good way. It is also less fun to play alone and you feel overwhelmed quite a lot. If you like the look of the game, get the second one, it's balanced a lot better and way more fun to play.

review:
Суть и смысл игры проста, как орк-воин: Бей орков.
С помощью большого арсенала ловушек истребить всех иноземцев не пропустив к порталу ни одну живую душу.

Впервые сыграв в компьютерном клубе, я был потрясён крутостью этой игры, на момент выхода игры это был пожалуй лучший Tower Defence в своём роде :з

Я рад что наконец-то руки дошли вспомнить былые времена ^w^

author: {'steamid': '76561198088189011', 'num_games_owned': 583, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1639772159}
review:
+ [b]Сюжет гениально прост.[/b] Он здесь не просто есть, он увлекает и заинтересовывает, а главное показывает что эта резня орков имеет смысл.
+ [b]Главный герой красавчик.[/b] Добавить нечего.
+ [b]Великолепный саундтрек.[/b] Под эти песни можно убивать не только орков но и домашку.
+ [b]Русская озвучка бесподобна.[/b] Маленький издатель Robot Entertainment не жалеют денег, чтобы их игры были озвучены на многих языках, в отличии от некоторых крупных компаний (Microsoft например) которые не заботятся даже о текстовой локализации своих игр.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106927602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2174, 'last_played': 1642036292}
review:
This game is an absolute blast! It has a lot of depth and strategy involved if you're aiming for the high scores and the top of the leaderboards but can be played casually as well for the fun and glorious chokepoint massacres of orcs! There are a lot of traps/weapons to choose from as well so you can try different strategies and see which one works the best in each case. Trap/weapon combos are really well made too. After all these years it's still as entertaining as the first day of play.
Pros:
-Low-ish PC requirements(Availability), Fun and diverse levels, Funny dialogue and many more.
Cons:
-Some settings aren't present in the game(e.g. refresh rate etc., game still runs smooth and fast though) and I also found that the lowest mouse sensitivity setting is still quite fast for my taste(for the low DPI lovers).

author: {'steamid': '76561198037651328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 7239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7239, 'last_played': 1641575716}
review:
One of my all time favorites.  Oodles of fun and lots of replay-ability.

A really innovative combination of 1st person shooter and defense system.  Well made game, with good animations, sound and variety.

You will develop your own strategy for what weapons and traps you like.  You will find out that it sometimes doesn't work and work on new layouts and strategies for new levels.  The ability to unlock new features and upgrade things means you may find something seems impossible at first, but with some grinding... a rewarding victory can be had.

review:

I tried hooking up an xbox controller, button for a spellbook doesn't work there either. Tried running the game in compatibility modes, in window mode, tried swapping keybindings with map (it opens just fine regardless of a key).
The issue isn't new and it doesn't seem to have a working solution in Steam or Reddit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061604773', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 258, 'playtime_forever': 1706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1706, 'last_played': 1530907451}
review:
O jogo é incrível, sendo um dos Tower Defense's mais divertido que já joguei, é muito boa a sensação de matar os orcs.
 Além dos mapas criativos, cada um com sua estratégia, nunca vi um jogo equilibrar tão bem entre a importância do personagem e armadilhas, um é dependente do outro. Há fases que você vai ter que deixar as armadilhas cuidando de um lado, enquanto você monitora o outro.
 Infelizmente o jogo não tem online, mas isso não deixa o jogo ruim. Com certeza você vai passar muito tempo matando os orcs e evoluindo!

review:
The game is a tower defense without the maze building. You have a lot of traps, but you'll find yourself using mostly the same ones every level. The enemies are often similar each level so the only real difference is the map. It's a kind of casual game you can play a map or two, go off and do something else, then come and play more.

Overall, quite fun if a short and lacking in story. I liked it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156036994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 1689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1689, 'last_played': 1639431327}
review:
Killing orcs is fun. That’s it. There’s no need to say anything else. Oh, you want more? Ok. [i]Orcs Must Die![/i] is a tower defence game, mixed with a decent dose of third-person shooty action. It’s relatively simple in mechanics, and doesn’t have much replayability, but it’s also crazy addicting for the 30 or so hours most will need to do everything there is to do here. So, what are you waiting for?! Go kill some orcs too!!!

[b]Cubed3 Rating:[/b]
[b]7/10[/b]
[url=http://www.cubed3.com/review/6549/1/orcs-must-die-pc.html][b]Read Full Review Here[/b][/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198017953129', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1483, 'last_played': 1639949342}
review:
Un autre die and retry. Une similihistoire qu’on a du mal à suivre : il n’y a que quelques cinématiques et les dialogues se passent au début de chaque niveau, au moment où on est occupé à préparer l’attaque et pas vraiment suivre ce qu’ils disent.

On se retrouve souvent à utiliser les mêmes pièges, surtout quand certains sont débloqués, ils deviennent incontournables. Il y en a d’autres dont je ne me suis pour le coup jamais servi. Même chose dans les arbres de compétence, l’on se retrouve à utiliser la même chose et à n’utiliser jamais certaines choses.

La montée en difficulté est selon moi mal gérée. Certains niveaux du début sont beaucoup plus durs que d’autres à la fin. Je pense particulièrement à la chambre du chaos qui est selon moi un enfer de gestion entre les deux portes complètement opposées.
L’on se retrouve en fin de compte à chercher une soluce pour certains niveaux, surtout pour les hauts niveaux tels que « cauchemar » qui sont impossibles à moins d’avoir une technique précise et millimétrique. Tout se jouant dans les premières vagues, cela se faisant tout seul ensuite avec les pièges.
On se rend compte, surtout avec les soluces, qu’il est nécessaire au final de n’utiliser que quelques types de pièges, et donc toujours les mêmes. Cela devenant donc redondant.

C’est un jeu intéressant, mais il vaudrait peut-être mieux se diriger vers les jeux suivants de la série. Celui-ci ayant peu d’intérêt, les mêmes cartes se trouvant aussi dans le 2 apparemment (pas encore testé au moment de l'évaluation).

Quelques bugs sont à noter de mon côté : Impossibilité de modifier le son Windows lorsque je suis sur le jeu, je dois en sortir pour modifier le niveau et retourner sur le jeu ensuite. Quelques freezes à noter également, surtout quand il y a beaucoup d’ennemies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198308285722', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 836, 'last_played': 1639667431}
review: This game is a hidden gem. Solid single-player game that should give you about 10+ hours of great gameplay. Quite a lot of replay value (fun but not too grindy achievements) and gives you a good amount of challenge even at the easiest setting. Not a lot going on story wise but it's not bothersome at all. 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043867422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1707604109}
review: The classicness of this game for us pc gamers is comparable to Crash Bandicoot for consoles users. It has a graphical style that has aged well, the gamplay is excellent. Hurry and grab this gem!

author: {'steamid': '76561199071024808', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 3016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3016, 'last_played': 1639476758}
review:
Si eres de los que gusta poner trampas y esperar a que las ratas caigan. Este es tu juego. Aquí tendrás trampas de todo tipo, solo estarás limitado por el espacio que tengas para ponerlas y tu imaginación para acomodarlas.
Gráficamente el juego es sencillo, es básico y suficiente para el tipo de juego que es. El diseño artístico se ve reflejado en el aspecto caricaturesco de sus personajes. Esto también sirve para darle cierto carisma al entorno, personajes e incluso trampas.
Conforme progreses en el juego adquirirás mas trampas y aparecerán nuevos enemigos. Los escenarios podrán ser mas sencillos o mas complejos. 
La historia también es bastante simple y es contada de una forma graciosa por un difunto personaje y la poca fe que este le tiene al protagonista del juego. Por desgracia, solo cuenta con 3 episodios y todos estos con imágenes y relatos. No hay ninguna cinemática en este juego. Pero créeme que ni te importará si es que el juego logró engancharte.
En cuanto a la dificultad pues es bastante relativa, me explico, evidentemente los primeros niveles serán los más accesibles. Es normal que la dificultad incremente poco a poco, sin embargo,  depende del sistema de trampas que utilices para pasar los niveles para determinar lo que la dificultad realmente supondrá para ti. Depende mucho de la imaginación que tengas para acomodarlas y sacarles el máximo beneficio. Es ahí donde esta la gracia de este juego y lo que realmente puede llegar a ser muy adictivo.
Y si despúes de habertelo completado todo aun no fue suficiente, tienes el modo pesadilla donde pondrás a prueba tu talento para armar tus sistemas de trampas con casi nada de tiempo para ponerlas y con ventajas para los enemigos.

Me divertí mucho armando las trampas y ver como los orcos morían de todas las formas posibles de acuerdo a los sistemas de trampas que cree. Es netamente satisfactorio. 
Los comentarios del protagonista,  las conversaciones de este con la antagonista, y los comentarios de los orcos, añaden su pequeña cuota de gracia.
El precio en oferta por todo el pack completo es un regalo. Si no me equivoco, al menos de momento hay una demo disponible para sacar todas las dudas.
Lo recomiendo, es un juego simple y en su simpleza logro tener cierta complejidad que me cautivó. No espero menos de la segunda parte, pronto la probaré.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273119412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1639433349}
review: Çerezlik niyetine aldığım oyun hırs yaptırarak 10 saatte bitirtti kendisini.İkinci oyununu ilk fırsatta alacağım.Gittikçe karmaşıklaşan haritalar,goblinlerin yanı sıra devler,alev yarasalarına karşı sürekli genişleyen bir eşya envanteriniz var ve farklı kombinasyonlarla sürekli yeni kombolar geliştiriyorsunuz.Bunun karışıklığının yanı sıra oyun sürekli kendisini geliştirdiği için oyuna başlamadan 4 5 dakika haritayı gezip nerede nasıl tuzaklar kuracağınızı düşünüyorsunuz.Bilek olarak çok efor sarfetmesenizde bulmaca misali taktik düşünmeyi çok sevdim.Kesinlikle tavsiye ederim.

review: Overall great and tough game. There are some notable bugs with some places with the maps and some traps won't go where you think they should. So spend a bit of time going through with traps and test them out where they can and can't go but if you don't place the trap then you won't be locked into the setup as you can't access the book again even if you pick back up all the traps. Kinda stupid on that bit. Also if you do need help you can look up help guides on YT but do keep in mind that most of them are old and before some patches so some things won't work like they show.

*The Good

-Gameplay

*The bad
-Some mobs pathing get stuck in wall making impossible to end the mission having to retart

the game is a solid 8/10,I don't know what I would more out of the game to be a 10/10 but it still holds up and is a totally satisfying play

author: {'steamid': '76561198300183341', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 1070, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1070, 'last_played': 1638453407}
review:
罠で敵を倒すゲームですが、それが出来るのは金が貯まって防衛拠点を作れてから。それまでは自分が動き回って敵を倒す仕様です。金や時間に余裕が無いので色々な解決法と言ったものは無く、効率的な罠の設置が求められます。しかも最初以外は守りにくいマップなので余計に苦労します。難易度を上げると1度の失敗で総崩れするので、へこたれない精神が必要です。

　最初のプロフィール作りにはマウスが必要。動きを鈍らせる罠と攻撃用の罠を組み合わせるのが基本となります。強化する罠を間違わない様に。

author: {'steamid': '76561198303014364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1064, 'last_played': 1624889084}
review: #5：这是我玩过的最欢乐的塔防游戏！强烈推荐！早些时间在集中看一些塔防游戏，比较下来这款游戏应该算是翘楚了！10年前的游戏哦，可见好的玩法是永远不过时的。简单说三点：1、陷井的种类较多，可以搭配使用，甚至可以组成Combo，这个是非常出彩的地方；2、主角的射击爽快感非常不错，塔防主玩法中加入了些许动作元素，让这款游戏的节奏瞬间紧张起来，是一个很好的混搭；3、若能够再加入一些RPG元素，游戏的可玩性可能会更深一些。

author: {'steamid': '76561198079183831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 977, 'last_played': 1452015827}
review:
Loved this game. It combined the concept of tower defense with 3rd person shooters making you strike a balance between fighting and making good defense management. It has nice music, playful dialogue/themes and the visuals are appropriately cartoony. I liked the second game more since it expanded upon many aspects of the first one, but this is nevertheless a very strong start to the franchise.
I recently played 3 and got mildly disappointed, but also had low expectations knowing it was a Stadia exclusive before releasing to PC.
Also, I watched Sips play it back in like 2013 and that's why I got it back then.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977222008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3564, 'last_played': 1700611067}
review: Remember playing through the first mission or two 10 years back and had the game on my wish list.  Cruising through the Steam Store I saw Orcs Must Die 3 and thought, "Damn...don't even remember getting to number 2."  Bought 1 and 2 on sale and just finished playing through 1.  Couldn't stop playing.  60 hours later, all missions completed on both regular and nightmare and I have to say it was the most fun I've had playing a game in a while.  Looking forward to starting up the 2nd and then, likely, will move on to the recent 3.  Definitely worth the purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561199156895515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1637523201}
review:
Excelente juego, muy entretenido y frenetico.
Es un tower defence, pero con toques de shotter y estrategia. Debes colocar trampas y matar invasores  cada vez mas dificiles y con habilidades nuevas, asi tambien vas consiguiendo nuevos poderes y defensas para ayudarte. 
Tiene bastantes niveles y su apartado grafico es bastante bueno.

Actualmente esta en oferta y por lo recomiendo al 100 por el precio que tiene

author: {'steamid': '76561198052438715', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1637532505}
review: Я не люблю tower defence, не люблю мультяшную графику с нарочитой несерьёзностью(вот откуда ноги у фортнайта растут), не люблю бессмысленное насилие. Но эта игра шедевральна. Ведь где ещё можно почувствовать себя архитектором орочьего холокоста? Оценить обстановку, спланировать оборону, расставить ловушки - и пить чай с булками пока орки без вмешательства игрока перемалываются в фарш. Божественно.

review: Rewarding, entertaining, and humorous, Orcs Must Die is a fun twist on tower strategy by adding in an action role-playing element. It's addicting without being overly time consuming to advance and unlock more traps and powers, adding a lot of replay value for when you do unlock everything. The weaver functions add extra dimensions and possibilities. I highly recommend this game and if you're already interested in the series definitely play this one first!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025102926', 'num_games_owned': 1728, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1634587688}
review:
Well, for starters -- I didn't finish the game, not even close. It's just too chaotic and difficult.

However, what I've seen wasn't bad at all; it's just not my game. You're placing traps to prevent the orcs from reaching the portals; however, since you don't have the resources to just cover the level with traps, you also have to get your own hands dirty. Later on, when you get more entrance points, more exit portals, and the levels don't allow you to funnel all orcs into a single kill zone, the over-reliance on combat is what usually brought me down, along with not enough real breaks to really focus on your trap placement. For example, taking down an Ogre or Hunter can take quite some time, and you're not doing anything else while you deal with them.

Still, if you like that kind of game, I'm pretty sure this qualifies as a good one.

No story either, and the game itself doesn't explain anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058442015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1633479358}
review:
Reviewed early in my playthrough but this is a Ronseal type of game - it delivers exactly what it promises to deliver.  Neatly combining FPS and tower defence you set up your defences, unleash the Orcs and try and kill them all before they reach their target.  And then - more Orcs and monsters, more defences, upgrades.  Fast, frantic fun.  Probably best on a PC with a replaceable keyboard than a laptop.

S.x.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075847445', 'num_games_owned': 1063, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1691528299}
review:
The first Orcs must die unlike the sequels is a single player only game which is very short.


Still serve as a very good entry in the orcs must die universe , traps are unlocked by beating each levels , visually this game aged pretty well with it's well done style.

Orcs must die 1 is probably the most balanced of the 3 Orcs must die games when it's come to solo play , it's also have less grinds then 2 and 3. So if all you want is a game you can quickly be done with in a weekend then yeah you might like this one more then the others.

the story is simple enough that you won't feel lost even if you start with 2.

听说是非常赞的游戏，可惜没法体验。

author: {'steamid': '76561198010203905', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2647, 'last_played': 1632340048}
review:
I revisited this game after being really busy for 10 years and it is a very fun game with enjoyable humor in the story line with some good gameplay mechanics, It is very satisfying to watch your death traps eat waves of foes, and still offers a good challenge if you are looking for it.

PROS:
-The story is fun for what is a pretty simple premise
-Three appropriately scaled difficulty settings for relaxed, regular and hard play
-Good variety of traps
-Decent weapons that make you feel powerful
-interesting levels that make you try different trap combos 
-watching others play online there is no one right way to beat a level
-DLC not required to win, and it does not cheese the game

Cons
-Mouse sensitivity settings are bonkers, I moved my hand a millimeter and my character did a 720, I had to put it on minimum settings and adjust my computers mouse setting as well
-Hidden timer, to get 5 skulls (the best score) on any level you have to beat is without letting any orcs through, and under a certain amount of time. only way to see the par time, is to complete the level and then look at your stats to see how much you missed it by.
-Overlapping audio on Nightmare mode, Your character will call out important things in a level such as beginnings of a wave, and he will give exposition at the start of the game. there is no downtime in nightmare, leading to his lore and info overlapping to make sound garbage
-placement glitches, sometimes you will try and replace a trap and the space will be occupied even when it isn't, making your perfect deathtrap asymmetrical

My level of experience with this game:
I beat the game without DLC items on the regular and Nightmare difficulties and 100% the game. I used no cheats or exploits. I did look online to see how other people set up traps for harder levels and altered my strategies based on what I liked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143793523', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 804, 'last_played': 1650750685}
review:
Bom jogo, mas extremamente irritante, bem dificil (sem ser no apprentice) e demorado , recomendo pra quem tem paciencia kkk


Dicas (Coisas que eu fiz pra vencer mapas no modo normal):

Melhores armas:
- Vampiric Gauntlets e Bladestaff
Melhores "Armadilhas":
- Barricade, Tar Trap e Push Trap
Melhores Armadilhas (Dano):
- Spike Trap e Floor Scorcher

Minha estratégia:
- Antes de começar o jogo sempre escolha a Steel Weaver..
- Obrigue os inimigos a passarem por um espaço de um bloco só com as Barricades e abuse disso com as armadilhas de dano e Tar Traps.
- Caso os inimigos estejam invadido a tua base, fique encostado no portal e utilize as Vampiric Gauntlets, você vai conseguir recarregar ela muito rapido e sem perder toda a sua vida, por conta do portal.
- Se tiver um espaço de três blocos com duas paredes dos lados, coloque uma push trap em cada parede, isso vai prender os inimigos por um bom tempo e vai ficar jogando eles pros lados, além de dar dano, e recomendo tambem botar armadilhas de dano no chão, obviamente, entre as duas push traps e em volta, com barricades e tar traps pra realmente dificultar a passagem da maioria dos inimigos, fazendo isso chega um momento que fica impossivel de qualquer coisa passar, principalmente se você liberou na weaver o upgrade que faz os monstros grandes serem empurrados e lançados tambem.
- Em certas fases com multiplos spawns, você consegue bloquear a maioria dos caminhos com as Barricades, obrigando todos os inimigos a passarem por um lugar só.
- É muito facil derrotar os monstros grandes com a Bladestaff, só ficar rodando em volta deles e atacando, com cuidado pra não tomar stun, se a fase tiver aquela crossbow gigante q tu aperta E pra usar, use ela pra derrotar os monstros grandes se eles tiverem sobrevivendo suas traps.
- Use uma porrada de arqueiros se sobrar dinheiro, eles ajudam muito, principalmente contra os bichos voadores, depois com o upgrade da weaver fica muito foda ver as flechas de fogo voando.

Enfim, é um bom jogo, mas vai fazer você passar muita raiva, cuidado para não quebrar alguma coisa que esteja por perto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066259273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1631100606}
review:
I loved this game back in the day and with the new game Orcs Must Die 3 I wanted to go back and play and actually the first 2 games, however a bug has arised that prevents you from opening up your spellbook which you need to do to even play the game.  I have searched around to see if there was any fixes, but no there is not from what I can tel and there are many who are experiencing this bug and apparently have been for a few years now.

I cannot recommend this game, even though I find it fun, until this game breaking bug has been fixed and until then I highly do not recommend this game unless a community or official fix is made.

Shoot I won't even recommend the new game until the developers get off their asses and actually care to fix their older games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995299604', 'num_games_owned': 663, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1630525098}
review:
Das Trommeln gegen das Tor lässt die Balken brechen. Eine Horde zahlloser Orks und Oger rasend brüllend auf den Spalt zu, um in die Menschenwelt einzudringen. Mit Waffen und Fallen im Köcher stellt sich ihnen ein Magier in den Weg. Wird er Erfolgreich sein?
Orcs Must Die!. Ein ungewöhnlicher Hybrid aus Towerdefence und Ego-Shooter.
Ein alter, mächtige Magier schlug Orks, Oger und sonstigen Abschaum Jahrhunderte lang zurück um sie davon abzuhalten in die Menschenwelt einzudringen. Bei seiner letzten Schlacht fand er sein Ende, als er auf Orkblut ausrutschte und sich den Kopf auf einer Treppe aufschlug. Nun fällt seine Aufgabe auf seinen Lehrling wieder desen Markenzeichen seine unfassbare Naivität und Dummheit ist.
23 Festungen gilt es im Verlaufe des Spiels zu verteidigen. Am Anfang jeder Runde können wir uns ein buntes Paket aus Zaubern, Fallen und Waffe zusammenstellen um gegen die Überzahl an Feinden auftrumpfen zu können. Bodenstacheln hier, eine Barrikade da und ab geht die Luzie. Anschließend geht das Spiel fließend über in einen Action-Teil bei dem wir mit Bogen und Schwert uns in bester Rambo Manier durch die Horde arbeiten. Ist die Welle bezwungen gilt es verdiente Taler schnell in neue Strukturen zu investieren. Unterschiedliche Level Layouts und wechselnde Gegnertypen sorgen stets dafür das wir unsere Taktiken immer überdenken müssen. Was auf Karte 1 noch wunderbar klappte, geht auf Karte 2 tierisch in die Hose. Und als Kirsche auf dem Eisbecher werden die Festungen jedes Mal mit humorvollen Dialogen untermalt.
Für TD und Shooter Fans geht eine klare Empfehlung raus. Für Aufbau Spieler des gemächlichen Spieltempos eher nicht.
