review:
[h1]極力推薦！充滿黑色幽默、塔防+動作射擊的完美結合！[/h1]

這是我在Steam上第一款玩到解開全成就的遊戲 (可見這遊戲的好玩度和高中毒性...) 一二代都很棒，要說缺點的話就是一代只有單人模式無法兩人合作，二代又有點太注重兩人合作了導致有些關卡一個人玩會很困難。 另外雖然二代有包含一些一代的經典地圖，但由於兩代的升級系統不同，玩起來感受是有些不一樣的，所以第一代還是有他的價值。可以的話直接買大包的兩代+DLC都一起收藏吧！

大包連結：
http://store.steampowered.com/bundle/3092/Orcs_Must_Die_Franchise_Pack/

author: {'steamid': '76561198131924289', 'num_games_owned': 2210, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1299, 'last_played': 1407697191}
review:
Graphic── 畫面：☆☆☆
Character──角色：☆☆☆☆
Scenario──劇情：☆☆
Single player──單機：☆☆☆☆
Multiplayer──多人：─
Durable──耐玩度：☆☆☆
Feature──特殊賣點：陷阱與射擊並行之塔防+需要靈活行動的關卡。
Rating──整體給分：7.5/10

以塔防遊戲而言，Orcs Must Die!（下稱OMD）絕對稱不上傑作。
但在遊戲方式上，以陷阱為主，卻是相當有意思的。
不只是種類與功能，配置也是一大重點。
成功的布置，可以事半功倍；失敗的擺設，則能讓主角兵敗如山倒。
同一套防守法，換了地圖就不管用了。
每次換圖都必須轉換思維，OMD就是這樣的遊戲。

主角擁有近戰武器，也有十字弓。
後期也能取得各式各樣的魔法戒指，用來阻止獸人的攻勢。
搭配附加神力的購買，遊戲變得多樣化，且更加耐玩。
必須附上一筆的是，主角鮮明的個性以及活潑的勝利動作，也是一大賣點。

推薦給喜歡塔防，而且厭倦人對人互攻類型的您。
二代可以連線，如果想享受多人合作，一代或許可以PASS，
但我依舊建議入手，OMD絕對是一款讓你發現，「塔防原來也可以這麼爽快」的單機遊戲！

author: {'steamid': '76561197985881367', 'num_games_owned': 651, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1394227749}
review:
It's tough to talk about this after having played 2, but here goes.

I enjoyed this game enough when I first played it.  Some of the later levels get tough, and there are really only a few viable traps/weapon combos, but it works out.  There isn't a lot that I would say is bullshit, which is more than I can say for 2, but there also isn't much challenge, either.  Nightmare mode isn't necessarily hard, it just removes the strategy part of the game.  You're not given time to think/analyze/change placements, really.  I mean, yeah, that's hard, but it's also not really upping the difficulty in anyway.  Of course, maybe that's the best way to increase difficulty in a strategy game: removing much chance to strategize.

There is, believe it or not, a story to this game.  I wasn't really aware of it for a while, but it's totally there and you might miss it if you're not paying attention.

One quip I have is that things get redundant quickly, but whatcha gon' do.

It's an alright game, good even, if a little stale/boring/dry at times.  Like I've indicated elsewhere, though, Two is an improvement in every way, from the interface to map design.  The addition of co-op was a much needed boost to OMD as well.

If you skip this one you're not necessarily missing much.  A lot of the traps/dialogue/maps are carried over into two.  Still, this was an alright game.

review:
A lot of games try to blend tower defense and action-based gameplay. This is one of the few titles that actually pulls it off, with a quirky sense of humor to boot.

On the other hand, the game is rather short, and could use moddability and/or custom levels. Replayability is, accordingly, rather limited.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023890771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1404063077}
review: Fire casting, lightning wielding, crossbow shooting, sword swinging, trap placing goodness. You are some dude who has to protect some portal from the orcs who want to use it. You do so by killing them yourself by means of fire, ice, lightning, sword, crossbow, lifestealing, etc. You can also place traps to make an unpassable death hallway which you can sit back and watch. You even has access to archers and Knight minions to place to kill the orcs. Really Really fun! Running around killing the stuff. The game looks beautiful, the main character is funny and has nice remarks and stuff to say while your killing the orc, very funny. It is part strategy with placing the traps on walls, floors and ceilings while also being a 3rd person view 3d game where you can run around and kill stuff. I have no idea why this isn't more popular.

review: I love Tower Defense games and this definitely has a unique twist to it. Instead of towers, you set traps and fight as yourself in 3rd person. You are rewarded for comboing multiple traps and slowly unlock new traps and powers. I also like the cartoony art style, makes me not feel as bad for slaughtering hundreds of Orcs. Very fun times.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971672468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2777, 'last_played': 1448795654}
review:
Un jeu mêlant Tower defense et Hack 'n Slash. Le pitch? vous êtes un apprenti prétentieux et pas très doué qui, à la suite de la mort de son maître, disparu dans un malencontreux accident, se retrouve à protéger le château de hordes d'orcs qui veulent tout envahir.
Pour ce faire, il faut sortir une armada de pièges plus sadiques les uns que les autres, avec quelque soldats et sorts pour achever les autres.

Les niveaux sont rapides, cela fait un parfait défouloir après une journée pas terrible et si on ne peut plus se défouler sur les orcs, où va le monde? Après un  certain niveau, ça explose, ça décapite et ça brûle à tout va. Jouissif.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051520578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1527450486}
review:
With Orcs Must Die!, the game starts off slow and seems to get quicker and more faster paced as you gain experience and get access to more abilities.  Graphics are nice in this game as well.  It Does seem to get a bit tedious after a long while and the pace at which the orcs spawn and rush in increases. 

If you do not have a lot of time to be able to play because of work, schooling or family schedules but would like to spend 15 min, 30 min or an hour just relaxing, I would recommend this game.   

So overall this game is enjoyable, especially if you dont always have tons of time on your hands.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968607013', 'num_games_owned': 668, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1364, 'last_played': 1388822802}
review:
【お勧め度】★★★☆☆
【プレイ時間】１５時間
【プレイ難易度】ノーマル
【総評】
タワーディフェンス＋アクションをうまい具合に組み合わせたゲームです
罠を設置して、敵を向かい打ちながら自分自身は罠を抜けた敵や複数個所から
責められるためピンチのポイントに向かう感じです
タワーディフェンスは好きだけど、ボーと眺めているのは暇だ！と感じている方には
かなりお勧めできると思います

こちらは１作品目ということで、少し強い罠が多くうまく設置してしまうと眺めるだけ
という事態になることも結構あります
罠の説明文がわりと大雑把で、どれくらいダメージを与えるのかも不明なために
始めは罠をどういう風に設置していいのかわからず、さまざまな組み合わせを試したり、
しなければならないので、多少は面倒に思うことがあるかもしれません

author: {'steamid': '76561197994154869', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1404258390}
review: I had heard a lot about this game from friends and online review sites but I never really thought this game was for me. Boy was I wrong! Seeing it in a bundle I ended up buying it and Orcs Must Die! 2 and I am so glad I did. Being able to setup traps and try to link combos is so fun it's stupid. For anyone that read about this game or seen videos online and thought it wasn't for them, give it a try. You won't regret it! Now only to get more free time to play the game...

author: {'steamid': '76561198042952896', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1427907818}
review:
This game is great to play when you want to have a quick fun.
Each party does not last more than 20 minutes, so you can play it every now and then. 

The gameplay is easy to grasp and the challenge is well balanced so you get the incentive to start over some levels to get all the points.

I'm going for 100% achievements for this game, because it makes me feel like I can do it. 
I will do it at my pace, one play at a time, every now and then. 
And when I'm done with it, I'll download the sequel to keep the fun going.

That makes for a fun game, that I recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111723140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1224, 'last_played': 1393400233}
review:
盲目的に進軍してくるオークやその他のモンスターを、わなや魔法で蹴散らすゲーム。
一種のTDだろうか。とりあえず、わながうまく配置できたところに大量のオークがつっこんでいき、ばったばったとやられていくのを眺めるのは中々の壮観。ただ、ゲームバランスがあまりよくなく、出現位置で剣を振り続けるだけでオークは何もできないという始末。
出現位置が複数あっても片方を自分ひとりで押さえもう片方にすべてのポイントをつぎ込んで自動化すればなんてことはなくクリアできてしまう。
難易度を最高にしてもこの方法で難なくパーフェクトが取れてしまう。
ただ、そういう荒さを除けば個性的かつシンプルなゲームであり、時間を忘れて没頭できるゲームだと思う。

author: {'steamid': '76561198047086513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1391724196}

review: There's just something about deploying the traps, bottlenecking the Orcs, and watching the combos fly that balances its charm between arcade tower defense and creative puzzle making.  This game has kept me from jumping back on World of Warcraft...FOR THE ALLIANCE!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197964120751', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 1476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1459, 'last_played': 1592400357}
review:
Good game, very original.

Third person combat combined with tower defense, reasonably well executed. I'm not sure there's a point to all the stuff in the game - there seems to be some equipment and spells that are just objectively better than others - but then again that might just be my play style. Reminds me a bit of Dungeon Keeper, if it were possible to place traps while posessing a minion. That said, I haven't played anything quite like it, so it gets points for an original fusion of genres. The player character is highly irritating - I think he's supposed to be an endearing doofus, but he just comes across as an out-and-out arsehole. Even so, this is worth getting.

review: chytilo ma to, ale z dôvodu málo miesta na disku muselo ísť preč, samozrejme odporúčam, dobre sa cvičia reflexné schopnosti a ťahy s myškou :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198053895039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1466, 'last_played': 1394579129}
review:
You like tower defence? You like slaying orcs? Or crushing them? Burning maybe? Or penatrating them with arrows? All whilst listening to comments of the most selfcentered douche since duke nukem? Well then this is the game for you. Fend of orcs in an epic onslought, using your wits and your crossbow to prevent them from entering the rifts. With lots of different traps, spells and a decent amound of enemy variety this game does one hell of a job in the third person TD genre. The game is not perfect though. The levels are all very gray and brown and as you are nearing the end of each lv, your defence has usually become so solid that there is no need for you to even be there. 
But if you can live with that (and I know I could), then this game sure is a hell of a lotta fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082904865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1401034369}
review: A single player tower defense action game. As the name suggest your character must defend a room from an onslaught of orcs. The orcs will come through a door as their starting point. Each will proceed to the end goal at the opposite end (usually) of the room. You will run around setting up traps of all kind. Along floors, walls, and ceilings. Traps consist of lava, tar, spikes, and so on. Unlike alot of other defense games this game has more interaction. During and in between rounds you can purchase and lay your traps through out. However, you can also attack the oncoming orcs with one of two weapons. A melle and range weapon set this game apart. Being able to actively attack enemies makes this that much more fun. No need to feel as just a spectator to the game. Most enemies wont attack you as they are driven to their goal. However, as the levels proceed difficulty increases. With newer enemies comes new threats, and new threats begat new traps to counter. If strategy and defense is your cup of tea. I highly recommend this title as the ability to attack will bring something new that you will enjoy. However, if it is not your cup of tea. I still recommend it for the very same reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018625414', 'num_games_owned': 3805, 'num_reviews': 1248, 'playtime_forever': 2154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1605, 'last_played': 1628357221}
review:
日本語音声・翻訳完璧にされています
影牢シリーズのようにトラップを仕掛けて敵を倒すタワーディフェンス型のゲームです
完全にトラップ頼みではなく操作できるプレイヤーが攻撃をしなければならない場面があるので

アクションが好きな人にもオススメできます
FPSに比べるとTPSなので画面酔いしにくいです
DLC無しノーマルひと通りクリアの状態ですがかなり遊べました
難易度も一番難しくないのであればアクションが苦手な人でもイケルと思います

2021年10月31日追記ーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーー

3を予約して買いましたが
なんだかんだで1がバランス的には好きです

[code]
Steamキュレーターで紹介しました
「3D酔いでもゲームがしたい」
日本語でレビューしています
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41056472/
[/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561197987047936', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1326009600}
review:
I usually don't like tower defense games because they often turn into just sitting around waiting for the enemies to die, but with the blend of third-person action, Orcs Must Die! is a lot more fun and engaging. It gets especially intense when you have to monitor multiple paths at once. I'm not sure whether I'd recommend the DLC, since it doesn't add that much to the game -- but on the other hand, it's not very expensive. So, play this game! It's awesome. 

Full review here: http://postlaunch.blogspot.ca/2012/01/orcs-must-die.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198126257101', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1404136665}
review: Сюжет в игру слабый, хотя он и не имеет особого значения, ведь это типичный Tower Defence. Но меня порадоволо то, что избавляться от волн орков можно не только безжизненными механизмами,но и  можно самому ворваться в смертельную битву с этими орками, используя при этом немаленький арсенал оружия. Довольно приятная графика и геймплей, игра отлично подходит для того чтобы убить временя. Кооператива конечно же не хватает, но его добавили во второй части.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036181362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1847, 'last_played': 1628938350}
review:
1,2ともに完全日本語吹き替えという無駄に豪華なTD+TPSゲー。
ダンジョンに罠を張って敵を追い込んでいくので、「影牢」なんかに近いかも。
長い通路を作って敵を殲滅させるような一般的なTDではなく、
一カ所に集中的に罠を仕掛けて一気に敵を殲滅していく形になるので、
殲滅ポイントの選定とどう追い込むかがゲームのポイント。
ウェーブ後半、次々肉片になるオークを見てるとかわいそうになってきます。うそだけど。

良い点
・パーフェクトをねらわなければほどよい難易度。
・コミカルで妙に魅力的な敵味方。
・完全日本語吹き替え。

悪い点
・最初の１,2ウェーブがきつくて後半は眺めてるだけで良くなる1ステージのバランス。
・罠や魔法のアップグレード回数が事実上制限されているため適当なアップグレードを行うと取り返しがつかない。

良質なTDゲーなので万人にお勧め！
1，2ともセールの常連なのでまとめ買い推奨

author: {'steamid': '76561198015484341', 'num_games_owned': 1239, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1448651564}
review: Тут Вы снова играете за мага, который только начинает осваивать способности. Вам нужно убивать полчища зеленых говнюков различными ловушками: от настенных пик (шутка про два стула), до котлов с ядом. Так их, сраных орков. Ватник рекомендует.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077563129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1382455805}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035865707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1045, 'last_played': 1404065108}
review: Orcs Must Die! offers a unique perspective to the tower defense genere.  Build your defenses and fight yoru way through swarms of orcs in this 3rd person behind the shoulder tower defense / beat 'em up hybrid game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990121928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1652870193}
review: You get what you pay for. If you are looking for a deep history or a complex rpg level system this is not your game, it's a pure third person action tower defense, well balanced, really endurable graphics and tones of addictive arcade fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198048681608', 'num_games_owned': 581, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1703983712}
review:
Very easy to play, great sound track and voicing.  Well worth the buy plus alot of replayability for sure graphics are unique and great. 

You can create you own death gauntlets!!

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197996912854', 'num_games_owned': 762, 'num_reviews': 747, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1558979959}
review: I played Orcs Must Die! 2 before this one, and I must say, the second one is better. For those that wants to know what happened in this one, I will spoil it for you and say there is no boss fight with that woman. There is no upgrading your actual weapons, there is only upgrading once on your traps. The DLCs' made this game easier. Skip this game and get Orcs must die 2 if you want gameplay rather than story.. If you want to know how this all started, then feel free to get this when it is on sale. 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198026633656', 'num_games_owned': 1093, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1606, 'last_played': 1392327562}
review: Orcs Must Die! Is one of my favorite games to be honest! This game is filled with humor and has a really nice gameplay. The only drawback is that it's a pure solo game. Something which it's sequel Orcs Must Die! 2 remedies! you take the role of a warmage, protecting the world from invading hordes of Orcs, Gnolls, Ogres and other creatures wishing to enter our world through magical rifts. The story-line is actually quite nice. If you enjoy tower defense games then chances are good that you'll enjoy this game as well!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045910264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1402773155}
review: A fun active tower defence game, each level unlocks a new defence item and you can bring those back to past levels to help you get three stars, a very cool game with a nice style.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022007643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4595, 'last_played': 1410039028}
review: Requiring a degree of strategy and finesse (especially by the time Nightmare levels present), Orcs Must Die! is lots of gruesome fun that will test both your mettle and ability to adapt in ways that will bring you back time and time again to see just how many ways those pesky orcs really can die!  Kobold sappers can really be frustrating as can minor bugs with trap placement on a few levels, but overall this is a very enjoyable experience.  I definitely can recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198121516040', 'num_games_owned': 602, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1445125400}
review:
Игры в жанре tower defence большое множество, но имена это лично мне подуше!!! Сдесь приятный визуальный  ряд, провереный годами tower defence-гемплэй и даже неплохой намек на сюжет, а не всех играх подомного жанра даже намека на сюжет нету. Тем болие один уровинь можно пройти поразному, если начать эксперементировать, а не идти уже по пройдиной схеме. Игру советою всем. Любителям жанра tower defence советую не медлина бежать в ближайший терменал и ложить деньги на покупку это почти шедевра в жанре tower defence.
Графика: 8/10
Геймплей: 9/10
Сюжет: 7/10
Звук и музыка: 8/10
Общая оценка: 8,5

author: {'steamid': '76561198042023224', 'num_games_owned': 1587, 'num_reviews': 1027, 'playtime_forever': 2044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1961, 'last_played': 1468840292}
review:
FPS식 3인칭 시점 디펜스 게임. 
오크들 자체는 무식하게 앞으로 우어어어어 하는게 끝인데, 오크 말고 다른것들이 굉장히 영악하게 구는 경우가 많다. 코볼트라던가, 임프들이라던가...

디펜스는 디펜스인데 이게 3인징 시점으로 FPS마냥 디펜스를 하려니 반쯤은 FPS고, 슈팅 게임이 되어버린다. 참신하긴 한데, 그만큼 또 게임이 어렵게 느껴질 수 있는 부분. 비싸지 않은 가격의 DLC도 있고 해서 스테이지 부족할 걱정은 없다만, 이게 생각보다 한 판 한 판이 긴 편이라(보통 12분~20분 정도)......

정 아쉬운 사람들이라면 후속작이 있으니 그걸 해 보는 것도 좋을듯.
(그러고보니, 이 게임 FPS식 관점인데 3D멀미가 없었지.)

review: i enjoy the fun 3D tower defence game. Having returned to it after a few years, there are a couple of things that could be improved. Some of the levels are much easier to solve by spamming with cheap traps and I haven't been able to make much use out of weavers yet. Still the characters are fun, the environment is cool and the challenge is still exciting!

author: {'steamid': '76561198114998782', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1593521190}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041066484', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2011, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1872, 'last_played': 1456175327}
review:
Orcs must die! That one sentence is actually all you have to know about the game with the same title. It's a mixture between tower defense and an kind of action-rpg, where you have to prevent orcs and all their fellow companions like ogres, flying wyvern, and all that good stuff to enter the portals to the outer world. To do this, you have to... kill them. Of course.

Story:
If you actually want to play this game because of the story, you're considering buying the wrong game. There is basically no story, except if you call that little bit of dialoges between the hero and the villain a story. They're fun to listen to, as mentioned below aswell, but nothing special. Just the regular "evil person wants to destroy the world, hero has to stop her"-story.
2/10, but f*ck that, that's not what makes the game the great game it is, so read on.

Gameplay:
Before starting a game, you have to decide which items you want to use. There are about 25 different defense elements and 5 weapons for the player, such as a lightning ring, an ice ring or a blade, and of course the crossbow, which is your standard weapon.
Then, after having built your line of defence, you enter "G" and the actual fun begins. Orcs and other creatures come and run to the portal (or portals, as you have multiple ones to protect on higher maps). Depending on your build you'll have to do more or less yourself, while your defence units are killing the mobs.
There are three difficulties, one for beginners, "Warmage-Difficulty" (which is the standard one) and "Nightmare-Difficulty", which you unlock after beating the game on Warmage-Difficulty. On nightmare, you have only 3 seconds before the game begins, then you can't stop it anymore, so you have to think fast and play fast. There's actually skill required.
9.5/10

Graphics:
The game is not the newest. It hasn't got high-end graphics, but I like the comic-style of the art design. It's playful, fun, and excentrical. It fits perfectly to the game and to the main character, who's a little bit narcisstic, sarcastic and feels over-the-top, which makes him super fun.
7/10

Sound/Music:
The entire sound is great. While fighting, there's a mixture of rock/metal music with old, somehow medieval music playing. It's fast, it's hard, it rocks, it's just excellent if you like this kind of music.
If you headshot enemies, there sometimes might be special e-guitar riffs played, which makes them quite satisfying.
The monsters sometimes may comment your actions or say stupid things like "why does his crossbow shoot 1000 times a second?" with ultra-stupid voices, which makes them REALLY fun to listen to. Also, they make somehow fun of themselfes, which fits into the concept of Orcs Must Die! pretty well aswell.
The hero - the Warmage - is nice voice acted and sometimes also comments the action going on on the screen in his sarcastic way. Pretty fun aswell.
The villain is nice voice acted aswell, and the dialoges between her and the Warmage are in most of the cases really fun to listen to.
10/10, definitely.

Overall:
Orcs Must Die! is a great tower defense game. It's fun, challenging, entertaining, humorous, and hours fly by like a few seconds when playing it. I love it.
36.5/40 (as story isn't important, if you want to consider it, you get a 38.5/50; but trust me, it's a 50/50 for me personally.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198024908773', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1694019553}
review:
I played the crap out of this game on my friends xbox 360 and loved every minute of it.

Pros: Orcs Must Die is just witty, funny, entertaining, strategy driven tower defense with a 3rd person shooter slapped on top of it, utilitizing traps to push back hordes of orcs and other monsters . This game is just great 100%.

Cons: Honestly there is no cons to this game that I find worth mentioning.

Overall: 9.9/10 because on warmaster this game is intense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060402098', 'num_games_owned': 1248, 'num_reviews': 230, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1475168577}
review: "Petit" jeu qui présente vraiment un gameplay addictif et sympathique : un tower défense en 3D qui est vraiment très fun et qui présente aussi un défi à la hauteur. C'est un bon jeu que l'on prend plaisir à refaire pour améliorer sa stratégie en plaçant ses pièges comme on l'entend. Franchement, la victoire est ultra grisante et le gameplay tellement dynamique et jouissif d'exploser des hordes d'orcs en tous genre. Franchement je suis devenu fan de ce jeu, et je me dis que l'expérience à 2 aurait juste été énormissime sur un tel jeu (et ça tombe bien car le 2 permet d'y jouer à deux justement^^).

author: {'steamid': '76561198071396409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1465213213}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067109130', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 4067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2834, 'last_played': 1529671466}
review:
Con este agresivo título, salio (12 - 10 - 2010)  a la venta en formato descargable el nuevo juego de estrategia y acción desarrollado por los chicos de Robot Entertainment, una empresa que no cuenta con muchos títulos en su haber y cuyo primer trabajo fue el notable Age of Empires Online, un juego que ahora se encuentra en manos de otra desarrolladora.
A pesar de que Robot Entertainment no es una empresa muy conocida para el gran público, es importante saber que sus integrantes cuentan con gran experiencia en el género de la estrategia a tiempo real, ya que muchos de ellos fueron miembros de la antigua desarrolladora Ensemble Studios, conocida por la famosa saga Age of Empires.
 
Orcs Must Die! nos muestra una visión más desenfadada del género, aunque cuenta con un gran componente estratégico mucho más profundo del que puede darnos a entender a primera vista. Su mecánica es la del clásico juego de defensa de torres y en él manejaremos a un aprendiz de mago que, después de morir su mentor, se ve obligado a asumir la peligrosa misión de defender una fortaleza a la que cientos de Orcos y otros malvados seres pretenden acceder para alcanzar una especie de portales denominados fisuras, distribuidos por las diferentes fases del juego, con el fin de gobernar en un reino de tinieblas.
 
Con esto no queremos decir que el juego sea un camino de rosas, es más, habrá momentos en los que deseemos estampar el mando contra nuestro televisor por su exagerada dificultad. Las fases iniciales no son excesivamente exigentes y las oleadas de enemigos son menos numerosas, pero la dificultad subirá considerablemente según vayamos abriendo niveles, aparecerán enemigos desde diferentes frentes cada vez más resistentes y, para más intriga, nunca sabremos el orden de salida de los mismos. Por todo ello, será fundamental conocer el mapa de cada uno de los niveles a la perfección, para poder así elegir una estrategia óptima que nos permita enfrentarnos a las hordas de enemigos con ciertas garantías de éxito.
 
A lo largo del juego, nuestro héroe se irá haciendo con una serie de armas, tanto de largo como corto alcance, que cuentan con una habilidad primaria y otra secundaria que nos permitirán frenar los ataques de nuestros enemigos, aunque las verdaderas protagonistas son una serie de trampas y ayudas que se irán desbloqueando progresivamente cada vez que superemos un nivel. Estas ayudas se mostrarán de muy diversas formas y nos encontraremos con trampas de pinchos, eficaces arqueros, barriles explosivos, sierras que se activan de forma automática, trampas de vapor que elevarán a nuestros enemigos hasta el techo o plataformas trampa impulsadas mediante un muelle que harán que estos salgan despedidos en la dirección que deseemos y serán ideales para colocarlas cerca de abismos o depósitos de ácido. Estas trampas son esenciales para evitar que nuestros enemigos consigan acceder a las fisuras y para ello, deberemos ir colocándolas estratégicamente en distintos lugares del escenario que consideremos más adecuados, con el fin de machacar "literalmente" a las innumerables hordas de Orcos, Trasgos, Trolls, etcétera, que irán apareciendo a lo largo del juego.
 
Esta variedad de trampas son, sin duda, las que hacen que se convierta por méritos propios en todo un referente dentro de los juegos de defensa de torres, ya que, por regla general, este tipo de títulos suelen caracterizarse por contar con unos sistemas defensivos algo limitados a la hora de proteger la fortaleza en cuestión. Sin embargo, las trampas y mecanismos con los que cuenta Orcs Must Die! son innumerables y su original aplicación nos hará disfrutar de una gran diversidad de ejecuciones de lo más gore, que hacen que esta aventura sea una experiencia realmente gratificante.
 
Nuestro héroe cuenta con un inventario que únicamente le permitirá llevar de forma simultánea siete elementos a la misma vez. Por otro lado, no podremos utilizar las ayudas de forma ilimitada ya que deberemos pagar un precio cada vez que queramos colocarlas. Será esencial que organicemos bien nuestros recursos y conozcamos perfectamente la fase que estamos dispuestos a afrontar, sobre todo en los momentos más avanzados del título, donde un simple error puede ser sinónimo de muerte.
 
Cada vez que superemos una fase, se mostrará una estadística con nuestros resultados y obtendremos una serie de cráneos como recompensa. Su número dependerá de los puntos de fisura conservados y del tiempo que hayamos necesitado para finalizar la misión y estos nos servirán como moneda de cambio para obtener mejoras en los distintos elementos de ayuda. De ese modo, los pinchos serán más dañinos, las plataformas ralentizadoras aguantarán más tiempo a nuestros enemigos y la compra de arqueros podrá resultarnos más económica, entre otras muchas mejoras. Esto da una gran rejugabilidad al título, ya que si queremos obtener un buen número de cráneos con los que mejorar nuestras ayudas, deberemos superar de nuevo fases ya finalizadas.
 
El entorno gráfico resalta por un marcado estilo cartoon que ayuda a potenciar el carácter desenfadado del título, aunque los escenarios se muestran algo vacíos y demasiado cuadriculados algo que, por otro lado, nos ayuda a obtener una visión más clara de su estructura a la hora de colocar nuestro arsenal armamentístico. Por último, nuestro protagonista y los propios enemigos cuentan con un diseño bastante resultón y sus movimientos resultan bastante suaves y agradables a la vista.
 
El juego cuenta con tres niveles de dificultad, aunque al principio únicamente podremos jugarlo en fácil o en intermedio. El más difícil se hará accesible una vez hayamos finalizado con éxito el nivel intermedio. Aconsejo el comienzo de la partida desde este nivel (intermedio), ya que es el que va a ofrecer una experiencia de juego más satisfactoria y el que obligue a estudiar con mayor detenimiento las posiciones de las trampas que vayas a colocar para hacer frente a las numerosas oleadas de enemigos
 
Una de las cosas que más hemos echado de menos en este título es la posibilidad de jugar en cooperativo con algún amigo en la misma consola o a través de la red. Se trata de una modalidad que finalmente ha quedado fuera del juego, a pesar de que se adapta perfectamente a la mecánica del mismo y, con toda seguridad, nos habría ofrecido muchísimas más horas de diversión.

Por último, comentar que viene totalmente localizado a nuestro idioma. A menudo escucharemos de boca de nuestro protagonista divertidas expresiones como "el mejor trabajo del mundo", "ahora que el viejo está criando malvas" e incluso a mitad de una batalla le escucharemos decir "qué desastre" en tono irónico, cada vez que un grupo de Orcos es masacrado. La banda sonora y los efectos de sonido también se encuentran a un buen nivel y han sido bien implementados en el juego. Mientras preparamos nuestra estrategia reinará un silencio continuo y una vez empiece el show, diferentes melodías realmente pegadizas nos acompañarán en nuestra encarnizada misión.
 
El lanzamiento de Orcs Must Die! supone una grata sorpresa para el extenso catálogo de juegos descargables. El título ha mezclado sabiamente elementos propios de los títulos de estrategia con pinceladas de las aventuras de acción, creándose una combinación de elementos realmente adictiva y bien ideada. Sus más de veinte niveles (24 en el juego y 5 extra) te mantendra a la PC durante mucho tiempo, aunque no seras conscientes de ello y las horas te parecerán minutos mientras preparas sanguinarias estratagemas contra las numerosas hordas de enemigos que iras encontrando a lo largo de este divertido título.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010180088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 1052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1052, 'last_played': 1398719610}
review:
[b]This is a long review so if you want just a brief summary of why I recommend Orcs Must Die! then skip to [u]Results[/u] and read from there.[/b]

Robot Entertainment mixes elements of different game types to conjure up a brilliant rendition of the tower defense genre. Taking action packed battles and mixing them with strategy you get a game that pushes both hack ‘n slash as well as base management. 

[b]Story:[/b]
The order has fallen, the last War Mage is dead, and protecting the realm is now left up to you his apprentice. You must fight your way through the unlimited hordes of orcs as you defend the rifts from falling into the wrong hands. As you press through your adventure you come to learn the evil forces are being led by a corrupted War Mage who plans to destroy humanity. Will you be able to save the world from falling into darkness? 

[b]Campaign:[/b]
The campaign is broken down into three acts. The first act has ten levels, the second act has 8, and the third act has 6. Despite each act having fewer levels than the last they are all about the same length as the number of waves increases throughout the campaign. Each level unlocks a new element to the game and once you’ve completed the level you gain the new item for any preceding or future level. Each time you beat a level you get a rating of one to five skulls, unlike most games these skulls actually are given to you as a currency which you can use to upgrade items. You can only get five skulls per level, meaning you cannot beat a level scoring five skulls then play it again to get another five skulls. Each level you can choose from a mastery tree that allows you to kit yourself out for that level, based on your strategies this can vary greatly throughout the campaign. You will progressively unlock more tower/item slots, which start as you only being able to equip three towers/items but later on you’ll find yourself with 10+ slots. You play the entire game in third person, and similar to other games of the genre you are able to join in the battle and help your towers out. This means you are not just sitting there waiting between waves, but rather taking an active part into the gameplay. Some levels you may find yourself not needing to join in, while others you will be right in the fray. 

[b]Gameplay:[/b]
Each level allows you to equip an inventory which allows you to choose from a combination of spells, weapons, and towers. There are two weapons (crossbow and bladestaff), four spells (flame bracers, ice amulet, lightning ring, and wind belt), two guardians (paladins and archers), and 17 towers. I found myself typically sticking to the same set throughout the entire campaign, but there are many different strategies you can go for. By placing player activated traps you can take a large part of the game, you can sit back and use guardians to do most of the work, or even mix and match. The gameplay is fast paced and really pulls you into the mix by getting you to experience new elements each level. 

[b]Artifacts of Power DLC:[/b]
Artifacts of Power is a DLC that includes new items and towers. The DLC includes two traps (Shock Zapper and Floor Scorcher) and two spells (Vampiric Gauntlets and Alchemist Satchel). I used the Floor Scorcher and Vampiric Gauntlets a few times, found the Shock Zapper completely useless (as you need a roof for it to function), and used the Alchemist Satchel to get a +50 kill streak for the achievement. All and all this DLC isn’t exactly necessary, but if you can get it on sale and included in the pack it’s worth grabbing. 

[b]Lost Adventures DLC:[/b]
Lost Adventures is a DLC that includes new level, enemies, and even a new tower. There are five new levels, which offer more skulls allowing for even more upgrades. There are two new enemies the Frost Bat, and Cyclops Mage. It also includes one new trap the mana well which allows you to refill your mana gauge. This DLC is completely worth it as it adds additional content, new enemies, towers, and refined leaderboards. If you can get this on sale or in the bundle you will not regret it. 

[b]Results:[/b]
Orcs Must Die is an epic tower defense hack ‘n slash game that keeps you pressed and wanting more. With rating systems that actually give you rewards, fun and interesting enemies, a long and arduous campaign, and an amusing little story Orcs Must Die is a Must Buy (too easy). If you are looking for something similar to Sang-Froid or Sanctum this is pretty much in that line. Once you beat Orcs Must Die you’ll feel like you need to buy the second one as it makes you just want to play more. 

Pros:
+Leaderboard system that allows you to rank yourself amongst friends.
+Level rating out of five skulls which can then be used to buy upgrades.
+Loads of spells, weapons, and towers to choose from.
+Skill trees which can be customized each level to allow you to change how you play (more player intensive, tower support, or mixture of both).
+Smooth graphics which look good and don’t push it too far.
+Funny and amusing dialogue which gives you a laugh without being offensive.
+Intense amount of action, keeps you pressed and fighting between each wave.
+Built in level traps (such as rolling locks, acid pots, lava pots, and ballista).

Cons:
-I had a few levels glitch where an enemy wouldn’t leave the spawn point and thus I couldn’t kill it requiring me to restart (this was annoying if it was at the end of the level).
-If Gnoll Hunters fall into acid pits they do not die (as I learned when I set up a level that used nearby acid pits to kill enemies). 
-One of the DLC levels (Reverse Tower) is just The Tower in Reverse. I know this is obvious from the title, but if you purchase the DLC before playing the game its disappointing to find out one of the levels is the same thing just backwards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071706064', 'num_games_owned': 1960, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1387056461}
review:
Orcs Must Die is a third person tower defence game. You play as the magicians apprentice and you must stop the Orcs from reaching the Rift, which is a portal to your universe.
Each level the Orcs break through the doors (or fly through holes in the ceiling) and make their way to the Rift coming in waves. You lay traps in their path, from spiked floors to swinging blades the Orcs blunder through your traps becoming so much meat and with each death you get more money to place more traps. Of course should you get bored of watching them die you can enter the fray yourself firing either a rapid fire crossbow or engaging in melee. Once you complete the level you get skulls based on how well you did which you use to purchase and upgrade traps.

This game is pretty good, if a little repetitive and the difficulty really ramps up in the later levels, especially if you haven't got the right traps or upgraded them enough. It's very satisfying to see a horde of Orcs be decimated as they wander through your traps, all the while never firing a single shot yourself.

For £6.99 it's a great game, well worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057231824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 984, 'last_played': 1395308961}
review:
影牢に大量の敵とTPS要素を盛り込んだゲーム。日本語吹き替え付き
次々と押し寄せてくるオークを床や天井に罠を仕掛け自陣を守る
罠は一度発動すると再度使用するまで時間がかかるので
倒しきれなかったオークにハラハラさせられます
ゲーム一周のボリュームは5~10時間程度ですが、
難易度を上げるとオークに突破されやすくなるのでまた違った楽しみ方が出来ます

続編の２がありますがそちらはCO-OP対応です
協力プレイを重点に置いた為か、分かれ道や自陣が２つあるマップが多く
罠を分散させなければならなくなり、面倒臭さが出てしまったので
ソロでやるなら１の方がお勧めです

author: {'steamid': '76561198054195487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1569644649}

author: {'steamid': '76561198070632922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1753, 'last_played': 1397366448}
review:
一款注重操作的塔防游戏.

与想像中不同,游戏对于陷阱和操作的平衡掌握的恰到好处,兽人极厚的血量和多样化让战斗极具挑战,给的很不大方的金钱,又让制造一劳永逸的陷阱大阵成为不可能的事.
简单说杀入敌阵玩割草,或者造个陷阱坐等其成在这个游戏中是不可能的.只有陷阱的设置与个人的操作很好的结合才能过关斩将.
特别是恶梦难度下,游戏的速度很快,如果没有一个中心思想,抱着走一步看一步的态度,会死的非常的惨的.
不过即使是恶梦,只要根据本关的地形合理选择,配置陷阱,再将陷阱和战斗两者协调起来,5星通关还是游刃有余的.

但想在排行榜中得高分又是另一回事了.
得高分的关键是连击数要高,连击数高的关键还得看个人战斗时的技术如何.所以感觉游戏还是更倾向于战斗部分.
尽管游戏为玩家提供了多种多样的武器,但是想要提高连击数却更要看人品,因为作为最基础的武器的弓箭,经常性的会抽风.比如几乎脸贴脸的情况下想要爆头,而且敌人的头也确实是在准星中,准星也确实是最小的状态,在这种100%必中的情况下,箭却越过了敌人的头顶...然后一系列的计划就这么被打乱,运气好还能力挽狂澜,运气差的就直接见阎老五去了.

虽然是一款很有亮点的游戏,但它的缺点也亮的直发光啊.
前文也提到的,准星如同虚设的问题,zoom模式外想要爆头的话,凭感觉更有成效.或者直接0距离乱射.
视角会受比如摆锤等陷阱的影响而改变,使人眼花缭乱,完全没有办法做出正确的判断.
对空陷阱极其缺乏,现有的又太贵,敌人又一下来一堆.
冰魔实在是bug般的存在,没有有效的定身手段,对其有特效的火焰系陷阱或者法术又太过鸡肋,蘑菇虽然好使,但架不住1200的价格和成群结队的冰魔.

总之感觉游戏赢在了设计上,一种前无古人后无来者的设计,直到2代的出现.
值得一提的是,买了1代能在2代中得到附加关卡,把1代当成是2代的DLC更合适.75%sale的时候有买的价值,不然还是直接玩2代吧.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975051410', 'num_games_owned': 1443, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1336028400}
review:
Excellent tower defense-ish game!  It's smooth, colorful, bloody, violent and pretty damn difficult at times.  It's a lot like a single player Dungeon Defenders.  Removing the multiplayer makes it easier to see whats going on, and allows for more creative thinking.  Each new level, trap and ability you unlock will leave you thirsty for more and more Orc blood!

The traps are extremely divers and fun to experiment with.  Some combos work better than others, and some strategies are easier for different people.

The pace of the game will keep you on your toes, and the learning curve is well balanced.  With the constant addition of new enemies and new traps, your tactic will have to change throughout the game.

Its a good length for the content as well.  If it was longer, it would feel drawn out or not leave enough room for omd2.

Over all, this game is a lot of fun and worth buying – on sale!  I only stress that this is bought on sale because you can play all of the omd maps on omd2 – with or without a friend.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=7261685

author: {'steamid': '76561198069797359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1397259105}
review: Orcs Must Die is a game where there's orcs... and... they must die. Why? Fucking, I don't know, they're evil and they're breaking into your castle or some shit. Anyway, it's basically like a 3D tower-defense where you play as a douchebag with a crossbow who can put traps in places to mercilessly slaughter all the orcs. You gotta make sure they don't all get through, or else you'll lose, or if you're like me, if one gets through, then you gotta start over because that's prevented you from getting the highest possible score. In all seriousness though, this is really fun game, and if you can catch it on sale, consider yourself lucky.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069204713', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 965, 'last_played': 1413211917}
review: It is an intensly fun game to play, with great humor, and strategy to boot. I like graphics and the mechanics of the game, as it drives the focus on simply killing orcs, yet you must build the skills required to set the appropriate traps on a given map; failure to do so means your DEFEAT, to only have to try it again.  I give the game a 9.9 out of 10: I never thought I would have this much fun with a game such as this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044640183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 878, 'last_played': 1457896475}
review: A fun, cartoony, tower defense/FPS hybrid game. The controls are fluid and easy to pick up. There's a satisfaction that doesn't come with normal tower defense games where you just sit back and watch. If you liked Sanctum, this is better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017868757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1395760969}
review: I simply have to share a quick review/opinion on this game stating that despite its rather silly visage and initial portrayal, it is really one of the most fun-packed and relatively easy to pick up games that I've played in a while. A perfect game to fire up on an off-hour to let off some steam murdering pesky orcs in every single way you could ever imagine. It delivered everything it promised and more, with the possibility for what seems like some rather deep strategy and cooperative gameplay later in the game aswell. I still have to play more to form myself a perfect opinion on the game, but still felt that I had to give my highest regards to the creators of this games already, and to highly reccommend it to anyone looking for a bit of a fun fast-paced thought-requiring time sink.

review: Данную игру советую брать только во время скидок, так как считаю, что купив её за 250 рублей,вы будете расстроены.Задумка интересная,симпотичная графика,хорошо проработаны анимации, но не смотря на это, игра довольно быстро надоедает.Даже если учитывать, что в каждом новом эпизоде вам дают, что-нибудь новенькое (оружие,ловушка,войны) эта игра затянет вас максимум на 3 часа.Я купил её во время скидок за 62 рубля,поэтому ни сколько об этом не жалею.В целом 8 из 10)

author: {'steamid': '76561198046452775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1517740953}
review:
Pewnego zimnego wieczora w tawernie pod rozerwanym cielakiem ,
spotkałem starszego człowieka który za kufel piwa opowiedział mi historię ,
O młodym magu Bitewnym który uczył się od wielkiego mistrza ,
ten mistrz nie fortunnie się poślizgną na gęste śliskiej krwi .
Mag spojrzał na swego mistrza i długo nie myśląc zabrał z jego ciała księgę i Kostur ,
i wyruszył bronić magicznych szczelin które prowadzą do jego krainy ,
zatem rozpoczął on wielką walkę z Orkami  !!!

- Również w to nie uwierzyłem a jednak to prawda .

- Jeśli nie wierzysz ale cie korci poznać całą historię to nie masz wyboru
musisz zagrać w Orc must die .

author: {'steamid': '76561198041438666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 1150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1150, 'last_played': 1432629522}
review:
[h1]В середине осени 2011 года выходит Orcs must Die и наряду с вышедшей немного ранее Sanctum еще раз приоткрывает завесу тайн - может ли какая-нибудь игра соответствовать жанру Tower Defense, но быть более незаурядной?[/h1]

 [i]Примерьте на себя костюм одного из немногих оставшихся боевых магов. Молодой, бестолковый, самоуверенный, но неплохо справляющийся с полчищами кровожадных орков. Ученик после смерти своего наставника решает продолжить его дело и начинает противостояние злобной чародейке, а также ее легионам тьмы.[/i]

 Вы управляете магом с обзором камеры от третьего лица, а в вашем распоряжении многочисленные ловушки, стражники и другие полезные вещи. Путь орков заранее известен и все, что нам нужно - это не дать им дойти до портала. У вас есть выбор сконцентрироваться на самом герое или же передать ловушкам и стражникам инициативу остановить нашествие недоброжелателей. Первый вариант подходит больше для тех, кому по душе самим контролировать процесс т.е рубить мечом направо и налево, а также активно кидаться фаерболами или склянками с кислотой. Второй же вариант для тех, кого забавляет вид орка подоженного на напольной ловушке или нашпигованного стрелами.

Казалось бы уже очень неплохо, но немного позже нас еще знакомят с ''Хранительницами'' в чьей воле ваши боевые, магические способности и то насколько эффективны будут механизмы установленные вами для борьбы с зелеными болванчиками. Так что сделав акцент на чем-то одном вам предоставляется еще выбор в его развитии, что радует. 

 Тактику придется обдумывать надежную и подстраиваясь под особенности каждого уровня: где-то проходов несколько, где-то один, но есть также и воздушные вредители. Бестиарий местных монстров не особо их многими видами, но тех, что имеются - вполне достаточно чтобы процесс не приедался, а вам не становилось скучно.

 В сторону технической части хотелось бы сказать, что в игре все хорошо. Графически смотрится вполне мило и о плохом уровне детализации не подумать. Столь частая музыкальная дорожка во время истребления орков может вам быстро надоесть, но радует озвучание персонажей и орков от отечественных локализаторов.

 Не разочаруйте орков и делайте с ними, что вам придет в голову, будь-то: мечи, магия, напольные огнеметы, лавовые ловушки, настенные шипы, паровые ловушки, режущие механизмы.. Но не дайте им пройти в портал! Вид разлетающегося на части орка вам понравится.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054887912', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1782, 'last_played': 1590156871}
review:
This game is one of the best games ever made, this is the game that brought me to steam.
It is a 3rd person tower defense with great humor.

You are the last warmage that left to protect earth by preventing orcs and monsters to get into the rift.
Well.. you are not a true warmage.. you are the apprentice of an warmage that died in a very stupid death.

So it is only you VS tons of monsters that wants to kill you and then kill the human race.. BUT you are not just an apprentice., no no no , you are the most idiotic one! You are the last hope of the human race (you and your spells and traps).

Dont worry earth people , the apprentice is here to save you (you are doomed :P )


Score section :
Humor : 9/10
GFX : 7/10  great cartoon graphic
Voices : 9/10
Storyline : 7/10
Gameplay : 8/10

Score : 8


One of the best tower defense game ever made, worth every dollar

author: {'steamid': '76561198063823409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1449756474}
review:
You know from the developer said about Orcs Must Die:

Slice them
Burn them
Chop them
Pound them
Freeze them

You can use any methods to kill Orcs in this game, simple concepts but varies of executions. Your war mage is become like one man army, dealing with thousands of orcs every time you play this.

You got traps, guardian, spells and weavers to help you killing the orcs, you'll never regret it how things works out if you play this. 

This is a hybrid of 3rd person shooter and Real Time Strategy (RTS) because you need to know what kind of trap that will make orcs unable to enter your rift and don't forget of Big Boys such as Ogres and Bat for the Air units.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047022152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1362902400}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993891197', 'num_games_owned': 767, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 2832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1737, 'last_played': 1408269113}
review:
I have very fond memories of this funny and polished third-person tower defense game. Slaughtering orcs, trolls, goblins, and other mobs is hugely satisfying, especially when racking up combos and abusing skill trees and environmental traps.

The game's only flaw is that the hardest difficulty, Nightmare mode, is a bit on the unfun side, as it immediately starts all attack waves automatically, removing the element of careful planning. If you're a completionist aiming to 5-star every level, be prepared for the tedium of restarting every single level dozens and dozens of times from scratch until that one magical run where nothing goes wrong.

Aside from that, highly recommended game. If you've never played Orcs Must Die 2, get this one on sale and play it first, and see if you get as hooked as I did.

review:
续作orcs must die 2也相当好玩，所以orcs must die 3究竟什么时候出啊！
非常棒的TOBA类游戏，第三人称动作+塔防的魔幻游戏
卡通风格的画面也是非常萌萌哒
各种陷阱绝对能满足你想用不同方式揍死兽人的需要

author: {'steamid': '76561198080956272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1108, 'last_played': 1566826598}
review: Сюжет Orcs must die! прост, и по сути, является формальностью. Некий старый и могучий маг, уже много лет охраняет портал в страну людей, от полчища орков. Но как-то раз, он подскольнулся на вражеской крови, и расшиб себе голову на смерть... Печально? Нет! В игре много черного юмора и подобных шуточек. Так что продолжу. Теперь охранять порталы предстоит его молодому и озорному ученичку. Вот пожалуй и все.Игрок управляет учеником, а ныне полноценным защитником портала. В начале каждого уровня дается время на изучение карты. После чего на имеющиеся деньги необходимо купить и грамотно расставить ловушки для надвигающейся Орды, и постараться не пропустить их в портал.Ловушек в игре огромное количество. Признаться, я сам, их все еще не открыл. Тут есть различные механизмы выпускающие шипы, стрелы, различные молотилки и месилки, замедляющие и подбрасывающие ловушки и многое др. Можно еще и лучников с войнами расставлять. Кроме того и сам герой неплохо орудует арбалетом, пикой и различной магией.Вначале все просто, но каждый уровень становиться все сложнее. И приходиться хорошенько обдумывать свои действия. Но при этом и веселье игра тоже доставляет. Много юмора и различные варианты смерти зеленокожих, не заставят скучать!Красивая, качественная и весьма оригинальная игра, которая подойдет практически для всех.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994896116', 'num_games_owned': 2329, 'num_reviews': 1481, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1343718000}
review:
Казалось бы, что это обычная инди-игра про туповатого мага, который убивает орков. Но это немного не так. Маг и вправду не блещет интеллектом, что, в принципе, не мешает ему убивать вышеупомянутых орков ТЫСЯЧАМИ. Нужно отметить, что точный жанр - Tower Defence. Симпатичная графика, множество оружия и ловушек, приличное количество карт, широкий спектр врагов (от обычных орков до болотных тролей).

Лучшая игра в своем жанре (если учитывать обе части сразу).

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197982251433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1324368000}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002990097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1328342400}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is an extremely fun Tower Defense game, with a very nice mix of tower (trap) defense and third person action game.

While there are clearly some traps which are much more useful than others and you will tend to gravitate towards them, there is still a large amount to choose from, so you can easily set up some deadly combinations to defeat the invading orcs.

The gameplay is where the game really shines, while the level design is so-so, the sheer amount of variety in the game compensates for that.

The only major fault of the game is that it appears personal abilities are very strong and can overshadow the traps themselves, so if you are strategy minded you might be disappointed since, especially in the early waves, you will have to rely heavily on your character to do most of the work.

Great game let down by balance issues and level design.

8 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561197999965365', 'num_games_owned': 416, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 1754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1745, 'last_played': 1626134798}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971045149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1975, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1901, 'last_played': 1392915203}
review:
Einer der besten Spiele die ich kenne! Meiner Meinung ein Must-Have!

Das Spiel ist eine Mischung aus TowerDefense und Third-Person-Shooter.
Anstelle von Türmen werden Fallen und Wachen aufgestellt, welche die Orks verletzen, durch die Luft schleudern oder zerschmettern.
Im Laufe des Spiels werden immer mehr verbesserbare Fallen freigeschaltet, welche eine Vielzahl an Verteidungskombinationen ermöglichen.
Die Horde an Orks werden des weiteren mit Armbrust, Schwert oder Magieangriffen abwehrt, wodurch es nie langweilig wird.

Den nächsten Teil "Orcs Must Die! 2" kann ich ebenfalls nur empfehlen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017168358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1558797433}
review:
Gameplay is similar to tower defense games, but instead of towers, you defend rifts. You prevent orcs from crossing the rifts by setting up traps AND fighting them using your crossbow/blade/spells (3rd Person). You can also customize your warmage (minor spoiler) by using the weavers, which give specific boosts whether you prefer casting spells or being crafty with traps.

Highly recommended for the casual gamer, it's easy to pick up and go. Maps typically has 15 rounds which take no more than 3-5 minutes each (much faster if you are good)

author: {'steamid': '76561198091451306', 'num_games_owned': 566, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 2564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1523561344}
review:
[Critique tirée de mon SensCritique !]

La Fantasy, de manière générale, est montrée comme un genre plutôt sérieux. Il n'y a qu'à voir les innombrables créations littéraires ou cinématographiques : la grande majorité se veut sérieuse comme avec la Fantasy Épique, voire dans certains cas un peu trop sérieux si ce n'est complétement sombre (Dark Fantasy oblige). Alors, de temps en temps, cela peut détendre de se laisser aller à plonger dans un univers de Light Fantasy, à la recherche de burlesque et de bonnes d'oses d'humour et le moins que l'on puisse dire, c'est que le jeu Orcs Must Die ! nous gâte comme pas possible !

Alors que les Hommes vivent en paix - les invasions Orques étant retenues par des paladins faisant parti de l'Ordre - le plus grand mage de guerre vient à mourir à la suite d'une énième défense. La protection des Failles (passage entre le monde des Hommes et des Orques) revient alors à son apprenti. "Voilà... Le monde est condamné..."
Pas plus de spoil !

Orcs Must Die ! est un jeu développé par Robot Entertainment de type stratégique en "Tower Defense" : en effet, durant plus d'une vingtaine de tableau, il va vous falloir armer, piéger et défendre des salles toutes aussi surprenantes les unes que les autres pour empêcher les Orques de détruire votre monde. Et pour ce faire, on ne va pas de main morte !

En soi, le jeu est fort sympathique, revigorant et monstrueusement fun, facile à prendre en main, simple dans son fonctionnement. En effet, à chaque niveau, votre personnage (l'apprenti du mage de guerre) doit défendre une salle en y déposant moult pièges afin de stopper l'invasion. Donc, pas de prise de tête et c'est sans aucun mal que l'heure tourne tandis que les niveaux s'enchainent.
Alors, attention ! Il ne faut pas non plus s'attendre à un jeu très recherché ou même très profond scénaristiquement parlant. Néanmoins, le travail proposé fait largement l'affaire !

Pour expliciter quelques points du jeu :

L'histoire est simple mais il y en a une. En même temps, ne pas parvenir à faire d'histoire avec un thème aussi banal que la défense de salles, il faut le faire. Cependant, si elle est amusante - les éléments comiques viennent nous faire sourire plus d'une fois - elle est également facilement oubliable...

Le héros ! Je dois avouer que de tous les héros jouables (j'entends également non personnalisable, à la The Elder Scrolls), il entre facilement dans mon top 10 des héros favoris. Il est (du moins, je l'ai trouvé) absolument génial grâce à ses punchlines déclarées selon les massacres ou les situations.

Bien évidemment, pour un "Tower Defense", impossible de contourner l'élément principal : les pièges. Ils sont tous inventifs en plus d'être proposés en large catalogue. Pas seulement des pièges, mais également des armes, des unités et autres amulettes. De plus, au fur et à mesure des parties et des salles défendues, on reçoit des crânes (monnaie du jeu) permettant d'améliorer efficacement notre arsenal.

Et pour clore le point par point, les ennemis. On ne se borne pas à attendre seulement des Orques. C'est toute les armées qui viennent avec la ferme attention de nous dérouiller la figure : des Ogres aux Kobolds en passant par les terribles Gnolls, il y a de quoi faire et de quoi trouver sa hantise !

Pour conclure, Orcs Must Die ! est vraiment un jeu qui mérite le coup, ne serait-ce que pour l'essayer tant il est jouissif et reposant (en un sens). Les niveaux sont assez variés pour ne pas avoir l'impression de défendre deux fois le même endroit, le panel d'armes et d'ennemis est colossal, la bande son est accrocheuse - le thème principal peut facilement rester en tête, le héros est totalement déjanté... En bref, un jeu que je ne peux que recommander et qui assure (presque - parce que ma critique là, elle est tout de même pas mal subjective) un amusement poilant ! Ce qui est sûr, c'est que ça va laisser des traces !
Et n'oubliez pas que la Fantasy nous appartient !

author: {'steamid': '76561198043642780', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1392620183}

review:
Un gioco davvero simpatico, un tower defense che permette un coinvolgimento maggiore, visto che si controlla direttamente un personaggio in terza persona, con il quale posizionare le trappole ed ataccare i nemici.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990759355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1402144251}
review: I'm normally not a huge fan of tower defense, but this one is a lot of fun. The humor is charming, the traps are satisfying, the levels have a good difficulty curve, and the whole experience is very polished. Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198070694409', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 584, 'last_played': 1392675828}
review:
OMD Review:
This game is a solid pickup.
Gameplay: Solid. You can take two main approaches: weapon-based or trap-based, as well as various upgrades throughout the game that can improve the cost of your traps. The controls are solid and traversal of levels is easy.
Graphics: Good, runs on most anything.
Aesthetic: Interesting, lends itself to the game's unique humor.
Music/Sound: The music isn't the greatest, and the Archer and Paladin lines get EXTREMELY irritating. Also, if you happen to minimize the game, it will loop the current sound playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990976626', 'num_games_owned': 1141, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 773, 'last_played': 1392752479}
review:
Orcs Must Die! - хорошая игра на стыке экшена и Tower Defence. Необремененный интеллектом ученик великого мага остается один на один с тысячами орков и должен сдержать их натиск и защитить замки с порталами. В этом ему помогают десятки ловушек, орудия убийств и заклинаний, а также отличный юмор. Вы не раз улыбнетесь, слушая перебранку ученика с учителям или стенания избиваемых орков. Кроме орков будут шустрые кобольды, толстокожие огры и прочая, в том числе летающая, нечисть. В начале каждого уровня выдается очень небольшое количество золота, на которое мы должны организовать оборону. Поэтому каждый замок представляет из себя головоломку. Перед очередной атакой мы выбираем орудия геноцида и строим ловушки. Можно сосредоточится на ловушках и браться за меч только в редких случаях, а можно выбрать стезю боевого мага и полностью взвалить на свои плечи задачу геноцида.  Есть и третий - компромиссный вариант. В любом случае остаться сторонним наблюдателем у вас не получится и придеться попотеть. За истребленных получаем награду и усовершенствуем лабиринт смерти. За защиту очередного замка нам дарят новую ловушку или оружие. Если защита прошла успешна - выдают черепа, на которые мы можем улучшать ловушки. 

Все это приправлено сочной и яркой графикой.

Осторожно! Игра развивает садисткие наклонности и нетерпимость к оркам. При этом, приходя в какое-то помещение, ваш наметанный глаз будет автоматически подмечать где и какие ловушки лучше поставить.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985797191', 'num_games_owned': 5587, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 966, 'last_played': 1339484400}
review: One of the most helarious tower defence games I’ve played. I do very much enjoy this genre and orcs must die does shine as one of the best. Even though the gore and the graphics design is "cartoony"; mowing down the hord with well placed traps or jumping into the frey with a meele weapon is still extremely satisfying. The humor is well done but taylored for younger players with reasonably subtle hints to more adult subjects. The plot is simple but entertaining non the less. The maps can be quite fendish but once you work out the best arrangement it all falls into place and you can work on that high score.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091233767', 'num_games_owned': 600, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1576528586}
review:
Достоинства:
+ Симпатичная мультяшная графика. Качественный звук и мощный саундтрек, настраивающий на смертоубийство.
+ Смешение жанров Tower Defence и Action. Орков орды. Их увлекательно отстреливать, рубить, крошить, расставлять ловушки и смотреть как они их потрошат, сжигают и швыряют.
+ Обилие юмора - от карикатурного изображения врагов, до уморительных реплик главных героев.
+ Большое количество средств уничтожения орков - оружие ближнего и дальнего боя, а также разнообразные ловушки и всё это можно апгрейдить.

Недостатки:
- Практически полностью отсутствует сюжет.

Время за этой игрой летит незаметно.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988936522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1522540219}
review: I picked this game up cheap in a bundle and was very surprised at how very awesome it is.  It combines FPS, tower strategy, and humor in delicious proportions.  I find it hard to quit.  Each level requires its own analysis to determine the best defense, the options are endless, and I don't always get it "right" and get overwhelmed the first time through.  A perfectly played map leads to total personal satisfaction.  Orcs Must Die can be played casually in 15 minute bursts, but it is easy to get sucked into multi-hour sessions that leave you tense, sweatry, and carple-tunneled out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040564286', 'num_games_owned': 1210, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1653680852}
review: Just a lot of fun to play. Simple, fun story and wave after wave of orcs to kill. It does seem like the traps are a bit unbalanced and I do find myself using the same ones again and again while ignoring others but it remains fun all the same. I do wish the barricade were more cost effective; this one simple change would add a ton of strategy. Still, you will get $10 worth of fun out of this one easily.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030325733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1457098643}
review: Nie ocenia się książki po okładce. Na starcie stwierdziłem, że nie będe grał w tego typu grę z powodu, że wieje po prostu nudą. Myliłem się i to bardzo. Wciągnęło mnie bardziej niż może wciągnąć orka do mielonki. Mnóstwo umiejętności, mnóstwo pułapek, różnorodne rasy atakujących potworów. To wszystko sprawia, że gra jest ciekawa, nie męcząca ani irytująca. Jest ogrom taktyk, które można obrać do przejścia poziomu. Naprawdę udana gra. Doświadczyłem kilka niedociągnięć typu brak tekstur po wejściu w pułapke na ścianie, czy przenikanie potworków przez tekstury. Lokacje są bardzo klimatyczne, widać, że poświęcono im mnóstwo czasu. Dialogi są zabawne, ale miejscami też nudne. Jest także źle dobrana głośność dialogów do muzyki z fali nadchodzących orków. Bardzo dobre posunięcie z achievementami. Są proste, niektóre również wymagające, a także przyjemne, by zrobić grę na 100%. Dla kolekcjonerów osiągnięć, pozycja nie do pominięcia. Jestem w połowie gry i mogę zapewnić, że jeszcze długo w nią pogram. Brawa dla twórców za pomysł, wykonanie i fabułę.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015324861', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1391742166}
review:
In this fantastic third person tower defense, you get assaulted by Hordes of Orcs...

...and you can push them, stab them, pierce them, slice them, burn them, cut them, stomp them, zapp them, shredder them, scorch them, throw acid at them, set them up the bomb and kill them in many many gory ways. 100% uncensored splatter fun :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198072595035', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1394326181}
review:
【オススメ度】
　★★★★☆
【グラフィック】　★★★✦☆
【満足感】  　　 ★★★★☆
【自由度】  　　 ★★✦☆☆
【サウンド】 　　★★★☆☆
【やり込み要素】★★★☆☆
【実質価格】1000円

【レビュー】
大量のオークをぶっ殺していくタワーディフェンス型のゲーム。
様々な所に罠や兵隊を設置してオークの襲撃を防ごう！
この作品は２もでているが一人でやるならこちらの方が恐らくプレイしやすい。
とにかく買っておいた方がいいゲームです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198121751955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 874, 'last_played': 1389829725}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is a very enjoyable mix of the tower defense and third-person shooter genres with plenty of comedy mixed in.  The objective of the game is to place traps in order to prevent waves of orcs from making their way through to your world.  As you progress, you unlock more traps which you can also upgrade.  Furthermore, you can supplement your traps by attacking the orcs directly.

I highly recommend this game.  The gameplay and comedy are highly enjoyable.  For those looking for a co-op experience, you'll want to check out Orcs Must Die! 2.  Which as a bonus includes levels from Orcs Must Die! in addition to it's own, new, levels.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972448343', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 327, 'playtime_forever': 5527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5527, 'last_played': 1333350000}
review:
Orcs Must Die! 

That's a pretty dumb name. 

Although I ended spending way too much time on this silly little game. Orcs Must Die would fall in the "Tower Defense" Genre but it has so many different twists. Firstly being, there's a pretty funny story and hilarious characters. You not only make traps, you also run around with a sword or gun or frost magic and fight as well. It's entirely possible to win the game without a single trap.  It's also entirely possible to win without a single sword swing but both would be incredible difficult. I loved wasting time on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079872156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1388265500}
review:
Overall a good game for slaughtering Orcs. Being a fan of the Orc race myself in video games, it was enjoyable to slaughter thousands of goofy Orcs as they rushed towards you in the many different levels this game's storyline had. Many different games these days have vast differences in graphical designs, yet this game struck a good balance between keeping it simple and looking good at the same time. The same goes for the different skins and models available throughout the game.

The cutscenes explaining the storyline are a bit short, and lacking information at times, but the idea of this game is pretty straightforward; you kill Orcs. Lots and lots of Orcs. You've got many different ways to do it, all ending up in the brutal slaughter of Orcs. There are many different contrapments and weapons to help you along the way. Considering the purpose of this game, I would say this is one of the best Indie games I've played in a while and I look forward to playing Orcs Must Die! 2 as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070403360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2603, 'last_played': 1590108630}
review:
タワーディフェンス＋TPS。限られた資金で罠を設置しつつ自分もクロスボウなどの武器や魔法を駆使して戦いオークどもの侵入を防ぎます。
システム・ストーリーともにシンプルで癖がなく遊びやすい。吹き替えの質も良くイケメンこと主人公に感情移入しやすいです。STEAM初心者の日本人には特におすすめ。
続編の2に比べるとタワーディフェンスの要素が強い、というか一部のトラップが強くある程度設置完了するとあとはオークのシチューができあがるのを眺めるだけになったりする。これをぬるいととるか醍醐味ととるかは人による。

author: {'steamid': '76561197986336546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1209, 'last_played': 1392478709}
review: Orcs Must Die! is a nice twist on the traditional tower defence genre. Instead of building towers to defeat creeps (orcs), you set traps along their path. The game is played in third person view, so you can also kill orcs with your own spells and weapons too (similarly to Sanctum). OMD is exactly what it says on the box. You kill orcs in hundreds of different ways as they make their way to the end of the level. The premise is simple and it's fun to work out various strategies to kill orcs. Items, weapons, spells and weavers (special abilities) can all be used. Some levels are frustrating, though a bit of logical thinking goes a long way. The visuals are very smooth and fit into the laid back, humourous style of the game. The storyline and voice acting are a bit cheesy, but OMD doesn't take itself too seriously, which adds to the charm. Great game to play casually.

review: I took a chance buying this game and i'm glad i did, It's fun and addictive, The beauty of this game is that theres no specific way to set up the traps, Set them up your way, The joy of watching your perfectly arranged traps mowing down hordes of Orcs like a well oiled machine is wonderful to behold, With good graphics, sound and humor, I totally recommend this game, you'll almost feel sorry for the Orcs, Almost.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068049076', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1690, 'last_played': 1433782257}
review: Пожалуй, лучшая игра из жанра "TD с непосредственным участием". Это своеобразный десерт, содержащий в себе сладкую начинку из визуализации, несколько тонких слоёв неописуемого восторга от каждого пройденного уровня, покрытый дольками ещё не набившим оскомину юмором. Эта игра не отпустит Вас и после пятого уровня, вас будет одолевать желание проходить её всё дальше и дальше. Убийственные ловушки, благодаря грамотному расположению которых появляется возможность создавать различные лабиринты и опаснейшие механизмы. Придурковатый главный герой, который готов сделать всё, чтобы орки не прорвались к порталу. Потрясающий интерфейс и приятная атмосфера. И всё это - "Orcs Must Die!".
