author: {'steamid': '76561198061392080', 'num_games_owned': 998, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4509, 'last_played': 1389809942}
review:
Orcs Must Die! É um Tower Defense (gênero onde o objetivo é impedir que os adversários percorram um mapa e atinjam determinado ponto especifico) de ação e estratégia, com visão em terceira pessoa e combate em tempo real para um jogador. Foi desenvolvido e publicado pela Robot Entertainment, responsável por jogos como Age of Empires Online e Hero Academy, e lançado somente em formato digital para Xbox 360 e PC em Outubro de 2011.

O enredo gira em torno da Ordem dos Magos de Guerra, um grupo de magos, responsáveis por proteger as Fortalezas da invasão de Orcs (e outros monstros), para que eles não atravessem as Rupturas localizadas dentro delas, estas são a fontes de poder mágico vital para manter a vida na terra e um portal entre o mundo dos homens e dos Orcs. A história se inicia quando o Velho Mestre (e narrador) sofre um acidente ao defender uma das Fortalezas e aparentemente morre, cabendo então ao seu aprendiz (o protagonista do jogo, chamado apenas de o Mago de Guerra), defender as fortalezas em seu lugar, lutando contra as invasões crescentes e cada vez mais organizadas dos Orcs.

O jogo não possui uma história profunda e detalhada, apenas um conceito, que é uma justificativa para os acontecimentos do jogo, o foco principal é a jogabilidade. O enredo é contato através de cutscenes com imagens estáticas ao fim de cada ato, e através de diálogos do protagonista ao inicio de cada fase. A trama é focada no humor muitas vezes negro. O Mago de Guerra é um personagem muito carismático, seus comentários e diálogos durante o gameplay são realmente bem engraçados.

O jogo possui um total de vinte e quatro fazes, dispostas em três atos. Você começa cada fase dentro de uma fortaleza diferente, o objetivo é impedir que os Orcs atravessem as Rupturas, e você tem uma certa quantidade de pontos de Ruptura dependendo da faze, você perde pontos caso algum inimigo atravesse ou você morra, se estes pontos chegarem a zero é Game Over e vai ter que recomeçar toda a faze novamente. Os inimigos surgem em hordas, cada faze tem um numero diferente de hordas, e você tem um intervalo de dez segundos (três no modo pesadelo) entre uma e outra, e alguns momentos de pausa para se organizar, comprar seus itens e posicionar melhor suas defesas.

Para conter os inimigos você tem um arsenal de armas, magias, guardiões (que são NPCs que te auxiliam ao longo da partida) e principalmente armadilhas com diversos efeitos e usos diferentes a sua disposição, que podem ser melhorados com a utilização de caveiras dadas ao fim de cada faze, além de tecelões que servem para melhorar suas habilidades. Uma boa estratégia é vital para vencer, você deve estudar muito bem a faze antes do inicio da partida, fazer um bom posicionamento de cada armadilha ou guardião durante as fazes é essencial para conter os adversários. Mas apenas isso não basta para segura-los, é necessário utilizar armas e magias, e ser rápido e preciso, tomando cuidado para não levar muitos golpes, pois seu personagem é muito frágil e procurar controlar seu reservatório de Magia para que ela não se esgote, felizmente você pode se recuperar rapidamente chegando perto de uma Ruptura.

Os inimigos do jogo são bem variados desde Orcs normais, Kobolds pequenos e fracos, passando pelos mortais Gnolls, até grandes e poderosos Ogros, entre muitos outros, cada um com comportamentos e habilidades diferentes. Por isso é bom tomar cuidado, além de inimigos mais poderosos causarem mais dano, custam mais pontos de Ruptura.

O gameplay é rápido e frenético, você vai se ver muitas vezes correndo de um lado pelo outro pela faze, algumas com vários caminhos, a fim de conter seus adversários, felizmente o jogo responde muito bem aos comandos, tocar de armas, para armadilhas ou magias é rápido e feito alternando as teclas numéricas ou scrolll do mouse (e gatilhos no caso do controle), tornando o jogo rápido e dinâmico.

A ambientação do jogo é por vezes repetitiva as fortalezas são bem parecidas umas com as outras, com mudanças de design em cada faze, mas sempre com mesmo visual, apesar disso elas são bem feitas e detalhadas. Os gráficos do jogo seguem o estilo cartunizado, as cores são vivas e combinam muito bem com todo o resto, apesar disso a violência gráfica é moderada, com Orcs sendo fatiado e suas partes voando pelo cenário (e desaparecendo logo em seguida).

O jogo apresenta total localização em nosso idioma, com menus e dublagem em português, sendo um dos pioneiros na Steam nesse quesito, o que para um jogo independente é algo digno de respeito. E de fato a dublagem é excelente, todo o diálogos e piadas foram muito bem executadas, e não possuem qualquer erro, além das vozes combinarem muito bem. A ressalva fica por conta do gameplay com frases sendo repetidas a exaustão, o que chateia um pouco, mas nada que tire o brilho do jogo. A trilha sonora apesar de limitada cumpre seu papel nada de especular, ela é agitada nos momentos de combate e calma nos demais momentos.

Orcs Must Die! é um jogo bem divertido e desafiador que vai proporcionar várias horas de diversão, ele pode parecer difícil a primeira vista, mas a medida que você progride aprende, ganhas novos itens e habilidades e traça estratégias ele se torna bem mais fácil. Ele seria melhor é mais completo com um modo multiplayer, que foi adicionado em sua sequencia Orcs Must Die! 2, mas ainda sim é um jogo excelente e merece ser jogado, principalmente se você gosta de ação e estratégia. Orcs Must Die! custa R$ 16,99 a versão normal e R$ 21,99 a versão GOTY com todas as DLCs.

DLCs:

O jogo possui duas DLCs, já inclusas na versão GOTY Edition:

Orcs Must Die! - Lost Adventures, inclui mais cinco fases que expandem o jogo original, elas são bem mais desafiadoras que as da campanha principal, e são uma boa pedida quem quer um pouco mais de desafio ou caveiras extras para melhorar seus itens. Além disso jogo apresenta dois novos inimigos o Morcego de Gelo e o Mago Ciclope, e um novo item.

Orcs Must Die! - Artifacts of Power, que acrescenta duas novas armas e duas novas armadilhas.

Aqueles que fizeram a pré compra do jogo receberam a roupa alternativa Cavaleiro da Ordem, que nunca foi lançada via DLC. Todos os monstros, armas e roupas, lançadas como conteúdo adicional neste jogo vieram por padrão em Orcs Must Die! 2.

O QUE PODE AGRADAR:

- Jogo viciante e realmente divertido, rende muitas horas de gameplay.
- Legendas e dublagem totalmente em português brasileiro, que ficaram muito boas por sinal.
- O jogo é realmente leve e possui excelente otimização, não há quedas de FPS mesmo com a grande quantidade de elementos na tela ao mesmo tempo.

O QUE PODE DESAGRADAR:

- Diálogos muitas vezes repetitivos durante o jogo.
- A ambientação tem poucas variações entre as fases.
- Ausência de um modo multiplayer, muito comum neste gênero de jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073019258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1389651707}
review:
７５点
6時間ちょっとでノーマルクリア
Orcs Must Die!の２を持っていて、１からやりたいと思って買ったが、やっぱり面白かった
アクションディフェンスゲームで、オーク達がゴールを目指す道端に、色んな仕掛けをして、倒していく。
そして、自分も弓やら剣やら魔法やらで頑張って倒していくゲームなのだが、
ストーリーもざっくり、あってないようなもんで、アクションや面白さ、気軽さに力を入れている。
一気に6時間やってしまったくらい、オモシロイ。
気軽にできるゲームっていう感じだが、グラフィックも色遣いがなんか良かったり、
ストーリーは「ぶっ」って噴いたくらい、阿呆な感じだし。
気に入りました。

author: {'steamid': '76561198006785556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1682105917}
review: The title of the game says orcs must die but I dont think they should

author: {'steamid': '76561198105593328', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1414324315}
review:
There are a lot of orcs in this game.
They all need to die.

The story isn't great but the game itself certainly is. The game is challenging but can also be played in an easier mode if that is more your cuppa tea. For the die-hards, there is also a nightmare mode.
Finishing the game for the first time should take a reasonable amount of time (<10h). The replayability is good though, the achievements are fun to try and get, and generally not of the grinding type. Since the way to play a level will completely depend on how you approach it (which traps you use, which weaver, etc) you can do a level multiple types without feeling like it's always the same thing.

It's a lot of fun to find and try out new methods of making Orc-paste (a)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970735557', 'num_games_owned': 1153, 'num_reviews': 258, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1459283655}
review: This FPS / tower defence game is real fun. There's a speed and energy to the traps and your participation in the level, plenty of emergent tactics, and an appropriate level of panic and improvisation in some levels. Occasionally you get completely minced by a level, which can be annoying if you have half a dozen stabs at it, and I did 90% of the levels relying on 40% of the equipment, but that's the only downside to this excellent game. Oh, and the music is fabulous. Gonna buy OMD2 on the strength of this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966055543', 'num_games_owned': 1124, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1407772161}
review:
Burst the orcs into pieces!
Quite a few weapons and tons of traps promise orc-slashing fun.
Nice mechanics, pretty good overview, and a funny background story (which is not all too important, I claim :P ).

All in all a rather nice game to play.

review:
This game is a brilliant blend of the Action and Tower Defense genres. It never turns into a brainless shooting gallery, but it also never slows down, and it's always keeping the player engaged. Advanced players will want to tackle the leaderboards or play with less conventional setups. 

It's also funny. Seriously, go play this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006872207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 925, 'last_played': 1390652233}
review:
Mezcla del tipico juego de defensa de torres con accion en primera persona.

Es una combinación muy interesante, en vez de torres se tienen trampas que se han de ir colocando a traves de varios pasillos y mazmorras, como todos estos juegos hay diferentes enemigos, voladores, bajitos, fuertes, etc...

Además de que te dejan potenciar bien tu lado guerrero o bien tu lado de estratega con un pequeño arbol de tecnologias.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972476232', 'num_games_owned': 634, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1387236933}
review:
Must orcs die!? And why is the death of ogres and gnolls a foregone conclusion of this? The title's inherent racism is not really questioned at any point. The only option towards a peaceful resolution is to buy drugs that become available late in the game and which you can never afford enough of to avoid bloodshed anyway. The player character is a smug, chauvinistic jock who relishes in the slaugher of people of different skin tones. Utterly disgusting.
Servicable gameplay though if you can look past the developer's obviously politically inspired agenda behind this game.

review: A whole new level of the tower-defense games genre. It feels like you're in the middle of the battle in "The Lord of The Rings"!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987389179', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1470, 'last_played': 1388387005}
review:
Here we have a very fun game, but it can get you very angry when you try to complete it perfectly. I completed with multiple rage quits.

The proposal is simple, tower defense, prevent the orcs from reaching the portal, there are different types of enemies with different behaviors. The fun is to develop a strategy with the available traps, exploring the scenario in order to exterminate all. The vision in the third person possibility you to actively participate in the struggle, something different in these types of games.

With a fun and intuitive gameplay, the graphics also pleases with his cartoonish appearance, the sound of stacks of orcs being crushed and torn is comforting. The plot is simple, just an excuse to kill orcs in many ways.

7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198035423381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1398371351}
review: It's like tower defense meets action RPG. Orcs Must Die! is quite fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994300102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1396741592}
review:
Well first of all: Only god knows why this game is rated for 16 years old teens and above in Germany... 

[b]Pros:[/b]
+ Casual Instant-Action Fun
+ Lovely design of environment and player- and npc models
+ Great narrator
+ Orcsorcsorcsorcs
+ Good plurality of weapons/traps

[b]Contra:[/b]
- You get new weapons/traps to the beginning of the next level, this is good, but in this level most of the new weapons/traps are useless
- ... which is also for the whole game. There a few items you absolutely not need.
- For Core-Gaming, this game can get really boring. The level-design seems repititive after a long session.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016827623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2008, 'last_played': 1414803593}
review: I really enjoy this game. I'd describe it as a desktop tower defense game in which you are a player amongst the traps that you lay, directly engaging the Orc horde. The graphics are great, the maps are challenging, the traps and obstacles at your disposal are fun, and it includes a nice sprinkling of humor. A great single player game, especially when you need a break from your coop/MMO game of choice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046700694', 'num_games_owned': 446, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1810, 'last_played': 1558894262}
review:
Este juego me sorprendio completamente

+ Dificultad aceptable en modo mago (normal) y en el modo pesadilla los bichos te cagan a palos :D
+ Buena jugabilidad, nada complicado
+ Buenos graficos, nada muy exagerado, aceptables
+ ¡ DIVERTIDO ! ... Lo mas importante de todo

- Un poco corto si te pones a jugar ''asi nomas''... pero si te pones a completar todos los niveles con 5 calaveras, el juego se alarga bastante, sin contar el modo pesadilla D:

Recomendado, 4/5

★★★★☆

author: {'steamid': '76561197988585837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3675, 'last_played': 1320390000}
review:
Galet roligt spel i co-op men fungerar även som singelplayerspel (dock ej tvåan som är helt dedikerad till två spelare). Intensivt och med trevliga banor som efter hand kan bli riktigt tuffa att ta sig igenom. Det är enkelt att välja vilka vapen och fällor man ska använda, och kanske är det också enda felet med spelet (förutom att det är extremt repetetivt) - man väljer nästan alltid samma fällor oavsett vilken bana man är på. 

Orcs Must Die!

author: {'steamid': '76561197964534018', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1387, 'last_played': 1527443557}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062128104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1906, 'last_played': 1549053145}
review:
Oh yes! This game's atmosphere is awesome, never has killing hords of orcs felt better than in this game. While you are busy killing waves of orcs, a pretty good soundtrack will play in the background, which gets you hyped up for the coming battle. Prepare for one hell of battles, if you can't kill Orcs because they look cute, than you are going to easily fail this game, the difficulty in the game is really high and only the toughest players will make it to the end.

With a little plot, which consides of 4 "Cutscenes" this game will keep you excited for the next levels, however be warned that the lines get easily repetive, it helps to only play 3-4 levels a day maximum, to enjoy the game at it fullest.

It's one of the most fun wave based game there is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043327000', 'num_games_owned': 1108, 'num_reviews': 275, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1484517173}
review:
An excellent Tower Defense, in Orc Must Die our goal is to kill orcs. The concept is simple, but the execution was ver good. 

This is basically a Third Peron shotter mixed with Tower Defense, and our goal is to defend our portal that is inside a castle. Orc Must Die has 24 levels, and everyone level has a different approach, in each level you will fight hundreds orcs. 

Now you must be thinking that you are alone on this fight, well no, you will have many traps and magic powers to help you on this journey. On the beginning of each wave you have unlimited time to prepare your set up. Since is the first wave you won't have too many coins but don't worry because on the firsts wave, archers and barrels are the perfect combo. 

Graphically speaking this game goes for a sort of cartoonish look that fits fairly well, also the OST does the job equally.

If Orc Must Die has COOP - OMD2 has COOP - would be a much better experience. 

After i decreased my backlog a bit i sure want to re-play this game again! 

Recommend! 

~ 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197961930960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1388506703}
review:
There aree dirty dirty orcs coming into your castle. Take a spin on tower defense by defending your tower with a custom job of sikes, traps, and magical weapons. Pretty much to the point with what it offers. Simple functions for a game that's more of a pallet clenser from larger games, or if you just want to blow some time with a casual game.

Get it if your a fan of tower defense.

review:
Original, Fast Paced and Damn Addictive.

All 3 describe this game to maximum precision. It is such a fun game, hours can be eaten away form your hands playing through the extensive single player campaign. It does lack the single most important thing that would make this game more fun. 

Multiplayer.

Seriously, without it, this game is bland, you want to experience the Orc mayhem with your buddies. Skip this one, go for the sequel.

WompWompWommmmmp/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198022198593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 830, 'last_played': 1387887261}
review:
アクション要素強めのタワーディフェンス。

タワーにあたるモノの種類はそれほど多くないですが、壁や床・天井に設置できるトラップの種類が豊富です。
そのため、マップを立体的に利用する必要があり、タワーディフエンスにありがちな単調な感覚にならないようになっています。

基本的に小さい敵や普通のオークをトラップで仕留め、巨大だったり足が早かったりする特殊なモンスターやオーガをプレイヤーがアクション要素で倒すという内容になっています。
アクション要素も、ヘッドショットで大きなダメージを出す要素があったり、呪文を使って敵の足を止めて設置したトラップとのコンボを決めたりと奥が深いです。

また、最初から日本語化（日本語吹き替え）されていますので、日本語化ファイルを探したり、面倒な作業がないのもGOODです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198041944840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 951, 'last_played': 1630982014}
review: Tower defense with action rpg elements? Count me in! If you've ever enjoyed playing a tower defense game (even those little flash ones) then you HAVE to try this game. Rather than having defense towers, you will be equipped with an impressive collection of traps. This allows for a good amount of strategy and frantic gameplay. Fun, addictive, and challenging.

review:
Fun, cartoony and addictive gameplay. Maps are reasonably sized, and portals add to the strategy.  Only real peeve is that some traps never feel useful (looking at you ceiling shock zapper).  

Levels can be completed within 5 - 15 minutes, so this is a fun game to pick up and play if you have a small amount of time to kill. Highly recommend for fans of tower defense genre.

Tower defense (ok, path defense...whatever you'd like to call it), mixed with 3rd person 'shooter' with humor and plentiful dead orcs? Yes, please. author: {'steamid': '76561198009884241', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1527345035}
review:
Если вы любите игры типа Tower Defence, то "Orcs Must Die" определённо для вас! Здесь вам необходимо защитить портал от волн орков с помощью всевозможных ловушек типа настенных стрел или раскачивающегося молота.
Ловушек, как и орков, в игре ОЧЕНЬ много. 
В меню медленные, быстрые, маленькие, большие, сильные, слабые орки. Чем от них защищаться - выбираете Вы. 
В течение игры вам будет нехватать лишь кооператива.В остальном же "Orcs Must Die" - один из лучших представителей игр на выживание.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969092590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1354003200}
review: Not just a tower defense game. An extremely well-done tower defense game with fun writing and solid mechanics. If you like tower defense games, it's a must buy. If you don't, you should still check it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993276145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2646, 'last_played': 1483809460}
review: Orcs Must Die! is a fun, fantasy FPS mixed with tower defense. The storyline and humor are very enjoyable.  The combination of action and strategy is a fresh take of this kind of gameplay. I recommend picking the package deals with all of the additional downloadable content included. The sequel is great, too, but I start here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038787228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1387561973}
review:
While steam says i currently have 0.2 hours recorded playing this, I own it on xbox 360 as well and Ive completed the game. 
Honestly this is one of my fav games of all time. Absolutely love it so I dedcided to be the first to share my thoughs and opinions. 
Now on to the review :) 

Its a hybrid third person action game with tower defense. this means all your descisions and actions play out all in real time so when your defending against those nasty orcs, timing and well thought out traps are crucial. Yor goal is to keep the orcs from reaching a certain point on the map called, the Rift.The Rift was built in a forsakened fortress to keep everyone safe but now the orcs want to get to it and destroy you if you get in their way. Your teacher fell in battle so now it's up to you, The apprentice to defend the rift! The story is not really what this game is about but you are greeted whith the occasional cut scene. The game starts off with only a few waves and the basic set of orcs which are fairly easy to kill, as long as you don't sit there and let them attack you....but who would do that right? Each level in the game has a set number waves, each increasingly more difficult. The good thing is you always know what you're up against and just how many Orcs your going to slaughter in that particular level. The Orcs also range from ground units to archers to flyers and big tanks that take alot of damage. Also, each orc has a weakness so exploiting it in your traps and strategy will help alot. While the onslaught of orcs never stops, you have plenty of weapons and traps at your disposal, which brings me to my next topic, The traps! Each trap has a set fuction and there are a number of them which can only be placed on walls, floors, ceilings etc. 
They range from your simple barricades to huge swinging ceiling axes, to decoys and meat grinders, to archers and guardians. You also have weapons to choose from to kill the orcs yourself, thats what i love about the game. Youre not just looking down and watching the fight, youre in it. So it is up to you to work with your traps and stop the orcs from reaching the Rift. Although, in later levels you must defend more than one rift at a time which means the game can get pretty tough.  The rift will heal you when your close enough so if your ever in a pinch, you can go back and refill your hp which is nice. The game also scores you on your accuracy and headshots and the amount of kills in a row. Depending on how well you do, your awarded with up to 5 skulls, these are your currency. However, you cannot move on to the next level(s) unless you have earned enough skulls in previuous levels. So doing well, is essential. Yes the game can get challenging fast and you can lower the dificulty, but that reduces the amout of skulls to be earned, so its sort of a trade off. With the skulls you can purchase new upgrades and traps as well as bonuses that effect you and your traps, later on in the game. Now again i will say have not played this on pc yet but on xbox, there were no problems as far as framrate and lag. So I would check the system specs before you go ahead and make the purchase, as with all games. The visuals are quite nice and really stand out compared to most other tower defenses. The art style is a little silly and cartoony but dont let that fool you. When your killing orcs or watching your traps bruttally tear them apart..the gore and sense of pain does make the game feel less childish. Controls felt great on my xbox game pad although I would imagine mouse and keyboard is slightly better, accuracy and speed do play a big role here. Now i will say the game may have some flaws but I personally think Its close to perfect. And Im sure OMD2 fixes any issues this one may have. 

Theres more to the game than I've mentioned but I wont spoil it all. Lets just say if you like tower defense games and third person shooters/action, you should deffinitely give this a go. Robot Entertainment's Orcs Must Die! gets a 5 out 5 

edit: I mainly bought this to replay levels in OMD2, and yes i will be reviewing the sequal when I finish it!

review: I...I think I just realized I don't like tower defense games after all the ones I've tried. I can recognize this as being a well made hybrid of that and a third-person shooter, and there are definitely things about it I can appreciate, but even after trying it twice a couple years apart, I've bounced off it both times. Thanks, Orcs Must Die. You seem like a good game...for someone else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086289974', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1531771427}
review:
Orcs must die è uno di quei giochi che all'inizio dalla presentazione sembra uno dei tanti giochi senza nulla di speciale che si trovano ovunque su steam. All'inizio l'ho sottovalutato ma mi stavo decisamente sbagliando.
Questo gioco offre un gameplay divertente misto fra un tower defense e un action in terza persona con livelli che diventano gradualmente sempre più complessi senza però sfiorare in nessun caso l'impossibile..
Ci ho giocato poco visto che l'ho acquistato da poco ma per me è decisamente un sì. Questo gioco merita i soldi che costa!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023535139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 2187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2187, 'last_played': 1387757111}
review:
I am not a fan of tower defense games, but this game (and it's sequel) give a refreshing spin on the genre. It combines 3rd person shooter with tower defense. This allows you to actively participate in the defense. You'll be shooting down enemies while managing your defenses.

The level design gives you enough choice to try out different tactics. Sometimes there is one obvious tactic. Other times you have to try out different combos. Even though not all traps are as powerful/balanced, you can't always use the same traps. This gives enough variation through out the game.

[b]Orcs Must Die 2 adds a few new features:[/b]
+ Co-op
+ Endless Mode
+ New playable class (mage)
+ More customization

author: {'steamid': '76561198043285599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 5371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1683, 'last_played': 1527981136}
review:
I think this game is a sin... yes a straight up  biblical sin; it's  far too fun to be anything but sinful, wrong or cancer causing. I'm serious. There is nothing I can find to dislike about this game. The graphics are crisp. even in the pitch melee you can always pick out high priority targets, the music is very nice for the background and the sounds ... on the slicing of metal and the funny wails of agony never sounded so good.

It is also frustratingly difficult at times, don't be fooled by the early missions, it starts ramping up fast but it's a good challenge, the sort that has you reformulating your strategy when you lose and dancing when you win.

There's also the humor... it is actually funny to listen to the voice overs at time, it sounds like something Blizzard would have done about 8 years back.. around the time of Warcraft 2/3...you know.. before they stopped making games and started designing payment portals..

Give it a try, you won't regret it.  Defense with a twist. Now if you'll excuse me... I have a bridge to mine with catapult traps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007149870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1233, 'last_played': 1390642951}
review: This is a very fun puzzle game with different ways to defend each dungeon. I highly recommend this game to anyone. One downside is the highly sensitive mouse scroll speed, which I still don't know how to reduce. However, you soon get used to it and it doesn't become a hindrance. The graphics and designs are amazing; the audio and voice acting are outstanding; and the game mechanics (level design and weapon design) are dynamic and intuitive. Some players may find it easy - however this is a thoroughly enjoyable game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015143697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1338793200}
review: Overall I did enjoy Orcs during the short time I spent with it, and it is a great game. However, it generally didn't stand out of the pack for me, and came at the end of a long winded era of tower defense games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019456889', 'num_games_owned': 1464, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1397975133}
review:
Казалось бы, что это обычная инди-игра про туповатого мага, который убивает орков. Но это немного не так. Маг и вправду не блещет интеллектом, что, в принципе, не мешает ему убивать вышеупомянутых орков ТЫСЯЧАМИ. Нужно отметить, что точный жанр - Tower Defence. Симпатичная графика, множество оружия и ловушек, приличное количество карт, широкий спектр врагов (от обычных орков до болотных тролей).

Лучшая игра в своем жанре (если учитывать обе части сразу).

author: {'steamid': '76561198011012667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 2899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1409648842}
review:
모든면에서 알찬 재미를 보장하는 디펜스 게임! 
디펜스지만 직접적인 공격이 더 찰진 게임으로 게임하는 내내 유쾌하면서도 호쾌한 느낌을 지속적으로 받는다. 트랩들도 매우 아이디어가 기똥찬 편이다. 

게임을 하면 할 수록 모을 수 있는 해골로 트랩을 업그레이드해서 적 오크들의 물량 공세를 이겨내는 것이 목표. 

이 게임의 단점은 멀티가 없다는 것과, 다회차를 하기엔 좀 부족한 구성이라는 점이다. 
다회차를 할 요소로는 난이도별 클리어, 도전과제 정도... 

상당히 유쾌 상쾌 통쾌한 게임이고, OST 또한 기똥차므로 후회없는 선택이 될 것이다. 
(그렇다고 쉬운 게임은 아니다) 
분명 잔인한 고어 장면도 나오지만 크게 신경 쓰이지 않는 마법같은 게임이다. 
참고로 1편을 가지고 있으면 2편에서 1편의 스테이지를 즐길 수 있다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049490160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1582508747}
review:
The idea is that you kill orcs. How you do that is up to you, and therein is where the fun in this game is found. It has both shooter aspects (you move around shooting a crossbow and possibly other weapons) and Tower Defense elements (you need to design good trap combos to win). Simple enough, but well executed, high quality, and fairly fun.

The only shortcoming is that on some levels there is only one 'correct' build to easily win, and finding that can be a pain sometimes. And, unlike it's successor it does not have Co-Op.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003880852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1386870389}
review:
Fun fact: I dislike Tower Defense games for being boring, repetitive and unpersonal. Oh, and boring, just to mention it again.

Another fun fact: Orcs Must Die is NOT a tower defense game, even though it could easily be mistaken for one. But I would rather consider it a 'Tactical Defense TPS'. You're not a commander building towers, you're a guy building traps which are meant to aid you in wrecking Orcs. Lots of them. And boy, it's fun.

Let's begin with the art style and sound. Both are fluent, coherent and quite fine. I won't say superb, because the game obviously is neither an AAA title nor top-actual, but it's well above what would be necessary as a minimum.
A big point of the game is it's humor, that clearly hit my favour. Whether it's Orc's philosophing and quoting famous memes, or the utterly retarded-charming protagonist, or his even more retarded monologues, the game makes you chuckle. Whilst orc's get gibbed left and right.
Which is literally all this game is about: Killing orcs in the most fashionable/efficient/hilarious way possible. You got a wide array of different traps, weapons and champions at your disposal, and often the level'S themselves have special environmental hazards, high bridges ideal to kick orcs off from, lava pits...
Even as an enemy of TDGs, the game was great to play.

Which leads us to it'S only downside: 'was'. The game is terribly short. I've beaten the entire campaign + bonus missions at this point, with a perfect completion on about 75% of all levels (many of those on first try). Yes, there is a 'Nightmare' difficulty, but I'm not sure whether I will go for that or rather switch to the sequel ofthis game instead.

But hey, it's a budget game,so we can't exspect 40h playtime, can we?
Result: 8/10 Solid and extremely satisfying way to waste time. ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198107466003', 'num_games_owned': 1158, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1629058052}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971279033', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1332745200}
review:
A tower defense game mixed with RPG elements and a 3rd person perspective on your hero. A really enjoyable game where you are a young wizard defending the onslaught of orcs. You set up each mission by placing your "towers" (in this games case, traps) to slow the orcs down. This is only your first line of defense as you control the young wizard once the round starts. Cast magic, go melee, fix traps, and much more.

I would recommend getting this game before purchasing the sequel. Sure the second one has two player co-op, but this will be cheaper and allow you to get a feel for the game. If you really enjoy the game and, like myself, find yourself wanting co-op play to add new deminsions and strategy, grab the second one. If you are quick, grab both games from Humble Bundle (as of this posting 12/10/13) and get both games, all DLC, for $4.25.

I highly recommend giving it a try. Watch the video/trailer to see if the playing style is what you are wanting too. If not, then don't waste your time because you will not be satisfied. If you are intrigued or thinking, "yeah I will give it a try. looks fun!" then you should buy this right away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048004902', 'num_games_owned': 1195, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1370539570}

review: Excellent tower defense game - simple and responsive controls, crisp graphics, fun storyline. A good mix of strategy and skill. The 'level grade' system and Nightmare difficulty add extra layers of replayability to the game, forcing you to adapt your strategies and use a wide range of skill and trap builds for different encounters, while simultaneously demanding better playskill from you in the form of aiming (ie. headshots can cause significantly more damage) and laying traps under pressure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041251844', 'num_games_owned': 801, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1323, 'last_played': 1448109334}
review:
One of the most addictive and energetic games I have played lately is Orcs Must Die. At first I was somewhat alarmed by the fact of non-stop killing with the help of various mechanisms, but when I started to play it I was totally absorbed in the process. It can be classified as Tower Defense game, but among other rivals in this type of computer games it is IMHO one of the best. 

 The aim of Orcs Must Die is very simple – not to let hordes of orcs, trolls and the like into our world. You are given a tower with one or several portals to be defended from numerous waves of monsters. Upgrading from level to level you are also provided with new different devices, skills, mechanisms, as well as earning money to money to buy ambushes and modernize them. The two most brilliant features of the game are in my opinion the highest level of action tension (what I feared most while playing is that somebody of my household would call me for something) and the elements of tactics and strategy.

read more http://www.viewforum.net/gaming-dept-171/orcs-must-die-2767/

author: {'steamid': '76561198009547755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1224, 'last_played': 1385925065}
review:
The gameplay is gritty, easy to learn, and difficult to master.  The game is quirky, doesn't take itself too seriously, and is easy to pick up, but hard to put back down.  It has a few shortcomings (no CoOp), and Nightmare isn't quite as difficult in this original as it was in the sequel, but the gameplay is still going to challenge players of every skill level.

For those of us who love Tower Defense/FPS hybrids, this game is a solid purchase at anything under $10, and a steal when it dips below $5.  If you play through the achievements (all of which are reasonable), you can expect about 15 hours of very enjoyable gameplay.

review:
This game is fun!
The combat is clunky, but very nice and meaty. The variety in enemies, traps and weaponry is also quite impressive.
Also, it's a pretty good challenge.
It is kinda repetitive, though, and the campaign will only really take you about 12-15 hours.
For what you get, though, it's definitely worth the $10/£7.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044641727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1285, 'last_played': 1391295196}
review:
Tower Defense - Check
Shooting Stuff/Third Person Action - Check

If you like either of those, then you should like this game. Even if you dislike strategy games I feel like you'll like OMD! It's more of a "blood pounding, hope my arrow traps reset in time, must race with orcs to stop them from getting to the rift" than a monotonous "set trap here to kill this orc." 

I'd recommend it to anyone who likes killing stuff, shooting stuff, and just generally wreaking havoc with a swinging ball mace repeatedly killing orcs stuck in the tar pit below it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057849814', 'num_games_owned': 1156, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 1401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1117, 'last_played': 1527427416}
review:
[h1]AT A GLANCE[/h1]
(Full review follows below)

[list]
[*] [b]Game Name:[/b] Orcs Must Die!
[*] [b]Original Release:[/b] 2011
[*] [b]Genre Tags:[/b] Tower Defense; Action; Strategy; RPG; Casual  
[*] [b]My Overall Grade:[/b] A-
[*] [b]Estimated Playtime (Campaign):[/b] 15-25 hours
[*] [b]Multiplayer Aspect:[/b] None
[*] [b]Recommended To:[/b] Established fans of the genre; Those intrigued by the genre; Casual gamers
[/list]	

[h1]REVIEW[/h1]
[b]Orcs Must Die![/b] is an amazing take on a tower defense/3rd-person action combo.  Attributes of both genres are blended together perfectly to form an addictive and entertaining little game. This is a game that is very easy to enjoy.

[b]Orcs Must Die![/b]  does a great job taking 3rd-person action elements and blending them with some tower defense to establish a good basis. Then they sprinkle in the lighthearted atmosphere and charming characters with the simplistic-yet-captivating mechanics of the game… and it shapes up to be a really fun, delightful experience. It’s definitely the kind of game you can dive right into and get hooked for hours. 

There is a relatively large amount of different towers and abilities in the game when compared to many other games in the tower defense genre. You have plenty of options and can have fun experimenting with different strategies. The level designs also vary enough that they call for different approaches to beat them, so you will have to try out different tactics in order to succeed. And there is a fair amount of different enemies which keeps things fresh as you progress through the game.

There is also a scoring system and leaderboards to add replay value.

This game is just downright fun.

[i][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/murphyslawyercuration#curation]Follow my curation page to see more of my recommendations![/url][/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198032573928', 'num_games_owned': 870, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1584, 'last_played': 1384395806}
review:
This is a game about killing orcs. The concept is simple enough, but the execution is high quality. 

The game is basically a 3rd person shooter in which you have to defend a magical rift in a castle from a horde of orcs and other monsters that are trying to get through it. If too many monsters make it to the rift you lose. 

One man against a relentless horde of monsters may not seem fair, but you have a lot of advantages. In addition to your trusty crossbow, you'll have a large arsenal of spells, traps, and guardians to help out. Furthermore you earn skulls for completing levels, and you can then spend these skulls on further upgrading your arsenal.

At the start of each level you'll have time to plan and set up your defenses and get a feel for the layout of the area. You'll be told where the orcs are coming from, what route they are likely to take, how many waves there are, and even what monsters you can expect to come knocking down your door.

This is important because, despite the simple premise of "orcs must die," this is really a tactician's game. The first few levels you may be able to survive using just your crossbow, but as the difficulty level increases you will have to diversify your tactics or perish. You'll start facing more orcs, tougher monsters, monsters that come from multiple entrances, and even multiple rifts that must be defended simultaneously. 

I will give one bit of warning that is not mentioned in the game-- if you intend to play on the default (war mage) difficulty level as I did, in order to earn the maximum of 5 skulls per level you not only need to prevent any orcs from reaching the rift, you've also got to do it within the par time. Once you start the initial wave the timer starts, and it doesn't stop even during the "break" periods you sometimes get between waves.

The game is single player only. The graphics and music are adequate, but not AAA quality (this is an indie game, after all, and I don't expect AAA quality here).

There is a storyline which is short, simple, and entertaining. Borderlands fans will recognize the voice of Axton the Commando as the War Mage.

If you like third person shooters or defense-centered gameplay you'll like Orcs Must Die!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008117830', 'num_games_owned': 1135, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1097, 'last_played': 1370578306}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997009554', 'num_games_owned': 971, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1389, 'last_played': 1383949550}
review: Una divertida variación en 3ra persona del clásico Tower Defense pero con trampas letales, guardianes, armas y hechizos en lugar de torres. Los enemigos principales del juego son ejércitos de orcos agresivos que quieren traspasar la "Fisura". Tu deber es defenderla a toda costa usando el terreno a tu favor y las herramientas que cada nivel ofrece. No tiene multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029303853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3054, 'last_played': 1386011930}
review: Очень яркая и атмосфеная игра! Звуковое сопровождение, эти аранжировки, они только придают атмосфености. Красочный, яркий игровой мир, монолог главного героя, состоящий из высокомерных и самолюбивых высказываний просто идеально вписывается. Давольно большой арсенал позволяет делать кромсание орков очень красивым и насыщенным. Присутствует небольшой сюжет, все в меру и очень гармонично смотрится! 10/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035004965', 'num_games_owned': 1792, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1657, 'last_played': 1343372400}
review: Orcs must die is a tower defence game, without towers.  You place traps in expansive hallways and court yard like areas to defend rifts from a massive amount of Orcs.  Hundreds on screen at once running toward your rift.  You have traps, spells and weapons to fight them back and away from the rift and you are going to need every little bit of help you can get to work the field.  So prepare properly and get ready to hold down the fort.  Go buy this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197984095479', 'num_games_owned': 3177, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1380142691}
review:
Орки бегут из порталов, а мы ставим ловушки, всё просто и весело. Ловушек достаточно много и они разнообразны. Всё зависит от карты и типа врагов. У нашего героя есть оружие что позволяет воевать с врагами боем, не обязательно только ловушками. Игра почти не имеет сюжета но это не минус, ведь геймплей интересный. Сюжет который есть, вполне достаточен. Проходится игра достаточно быстро, но это и хорошо потому что не успевает надоесть.
Игра не обязательна к прохождению, если любите такой жанр!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017864121', 'num_games_owned': 680, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1249, 'last_played': 1512245055}

author: {'steamid': '76561197975808202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1063, 'last_played': 1384629486}
review:
Divertentissimo connubio di tower defense e sparattutto in terza persona, circa 20 ore di gioco a difficoltà normale cercando di completare ogni livello col massimo punteggio e dedicando tempo agli achievement di Steam.
Ottimo ritmo e difficoltà ben bilanciata, ogni livello può essere completato utilizzando diverse tattiche ed è divertente rigiocare i livelli già completati con le trappole che si acquisiscono via via.
I commenti del personaggio principale, il peggior apprendista mago guerriero di tutti i tempi, nelle cui mani si trova il destino del mondo, vi faranno morire dalle risate nella loro paradossale ottusità!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020728639', 'num_games_owned': 14596, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 1449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1449, 'last_played': 1379471805}
review: One of the most fun tower defense games I have ever played! The controls are perfect, the humor is spot on, the character animations reek with personality, there's lots of replayability if you want to get the highest scores and ratings per stage, the story is hilarious and the soundtrack is absolutely amazing! What also makes a great tower defense game is freedom in how you accomplish your goal. This game definitely leaves room for success via various strategies. Definitely a must buy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198016864397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1220, 'last_played': 1378337572}
review:
Orcs Must Die! ist für alle die, die auf Tower-Defense gepaart mit ein bisschen 3rd Person-Shooter Action stehen. Mit knapp 21 Spielstunden hatte ich das Spiel durchgespielt (samt allen Achievments). Jedoch werden Neulinge in dem Genre durchaus länger daran knabbern.

Das Spiel hat auf jeden Fall wiederspiel Wert und ist in dem höheren Schwierigkeitsgrad Alptraum bockschwer. Um hier immer die beste Wertung einzusacken muss man meistens länger herumprobieren.

Für 12,99€ als Game Of The Year Edition ist es auf jeden Fall sein Geld wert und wer sich immer noch nicht sicher ist wartet einfach bis es im Sale 75% reduziert also für 3,25€ zu haben ist. 

Tipp: Wer im Besitz von Orcs Must Die! ist schaltet in Orcs Must Die! 2 automatisch die Klassik Level frei.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032830185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1520197544}

author: {'steamid': '76561198074082907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1370188869}
review: Hra stavící na jednoduchém principu: Nepřítel za žádnou cenu nesmí přejít přes Vás!     Proti hordám orců využijete nejen svou kouzelnou kuši, ale také všelijaké pasti, které jim postavíte do cesty, a věřte mi, u některých je opravdu k pokochání sledovat smrt jednotlivých orků v neroztodivnějších pastích, které kdo kdy viděl. Grafika průměrná, ale o tu v tomto případě nejde. Jedno mínus, a to, že chybí možnost zahrát si s přáteli, ta přišla až v druhém díle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008997518', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1253, 'last_played': 1586599716}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018893258', 'num_games_owned': 3721, 'num_reviews': 744, 'playtime_forever': 1557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1557, 'last_played': 1324195200}
review:
アクションTPS+TDゲーム。
イケメンウォーメイジが、うっかりで死んだ師匠に代わってオークの侵入を罠と己の力を使い食い止めるのが目的だ。基本的にはタワーディフェンスで罠を設置してオークを倒していくが、操作キャラでもオークを倒すことが可能だ。

プレイヤーによって罠重視にするかキャラ重視にするか、どの罠を使うかで様々なプレイスタイルが異なっていくほどにゲームバランスは絶妙なのは素晴らしい。他のプレイヤーのプレイ動画等を見ると、こんなやり方があったのかと驚かされることもあるだろう。

完全日本語対応で、吹き替えも面白いセリフが多く楽しませてくれる。タワーディフェンスが好きな人もTPSが好きな人もどっちも楽しむことができる良いゲームだ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198010474371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1498131975}
review: Good lord, this game is addicting! Tower defense + third-person action = Complete Win! If you enjoy tower defense or third-person RPGs, this game will kick you square in the ass with awesomeness. GET IT!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025071258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1352707200}
review:
Traps, weapons, minions, towers, and (of course) orcs abound in this third-person tower defence game. The dialogue is surprisingly funny and adds a bit of zest to the already-fun task of creating the world's least orc-friendly castle hallways.

Tip: Use a row of wall blades and tar pits (with some barricades, if necessary) to create a single-file orc slaugherhouse. It's as much fun to build as it is to watch in action.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961124823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1217, 'last_played': 1344495600}
review: An alternative perspective on the Tower Defense genre. The objective is to prevent several waves of Orc's and other creatures from reaching your portal. You have an array of Traps you can deploy to help slow & kill the approaching enemies. Any that slip through can be taken out with your choice of Hand held Weapon or Spell. It's so much fun, once I started playing this I couldn't put it down till I completed it.

review:
Eine herrliche Mischung aus Tower-Defense und Echtzeit-Action.
In der Bauphase baut man seine ausgesuchte Mischung aus Fallen, um die Orks aufzuhalten, und in der Actionphase rennt man live zwischen Orks und Fallen rum und hilft aktiv mit, dass die Orks das Tor nicht erreichen.
Macht Laune!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055293023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1624503352}
review: Orcs must die is a action strategy defending game with a tower defense feel. orcs must die brings these kind of games to a whole new generation into games. Orcs must die is addicting yet really fun. Your main goal is to not allow Orcs from getting into a portal. While Defending you build traps, barracades, hire guardes, and much more. While defending you also learn spells at one point in the game when the orcs get harder and stronger. Orcs must die is easily one of my favorite games to play on steam and has a lot of replayability. Orcs must die is probably one of my favorite games of all time, so if you're a fan of these games get it now!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045753129', 'num_games_owned': 1864, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 741, 'last_played': 1502151341}
review:
This is a game that I consistently come back to. 
Orcs Must Die is a 3rd person action tower defense game. You are given a countdown timer to run and place your objects, road blocks, and towers before the doors break down and a horde of Orcs, Goblins, Kobalds, Ogres and more come storming through. It's  up to you a battlemage to use your spells and wepaons to stop them from running into a portal that takes them into your kingdom. 

After a certain level, you unlock Weavers which give your character special bonuses and skill trees. To an extent it's a level-by-level RPG as well. You choose from a backpack of skills and utilities that you have hot keyed to your 1-9 keys. 

I got this game for $3.74 during a special, but I'd recommend it at full price no matter what. It's really worth it.

This game has no multi-player, however Orcs Must Die 2 is multi-player.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964153663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 5676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4421, 'last_played': 1415558928}
review:
Orcs Must Die is the classic tower defense game with the added twist your character being controlled in the first person perspective and equipped to help out when those wall mounted axes isn't quite getting the job done. First person tower defense is nothing new but it is how solid and streamlined Orcs Must Die feels that makes it stand apart from it's competitors.

You are the last of the War Mages, not the brightest, not the strongest, just the last one. And you are all that stands between the peasants of the land living in an idyllic medieval utopia and being introduced to the business end of a rusty axe. To stem the tide of orcs pouring in through magical portals you must progress to a succession of levels killing increasingly larger and more diverse waves of enemies. To help you on this task you have your trusty crossbow and variety of traps and magic.

You start each level by choosing which traps and weapons you want to use, completing missions unlocks more and completing them well allows you to upgrade them. As you slay orcs you earn gold which can then be used to place more traps or to gain various in-mission upgrades. As the levels progress you are introduced to all the classic tower defense enemies, the fast runners, the big slow damage sponges, the attackers that run straight for you, the suicide bombers that can kill your barricades, the fliers that follow completely separate paths from their ground dwelling kin and every other enemy that has been in every other tower defense game to date.

Graphically the games goes for a sort of cartoonish look that works fairly well most of the time and the music does the job equally adequate. The various juvenile one liners being spouted by your character grows tiresome rather quickly however.

There really isn't much to set Orcs Must Die apart from any of the other tower defense games out there, it does everything they do and never strays too far from the path of tried and true. What makes it shine however, is how extremely solid it all is. No action is wasted and every item in the game feels like it serves a purpose. The gameplay is tight and satisfying and although the nature of the genre makes it repeat itself quite a lot as you reach the higher difficulties it manages to maintain a longer lifespan than most tower defense games.

All in all Orcs Must Die is your standard first person tower defense game, extremely well made and a must have for any fans of the genre but not a game that will attract any newcomers or a game that brings anything new to the genre. A tried and true fomular, executed solidly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018559357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 223, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1344754800}
review:
Know about tower defense games? Know about fantasy creatures? Know about humour? Know about shooters? You'll see all of them combined in this amazing action-strategy game by Robot Entertainment.

The main objective is that all orcs must die. But in order to complete that objective, you'll need to place traps and learn spells and forge weapons and train an army and... use your head. And your muscles. Because there are many ways to finish a level. If an orc or one of their allies (kobolds, ogres, goblins) lives long enough to reach the rift you're bound to protect, then it's over. Remeber: you're a War Mage, and War Mages need to protect the rifts at all cost.

You can use the environment, hire troops, place traps, engage them with your weapons, do as you please, as long as you get to carry your objective.

Slice them, burn them, skewer them, and launch them - no matter how you get it done, orcs must die!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007759510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 1201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1201, 'last_played': 1380807994}
review:
Orcs Must Die! to gra akcji wzbogacona silnymi elementami strategicznymi. Tytuł został przygotowany przez Robot Entertainment, czyli firmę założoną przez część byłych pracowników Ensemble Studios, znanego z serii Age of Empires.
Tytuł zaprojektowano jako mieszankę zręcznościówki i RTS-a. Zadaniem gracza jest odparcie kolejnych fal atakujących orków. Otrzymujemy bezpośrednią kontrolę nad ruchami naszego bohatera (kamera umieszczona została za jego plecami) i sterujemy nim niczym w tradycyjnej grze akcji. Jednocześnie dostępna jest opcja zastawiania pułapek oraz przywoływania innych oddziałów.
Akcja Orcs Must Die! toczy się w krainie fantasy, w której największym zagrożeniem dla ludzkości są bandy orków. By uchronić świat przed zalaniem hordami zielonoskórych, Zakon dowodzony przez Wojennych Magów wzniósł system fortec odgradzających ojczyznę orków od pozostałych ziem. Teraz, kolejna inwazja wystawi mury tych twierdz na ciężką próbę. Gra się w to bardzo fajnie ale trzeba sobie ja dawkowac.
Grafika 8/10
Dżwięk 8/10
Gameplay 8/10 więcej niż 2 godz lub 3 dziennie odradzam

author: {'steamid': '76561198067139097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1426426076}
review: Orcs Must Die! is a strategy - trap - killing orcs - thingy-majiggy type of game. It's kind of hard to explain. But you start off with a few traps, and you must defend the "Rift" by killing orcs.If orcs start passing through the Rift, a "Rift Point" is taken off. You're weapons at the start of the game are the Crossbow and Sword. As you progress through the game, you unlock a series of traps and weapons to enhance your ability to kill orcs. And there will be more enemies. And harder enemies. So basically, in a way, you're never "stronger" than the orcs. It is a pretty hard game if you try to get the perfect score, so I recommend not aiming for the prefect score just yet. But killing orcs has never been so fun! So the final score is: 9/10 stars. Fun fact: If you have played Borderlands 2, he kinda sounds like Axton.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992324374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2339, 'last_played': 1369119600}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968592122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1635, 'last_played': 1367305200}
review:
Good game, it's not the best of balanced TD game out there, as some traps are OP as hell (Swinging Mace) compared to others that are just pathetic (Steam Trap), but balance is good enough that it will let you beat stages in many different creative ways so not everything has to be so cookie cutter and boring.

Now for some advice time for the new players who for some reason is reading this crap on my profile... any-who, your upgrade priorities should be Tar Trap, Barricade, Swinging Mace, and Archer Guardians, those are the GOD level tier of traps and bread and butter to everything.

Other notable traps are your Brimstone, Floor Scorcher, Spike Trap, Spring Trap, Arrow Wall, and Grinder, these here are your second level of tier stuff so start upgrading them when you can.

The rest of your traps can go suck it because they do in fact all suck. Also never ever ever leave home without your Lightning Ring and just stick with the Steel Weaver exclusively, because you ain't no slut.

Congrats you're a Pro now.

Lastly... Good luck on beating some of my high scores :P

review: I did't think OMD! was gonna be that great, then i just couldn't stop playing. I wouldn't say it's brilliant or anything, but it is lots of fun. I love tower defense, and considering how legitimately difficult this game (at least in terms of getting perfect scores) and how fun it is at the same time I gotta say it's one of the best tower defense games I've ever played. I'm not even sure it's really 'tower' defense...maybe trap defense? Who knows. Either way, you'll be killing orcs like a fiend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036557583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1630550559}
review: a fun mix of a third person shooter and a tower defence. compete on leader boards against me and other friends to see who can get the highest score from combos, skill shots, and timing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018399912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1347346800}
review:
All the same things from Orcs Must Die 2 apply to Orcs Must Die. If you own both games, the levels from the first can be played from within the second game. I'd recommend playing it from the second game as all the new customisation features will apply to first game's levels, and you'll be able to play as the sorceress.

If playing this from the first game there are a couple of things to note:

* Its customisation system is not nearly as good as the second game.
* There isn't as much variety as there is in the second game. Applies to weapons, characters, traps and monsters.

review:
Petit jeu à l'allure d'un "tower defence" avec positionnement d'unités et de pièges. L'humour est omniprésent louablement supporté par les graphismes "cartoon" du jeu et quelques niveaux demande de penser au positionnement des pièges et au choix d'améliorations pour notre jeune apprentis que l'on incarne. Il est un peu court, mais il en vaut la peine!

16/20

review:
オークとかほんとマジ死ねよ！

トラップを敷き、ガーディアンを配置し、魔法とクロスボウでオークどもをミンチに変える！
基本的にはタワーディフェンスゲームなので待ち構えてトラップに巻き込むのがメインなんだが主人公を操作してオークを倒すことも可能。しかも主人公のアクションは軽快でストレスゼロ。 個人的にはSteam導入したら是非やっとけゲーのひとつ！

author: {'steamid': '76561197975233274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 4107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1599, 'last_played': 1445034025}
review:
9 out of 10.
It took me about 12 hours to get through the 18 map campaign, and I've spent at least another 12 going back and replaying the levels to try to get more achievements and better level scores.  Each map probalby takes 10 minutes to play.  You run around setting up traps (kind of tower defense-like) to kill the orcs, kobolds and ogres as they try to make their way through the map from the gate to your rift.  You have weapons as spells for direct combat.  It's fun to see if you can build the best configuration of traps to stop all the monsters.  Single player only.  Very stable, I only noticed one very minor bug with a monster getting stuck in lava and not dieing, but I was able to work around it.  The character you play is very humorous in the things he says and does, as are the orcs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970479262', 'num_games_owned': 729, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2006, 'last_played': 1374510633}
review: A tower defence game that's all kinds of entertaining, engaging, and challenging. And while it has all of the usual trappings of a tower defence game, it also functions as a third-person shoter, allowing you to get in on the carnage. Use your traps and spells/weapons to liquify, crush, scorch, grind, and perforate thousands of orcs as they try vainly to infiltrate your castle. If watching orcs be electrocuted and set on fire while being sucked into a meat grinder is your thing, then this might just be the game for you!

review: Didn't do it for me at all.  Part of the joy of tower defense is watching your little machine devour enemies.  I didn't enjoy running around inside the machine in some kind of mediocre 1st-person shooter.  This made the game less fun for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028163362', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1341990000}
review:
You take place of a special wizard dude who dies, and you have to defend certain areas of a castle from enemys, mostly being orcs. You gain multiple spells, traps you can place, and you also have a set of spells. You gain money from killing these enemys, allowing you to strategicly place even more traps. As you advance through stages, you gain more ways of defending your castle. you can also have a few allies that help you along the way. To be honest my little siblings play this game more than me. Not really my style.

6.2/10

review:
I highly recommend "orcs must die" if you are into the tower defence type games.

The only bad thing i must mention is that it has no multi-player,limits in upgrading weapons and traps and only has one character to choose from. 

Besides that it has a perfect story line.
Also challanging and exciting maps that will test even the mightest of tower defence game players.
And the graphics and mechanics are splended and unique.

So if you are into single player heavy storyline tower defence games then this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027973295', 'num_games_owned': 1820, 'num_reviews': 1844, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1654958955}
review: Третья в списке лучших tower defence игр. Может, я слишком легко отдал Swords & Soldiers второе место? Orcs Must Die сильный, яркий и интересный по своей механике проект, не являющийся четой более слабому Sanctum, где игроку тоже надлежит защищать башни от первого лица. Но, как и в S&S, восторги утихают к концу, потому что однообразия разработчиками избежать не удалось. Расскажу об одном показательном моменте: из 52 друзей, купивших Орков в Steam, последний уровень прошёл только один - LaCTuK.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007010651', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 978, 'last_played': 1351753200}
review:
Veridict: 9.0

The protagonist will make you laugh your *ss off, while the tower defense style of this game will turn you into a fan of the genre. And if you are already a "tower defense guy", then this title is a must have.

Despite it tower defense style, you can defeat most of the levels using only spells and weapons like a fire crossbow, a magic sword, bottles of acid and many other apparatus, just like a FPS/action game. Or even better, why not both? After you spread your vicious traps throughout the fortress' hallways you can equip one of your weapons of choice and slay any orc that pass through your killing machines.

Orcs Must Die! have a wide variety of traps, weapons and spells that you can use to stop the hordes of orcs from entering the rifts, you'll play it on the role of the last (and funnier/dumber) War Mage alive, and your duty is to defend the order and protect the land of man from being invaded through the rifts.

Fun is the only word capable of defining this game. And if you ended it and liked it, don't get emotional.. there's a sequel for this: Orcs Must Die! 2, so you can keep playing and slaying more and more orcs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033101690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 972, 'last_played': 1614393185}
review:
One of the greatest Strategy Defense games you will ever play.

I give it a 9/10

Pro's:
Great gameplay, funny lines and characters.
Awesome ways to kill those pesky orcs.
Neat little story built into the game.
It's immersive, giving you the final outcome in your defense, and allowing you to make it stronger by fighting the hordes yourself.

Con's:
Crossbows shouldn't be fully automatic.
Some items seem to be ten times better than others.
Kinda repetitive trying to build up skulls to buy upgrades.

Summary:

If you love Strategy Tower Defense games, why aren't you playing this right now?

author: {'steamid': '76561198032788858', 'num_games_owned': 1105, 'num_reviews': 678, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1356681600}
review:
Отличная игра.....до середины (может даже ближе к концу). 

Разные уровни кажутся действительно разными за счёт интересной их архитектуры. Плюс таблица рекордов (которая по неизвестной причине может забыть о вас) мотивирует улучшать свои результаты. Юмор....хм...он, само собой, присутствует, правда, в меньшем количестве, чем хотелось бы. Отдельно выделю саундтрэк и видеоролики, они потрясны. Мимо всех слов - играть не скучно. 

Орки должны умереть! Помоги им в этом! 8 из 10 :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198037989845', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1664499756}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026973217', 'num_games_owned': 1727, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1664818045}
review:
Tower defense with strategy. Rather, it's strategy using tower defense. The "towers" aren't so much towers as they are traps. Oil traps, impaling traps, arrow traps, launcher traps, and so on. Set them up at the right spots, and watch the orcs go flying back the way they came, or dying on the spot.

Oh, and don't forget to listen to what they say while you're killing them, or what your character says while he's killing them. That's always amusing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001875982', 'num_games_owned': 2793, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1355126400}
review: This is probably my favorite iteration of tower defense, save for the sequel, because it takes what's too often a genre where it's an impersonal enemy grinder and forces you to be an active participant at all times. Combining traps is crazy fun when you get it right, and the game itself is irreverent in just the right doses to not be too winky or tiresome. Very solid, though the main campaign is almost a bit too long and difficult, and this game is hampered a little bit by the fact that the sequel surpasses it in a lot of ways, so if you're not looking to dive in too deep, just grab the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967757388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2961, 'last_played': 1356249600}
review: OMD is an entertaining, furiously addictive mixture of 3rd person shooter and tower defense, with a splendid soundtrack that perfectly compliments the frantic action.   You play as the rather dense but cocksure Warmage, who must defend the magical Rifts from untold numbers of marauding orcs, using an array of traps, guardians, spells and weapons.   The main game of achieving a 5-skull rating (no orcs escaping, within a par-time) on all maps is a good challenge - which further fuels your abilities at large-scale orc maiming, as skulls can then be spent to upgrade your equipment.   Slaying the hordes is plenty fun enough, however therein also lies a complex combo-system adding much further depth of play, where the more traps and their afflictions hit an orc, the higher the combo-points, thus making every map replayable to experiment and chase that higher score.   Crisp graphics, great voicing, music, humour and still packed with pure, fun gameplay that's as good on a pad as with a mouse.   Quality arcade action that's only surpassed by it's more content heavy sequel, yet still worth playing first.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039939398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 842, 'last_played': 1345705200}
review: Its not the most "serious" looking game, and does look rather idiotic, I've enjoyed every second I've put into this game.  Its got a great playthrough value, and the replay value is solid as well.  If your looking for a fun semi-tower defense game, then this is worth checking out.  Its all single player, but check out the second one for co-op!

review: Nice, mindless fun. In the game you play as a war mage that kills orcs. You get cool traps and a few weapons. It's quite satisfying to play too. Only downside is lack of multiplayer, which is present in the second installment - Orcs Must Die! 2. If this game is on sale, I reccoment getting it. Also, getting this game will grant you 10 extra co-op levels in OMD2, however you have to note that both players need this game for them to be playable in the co-op mode.

review:
「たまにオークが可哀想に思えてくるんだ。ま、嘘だけどね。」
タワーディフェンス＋TPSアクションでオークを無慈悲にぶっ倒すゲーム。
ステージやトラップ、敵の種類も豊富でフレンドとのスコアアタックもできる充実っぷり。
さらに公式で日本語字幕＆音声にも対応しており主人公のキャラが非常に良い。
とりあえず安売りの時買えば損する内容ではないくらいには楽しめます。

author: {'steamid': '76561198070640507', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1590154050}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018979559', 'num_games_owned': 1085, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 1776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1776, 'last_played': 1590098450}
review: Orcs Must Die! (OMD!) is a fantastic addition from the indie developer, Robot Entertainment. It's a game that blends third-person action with tower-defense strategy. Casual and hardcore players alike should be drawn to OMD! given its uniqueness, exciting gameplay and its corky sense of humor.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998575383', 'num_games_owned': 659, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 1406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1406, 'last_played': 1353657600}
review:
An addictive 3rd person strategy defense romp. This game throws you into the role of the last warmage defending rift portals against waves of orcs, ogres, goblins and more. The maps make you think carefully about where to place your arsenal of various traps. Traps such as brimstone which scorches the ground or  your very own army of elven archers.
Some clever cutscenes placed here and there give emphasis on a story, uncommon in this genre. To add to longevity each map has 3 difficulties, leaderboards, and skulls you must earn to improve your traps.

A fantastic game for any fan of action or strategy games!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989808463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1611, 'last_played': 1353225600}
