author: {'steamid': '76561198037592969', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1491333730}
review:
これは面白いTD。基本的には扉から来る敵をトラップや武器を駆使して敵を殲滅するゲーム。
武器やトラップの種類は豊富でステージ数もかなり多い。また一つのマップ事にスコアランキング付きでハイスコアを目指す為にコンボ等を狙ってプレイすることもでき、普通にプレイするのとは違った楽しみ方が出来るのも良い。
　グラフィックにも抵抗がなく、BGMが良い。デフォルトで日本語表記なのに加え、操作方法とその説明がかなりシンプルでなおかつ親切だったことにかなり感動したw
キャラクターはフルボイス（日本語）でキャラクターの個性が強く個人的に好きなキャラクターは主人公とその師匠であるw
　個人的には文句の無い良いゲームでフルプライスで買っても損がないゲームだった。
　
コボルトの血は最強のトラップ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198000557334', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1347951600}
review:
I don't even like the Tower Defense genre and even I have loads of fun with this. The game doesn't take itself seriously at all, so the plot (well, there -is- a plot) doesn't distract from the mayhem, and vice-versa.
Aside from the usual Tower Defense elements, e.g. placing traps and such along the path your enemies will take, the game also features third-person shooter/melee/spellcasting action. You can even choose to specialize in either traps or your own combat ability.
Doesn't have co-op sadly, but that's what the sequel is for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040069139', 'num_games_owned': 653, 'num_reviews': 650, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1466143406}

author: {'steamid': '76561198055260660', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1640, 'last_played': 1352361600}
review: Хорошая игра в жанре Tower defense, с большим уклоном в сторону экшена. От игрока требуется немного навыков планирования и расстановки ловушек, и максимум личного участия в выносе толп врага (для этого есть арбалет, секира, заклинания огня, льда и молнии). Неплохая графика, забавный юмор, динамичность, подходящая музыка, хороший баланс, есть интересная возможность выбора пути развития защиты на карте (усилить себя, ловушки или все понемногу). Из недостатков – относительная простота, однообразные по виду карты, никаких доп. режимов вроде выживания.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999323242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1354, 'last_played': 1358928000}
review:
Orcs Must Die! est un jeu d'action et de stratégie de type "Dungeon Defenders".
Il dispose de graphismes de type cartoon.
Teinté d'une touche d'humour, il mettra également à rude épreuve vos capacités stratégiques pour faire face à des hordes d'orcs accompagnés de créatures diverses et variées.

Bref, un jeu complétement jouissif !

review: タワーディフェンス＋TPSの融合型のゲーム。最近ではよく見る形式だが、日本語字幕＋吹き替え完備なのは珍しい。ウォーメイジ難易度で一周した感覚ではかなり色々な解法があるように思えるが、かと言って簡単すぎるということはなく、難易度設定は常に良く出来ていると感じた。個人的には弓兵のガーディアンを大量に置いて弾幕を張るのが楽しかった。シングルプレイしか無いことが唯一の欠点か(続編の2でco-opが実装された)。値段相応の面白さはある。

review: Let us be honest, we've tolerated orcs breathing our clean air long enough. It's time for us to rise up in arms and take back our good clean air from these foul creatures. Take it back with vicious force, a force that will make orcs think twice before breathing our air again. So everyone should get this game and join in the cause of letting those sick orcs know that clean air is only for humans! Oh yeah, you'll also be helping protect some magical rifts and maintain harmony or whatever, it's not as important as the clean air.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016475753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1004, 'last_played': 1350630000}
review:
Entre le tower defense et le shooter à la 3e personne, Orcs Must Die! C'est du vice et du fun dans un univers mediaval-fantastique cartoonesque. Les parties sont relativement courtes mais intenses, graphiquement c'est très sympa, et les niveux de difficulté proposent un bon challenge.
Un très bon jeu pour un prix raisonnable!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030069674', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1349074800}
review:
This game is, simply put, fantastic. It is basically a Third Person Action/Tower Defense game hybrid. I loved it. It is very humorous, but the story is not where it shines. In fact, the story is somewhat forgettable. The gameplay is what makes this game so great. It is challenging, unique, and most importantly, VERY fun. It also has a pretty decent replay value. However, I would recommend just getting Orcs Must Die! 2 instead, since it has moar weapons, traps, maps. OMD2 also has co-op which is great.. But if you want the classic maps from this game to play in Co-Op in OMD2, then you want to buy this one too. Treat it like a DLC to OMD2 that adds 10 maps. 

9/10 (Buy OMD2 instead, or buy it on sale)

review:
Originalni klon stale oblibenejsich tower defense v podobe, kterou jentak nepotkate...

Tady neplanujete z pozice boha ci generala, v teto hre po bojisti primo behate a veskere planovani a pripravy realizujete pekne rucne, tedy tak, ze jednoduse k mistu pribehnete a past polozite ci jinak pripevnite, samozrejme zalezi na typu onoho mechanismu, ktery vam pri vypusteni nepratel pomuze  vyron zla zredukovat ci primo znicit ;)

8/10 (1 bod za originalitu), protoze i pres veskerou variabilitu mechanismu se hra ohraje pomerne brzy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975291291', 'num_games_owned': 995, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1477, 'last_played': 1346569200}
review:
This game takes my love of a good defense game, with a wide array of traps and some varied terrain, and combines it with some goofy humor and a 3-D first-person perspective.  Watching orcs get hacked to bits is fun!

You can't entirely rely on your traps to do all the hacking, though: Some you will have to handle yourself, with crossbow, sword, or spells.  I'm ambivalent about that part, as it does keep you on your toes and give you a chance to catch what your traps missed, but trying to chase down a scurrying kobold with a crossbow detracts from the base-building gameplay if you have to do it too much.  All in all though I found it reasonably well balanced at normal difficulty.

In addition to your choice of traps and spells, in later levels you can choose for each level which of three "weavers" to work with, each with their own upgrade tree, which opens up more strategies.  How do you want your orcs to die today?

author: {'steamid': '76561197983958676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1128, 'last_played': 1374874691}
review:
I wasn't interested in this game when I first saw it. I misjudged its art-style as a sign of something undesirable that I can't put my finger on, and the phrase "tower-defense" generally holds little of my interest on its own. Orcs Must Die, however, is an excellent surprise, and its sequel (“2”, not the actually dead F2P MOBA “Unchained” or whatever) also excels, adding (among other things, of course) that one thing I most wished the first had had: co-op.

This game is not settled fully into the tower-defense subgenre, instead leaning heavily into its third-person shooter and RPG elements. This means it can accomplish the daunting task of getting me to like a tower-defense game for more than a couple hours (eg Dungeon Defenders, Aegis Defenders, Sanctum).

The visuals in Orcs Must Die look better in-game than in its marketing stills for me; something about adding weight, or movement, or different texture, or just zooming out made a surprising difference. Its challenge-level slopes just right, the gameplay and controls are tight, and good voice-acting and fun writing elevate this game to excellence. Relatively restrained and worthy DLC releases are hard to manage under the thumb of short-sighted publishers, so this game just keeps impressing me. And the addition of co-op in the sequel means the series can join that unnamed subgenre of co-op vs horde series like Vermintide, Killing Floor, Zombie Army, World War Z, Alien Swarm, and Deep Rock Galactic, for which I do have a reliable affinity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060439360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1395764482}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029034048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1346223600}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is a tower defence game that uses a third person action oriented perspective instead of the traditional top down view of similar games.

Its a very fun and entertaining game that will last you around 11 hours depending on your playstyle. A constant progression of new weapons, traps and enemies drives you through the adventure, and ensure the same strategy won't work for every level. 

Not only do you lay traps as in a typical tower defence game, your character can also move around and contribute to the kills to complement the traps you have set. The graphics are bright and colourful and animations are very fluid. Music and sound are crisp and clear and the game is a joy to play.

Downsides, this game is single-player only. Having a friend in multiplayer mode to help cover some of multiple enemy entrances would have made it an even more enjoyable experience.

Overall Rating: 7 / 10
Entertaining and fun game in a new twist on the tower defence genre. Don't miss it.

review:
Tattico, frenetico, colorato e gradevole all'occhio.
Decimare orde di orchi, coboldi, gnoll e chi più ne ha più ne metta, non è mai stato così divertente, tutto contornato da un comparto audio e musicale di tutto rispetto che accompagna le fasi di gioco più concitate e quelle più riflessive in maniera impeccabile. 
Un doppiaggio dignitoso narra gli atti di cui si compone il titolo e ci fa sorridere durante le fasi di gioco con battute e palesi narcisismi.
Da avere assolutamente nella propria collezione!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971680023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 2325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2325, 'last_played': 1357200000}
review: It took me a little bit to really get into this game.  I would play for half an hour, and have fun, but be done and not feel like playing again for a week or more.  However, once i got about 2/3 the way through the levels and opened up a wider variety of the traps I couldn't stop playing.  I enjoyed it so much so that the 2nd game was a day 1 purchase for me, which doesn't happen often.  The variety of ways that you can approach a level make replaying a lot of fun.  The talent trees opened up later offer completely different playstyles that all work if done right.  You have to be willing to invest 4-5 hours to get to the meat of the game, but if you do this game is a ton of fun and really well done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000132826', 'num_games_owned': 547, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1365836400}

Szczeliny , 2 głowne rodzaje broni , masa pułapek ! ( na sufit , na podłoge na ściany oraz łucznicy i paladyni  których możemy spawnować ) , Graficznie nie ma szału  ale nie jest zła , gameplay jak dla mnie super , polecam tą gre całym sercem ! ;) i zachęcam do zakupu drugiej części ! :) 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197986038119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1342940400}
review: With a title like that how is one supposed to refuse?  Ok it's actually rather fun.  For the seasoned tower defense expert it's a rather fun 3D variation.  Tower Defense for the uninitiated is at it's best a grid based puzzler.  Choose how and where to defend utilising resources you earn.  The more experianced you become, the more traps and defenses you can place.  It's biggest failing is that there is no autofire.  Constantly having to slam the mouse button to fire an arrow or whack a sword becomes a little tiring.  Would I reccommend it?  Yes I would on a steam sale, simply for the fun sounds and indie humour, dotted around endearing orcy goodness.  A quick level now and again, is what makes a solid indie hit.  Without the "just one more go" deliciousnous of games like this, we'd forget the simple pleasure of gaming.

review:
Simplemente increíble. Una historia entretenida, unos gráficos excelentes y una jugabilidad alucinante, LOS ORCOS DEBEN MORIR. A pesar de que el género "defender la torre" está ya muy mascado, este juego le da un soplo de aire fresco y te permite combinar la estrategia de planificar y optimizar tus recursos para instalar trampas para repeler la invasión con frenética acción de un beat 'em up en tercera persona que desarrolla cada vez mejores armas y poderes.

No es de extrañar que tenga una edición GOTY, se lo tiene bien merecido.

review:
Отличная игра!
Совсем незамысловатый сюжет, зато какой захватывающий игровой процесс! И, главное, чем дальше, тем интереснее, потому что арсенал ловушек и извилистость карт постоянно возрастают, что предоставляет все больший и больший простор для множества тактических решений по истреблению зеленой орды. При этом, постоянное море адреналина гарантировано.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033802030', 'num_games_owned': 2082, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 1515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1461, 'last_played': 1451872164}
review:
I like this game! This is basically a tower defense + third person shooter, similar to Sanctum, but with a much better sense of humor and style, and doesn't give me motion sickness. Within the first five minutes of playing, I quickly felt inclined to play through the rest, which is a rare experience these days. 

There's a good progression, as the game starts to get noticeably harder in the final levels. There is a nightmare difficulty once you beat the game on normal, for an even harder challenge. Every level you're presented with a new trap or item, but I found myself not using most of them, having tried them out and finding them less effective than existing gear. Since every level offers up to 5 stars, replay is fairly good for those striving for the most reward out of each level.

Well worth the asking price, especially on a sale. I hear the recently released sequel is even better, so I look forward to that.

review:
Un juegazo del tipo "torretas" en primera persona. Muy divertido, tanto por el apartado gráfico (Matar a orcos del modo que se te ocurra es bastante cómico de por si, pero es que los desarrolladores se esmeran en que te rias de las formas absurdas de masacrar ordas enteras de ellos) como por la historia del juego y la personalidad de los personajes.

Estoy deseando probar el "Orcs must die! 2" ya que el juego en cooperativo tiene que ganar bastante.

PD: Matar orcos gana mucho si está acompañado de la gran banda sonora apocalíptica de este juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997360179', 'num_games_owned': 1334, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1324454400}
review:
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!

A few things that it does it does, decently.

This game, and its successor, in my opinion, were attempting to ride the coat-tails of the highly anticipated, and much more highly refined, Dungdeon Defenders.  It is a poorly coded, excessively bland, tacky, generic FPS tower defense crossover.  The DLC may as well be called "EZ-mode".

the voice acting will grind on your nerves, the enemies are so stupid.... its indescribable.  They said they would come out with some multiplayer component (i.e. WTF THE GAME YOU WERE ATTEMPTING TO COPY HAS THIS AS ITS 3rd SELLING POINT, WHY DID YOU NOT INTEGRATE IT?) that would be DLC, but saw that there was enough demand for it that they would just crank out a sequel.  That is the kind of developers you are supporting by buying this game.  Yes Dungeon defenders has an excess of DLC, however they are still supporting it, this game has been left in the dust less than a year after it was released.  The developers should feel shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009785376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1629153802}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991881924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1343372400}

author: {'steamid': '76561198037336403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1347087600}
review:
Featuring a new, and humorous, take on the Tower Defense genre, Orcs Must Die is a brilliant game. 
Apart from allowing you to actually partake in the killing of Orc Waves, the game actually puts you in first-person so you can look at the 'towers' which will completely destroy any- and all orcs.

It's a good game, and it's a nice and mild brain-teaser for when you just want to have some fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044577496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1235, 'last_played': 1508653881}
review:
Finding intelligent ways to mutilate hordes of orcs in ever more brutal and bizarre ways never stops getting amusing, especially when your character is an idiot without remorse and the orcs are so unbearably adorable and comical.

It is perfect escapism. Satisfy your OCD cravings by making the perfect trap system while also satisfying your desire to cause untold mass slaughter.

review:
A very pleasant game. I think there are quite a few traps you won't be using at all, simply because you can't do without the few basic ones (and you only can take a few kinds of traps into each mission.) That's a shame, but not really a big deal. 

I was quite surprised how the game managed to drag me in and kill my entire evening in a "just one more level and I'll go to sleep" fashion, on multiple occasions.

review: Originale e divertente. Il genere deve piacere ma se volete un gioco dove poter usare l'ingegno per distruggere tutto ciò che si muove questo gioco fa per voi. Milioni di trappole ed armi diverse, difficoltà dal facile per i neofiti all'impossibile per i più masochisti esperti, mappe più o meno complesse e soprattutto tanti ma tanti orchi da far esplodere/bruciare/infilzare/spappolare/tagliuzzare!!! (ps. alcune imprese di steam son veramente difficili da sbloccare!)

review: Yet another recommended tower defence game although this one feels a lot more combat orientated. Surprisingly challenging if you go for 5 skulls, more so on Nightmare mode. Only one minor permanent upgrade per tower type while skills are put up through one of three skill trees which reset every level so you can play around with builds to avoid repetitiveness. The cheesy humour and over the top characters fit the game well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002518269', 'num_games_owned': 2042, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 1787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1787, 'last_played': 1354780800}
review: Another great spin on tower defense.  You can create elaborate traps - lots of very fun trap types that work well together, each one upgradeable for a small meta game (each trap type can be upgraded once).  You can also take on orcs by making yourself more powerful (upgrading spells, damage, etc).  And of course, you can do both.  The main campaign has 24 levels, which take anywhere from 5-15 minutes each.  Took me about 8-10 hrs to complete the campaign.  Then if you enjoyed it, there's leaderboards and some DLC that give you reasons to play more.

review: Very surprising game! Orcs Must Die! is a very good example of the mix between tower defence and action games. It's a solo only game but if you get into the first couple of levels you get hooked by the variety of the maps and the sheer number of traps you can set to stop the orcs from reaching your base. I would also recommend the sequel, which has a coop mode and alot more content.

review:
凄惨系Dungeon Defenders。
罠の有効範囲があちらと比べて、直線的かつ狭め。
オークの進路をこちらで誘導するという「罠にはめる」という言葉がピッタリくるゲーム。

完全日本語(多少の誤植はある)なので、純粋に楽しめる作品。
「Fresh Meat!!」なあなたにオススメ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198026906025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 841, 'last_played': 1343631600}
review: This game is simply a must-play for anyone even remotely interested in the tower defense genre. Orcs Must Die blends together strategic trap placement and 3rd person action seamlessly as it delivers a short but sweet experience that you will not soon forget.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035143576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1343545200}
review:
I'm a little surprised about liking this game. Usually I'm not big on action type games, but I found myself enjoying the mix of action and strategy. Placing the traps correctly is a major part of the game, but wading into a bunch of orcs breaking thru your defenses is the icing on the cake.

I'm not far into the game yet and have found the dificulty to be hit or misss on the levels. Some seem really hard, but the next level is very easy. I can see myself finishing the game as long as the last few levels don't go over the top in difficulty.

Overall a game worth playing, especially if you catch it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996737918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 5078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4888, 'last_played': 1470121899}
review:
I really like this game. It's a charming 3rd person action tower defense score-chaser that doesn't take itself too seriously. 

You set traps and kill things (sometimes even without the traps). There are lots of traps and lots of ways to play. This game uses a fairly simple scoring mechanism of kill steaks and combos (#of things hitting something as it dies) that is easy to understand, but tough to master so topping the leaderboards is quite the trick.

The price is affordable, the game has 24 levels that can be played on any of the 3 (only the last 2 matter) difficulty settings + a few more levels in the Lost Adventures DLC and I find it to be worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025338597', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 5766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1611, 'last_played': 1687449030}
review:
Dead Orcs = Good Orcs

From the people who made Age of Empires brings you a complex tower defence, third person shooter strategy, rewarding game. Plenty of levels, good music and a challenging Nightmare mode! For hours of fun!

I give it a Dead Orc out of Dead Orc.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993298158', 'num_games_owned': 723, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 990, 'last_played': 1343545200}
review: This game is much more fun than it has any right to be. It's a blend of the Tower Defense and First Person Shooter genres, it's extremely frenetic, and the main character is an entertainingly over-the-top douchebag. If you're not sure about it, grab it when it's on sale; it's a pretty minor investment for a solid game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008904881', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1137, 'last_played': 1344236400}
review: A great single player third person tower defense action/strategy hybrid. You control a Warmage that is able to attack with ranged/melee attacks as well as spells as you defend against waves after waves of nasty orcs that get more difficult over time. The gameplay is very smooth and snappy. An overall well made game that in my opinion (the only opinion that matters) is superior to Dungeon Defenders in every way minus the co-op.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011826529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1343458800}
review:
Vous aimez buter de l'Orc ? Alors ce jeu vous apportera ce plaisir ! :)

Orcs Must Die est, pour trouver une comparaison, un peu semblable à un jeu de tower défense avec un côté action.
Chaque niveau possède un portail à défendre, et une ou plusieurs entrées desquelles défileront des centaines d'Orcs et autres créatures par vagues successies.

Votre but est donc de défendre le portail (un passage vers le royaume des humains) en plaçant différents pièges. Chaque créature tuée vous rapportera son pesant d'or pour vous permettre d'ajouter de nouveaux pièges.
De plus vous pouvez aussi participer activement au massage grâce à des sorts ou des armes (vive les headshots en chaine !).

Chaque fin de niveau vous apportera aussi, selon vos résultats, des crânes qui serviront à améliorer vos pièges (ou en acheter de nouveaux).

La bande son ainsi que les graphismes sont particulièrement funs, et pour une fois la VF est respectable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034211368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1324368000}
review:
Absolutamente una buena compra.

   El juego tiene siempre dos fases, una, de planificación, dónde utilizaremos "dinero" para colocar trampas de diferente crueldad en el escenario, con el objetivo de evitar que las hordas lleguen al núcleo que defendemos. Ya en la segunda fase, tenemos que matar activamente a las hordas que asaltan la fortificación. Es importante tanto una buena colocación de las trampas como hacer una buena defensa activa.

   El juego presenta una buena variedad tanto de trampas como de oponentes y tiene una curva de aprendizaje muy buena.Al principio es sencillote pero cada vez se va complicando  más. En los niveles más avanzados y en la dificultad alta, es realmente un desafío.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031127685', 'num_games_owned': 983, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1331881200}
review: タワーディフェンス×主人公がボウガン撃ったり剣振り回したり風巻き起こしてオークをブッ飛ばすアクションゲーム。日本語化済み。基本的に四方八方から敵が来るからバリゲードでルートを作ってあげて、余剰コストで殺人回廊を一個作るゲーム。時間制限やらなんやらで頭ひねる良い難易度なんだけど、Wave毎に一息ついて装備を整えるのが面白いのにナイトメアモードだと待ち時間無しなのが残念。一人残してマップを探索するのは間違ってると思うんだよね。 DLCも出てるので買うときはDLC入りの奴買いましょう。箱○コン対応です。

author: {'steamid': '76561198020624321', 'num_games_owned': 584, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 1105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1105, 'last_played': 1598773283}
review:
Excellent tower-defense action game. Really. It's also not DLC infested like dungeon defenders.

Only complaint could be the lack of CO-OP but then again, orcs must die 2 is right around the corner. Can't wait for it.

This game is more action oriented than Dungeon Defenders, so you're contanstly doing something.

This game offers many traps and 3 different difficulties. And yes, the hard mode is hard. Not impossible though.

One of the best tower-defense i've ever played.

Overall: 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198023165930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1526, 'last_played': 1343718000}
review:
Most awesome tower defense game ever. There is a tough difficulty curve, but I've never felt cheated or forced into buying the DLC. In fact, I've beaten all the levels (even on Nightmare) without it. There is tons of replay value with this game due to the sheer number of weapons and traps and maps available. 

I love this game from the humor to the artwork to the gameplay.

The only thing I felt it was lacking was co-op, something that the second game brings in.

review:
Des Orcs, des piéges, du fun!
Ce petit jeu est fort sympathique, il est juste fun a l'état pur. Vous etes un héro qui pose des pieges sur la trajectoire d'orc barge voulant détruire un portail. On pourrait appeler ca un trap-defence. La diversité des piéges et le délire ambiant font que je suis tomber amoureux de ce jeu.
Rajouter que bientot il y a sa suite qui se joue en coop et la beeeen je vois pas comment on peut plus enorme!!

review: Fun game. I guess I'd describe it as defense with traps instead of towers. Very similar to Dungeon Defenders, but where DD succeeded in its multiplayer, this game succeeds in its silly nature and delicious traps of death.

review: Highly recommended if you enjoy both tower defense and third person shooter games as this combines them both.  Clever humor and some great challenges that push the brain to solve problems and react fast.  I greatly enjoyed trying to get five skulls on every map.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005506584', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1324368000}
review:
This little gem dosen't shine for long, but it is enjoyable while it does!

A quirky little venture into Tower D, and it succeeds pretty well. While the content is limited, this risk was well appraised by the community, and so the sequel to this should be quite grand. (Especially with co-op)

If ya got a few bucks just sitting there and want to kill a few hours and orcs, this is a purchase you won't regret.

review:
Tower defense in 3D, this is an original quirky game which combines the by now well known elements of tower defense with that of a 3d action game. The developpers then sprinkled in some extra humor and then ended up with 'Orcs Must Die!'. 

If you are interested in either of these two genres I can recommend this game to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032593330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 1104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1104, 'last_played': 1344582000}
review: Замечательная весёлая игрушка про мага-недоучку в жанре Tower Defense. Вы обязательно захотите пройти её снова и снова, чтобы улучшить свое место в мировом рейтинге, даже если Вы играете только в MW3, Dota 2 или TF2. Игра ничуть не уступает таким шедеврам как Plants vs. Zombies, Sanctum, Dungeon Defenders, и Defense Grid: The Awakening, а где-то даже превосходит их своей атмосферой радостно-дурацкого безумия. В игре не надо ломать пальцы изощренными комбинациями клавиш, управление как у стандартного шутера - W,S,A,D. И самое главное - здесь можно травить гоблинов грибами! Bravo, Robot Entertainment!

review: Orcs Must Die! merges First Person Shooter with Tower Defense in this entertaining game of reckless orc slaughter. The concept is simple but the strategy required to achieve a 5 Skull ratining on each level is high. You play a War Mage Apprentice who has all the personality of Ash from Evil Dead.   You won't have more fun killing lots, and I do mean lots, of orc any where else.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993104569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1344063600}
review:
Not to be confused with "Goblins Must Die"  " Kobolds Must Die"  "Bugbears Must Die" and "All Dire-Celestial-Vampiric Chairs Must Be Dismantled" Orcs Must Die is a game where I'm awesome.  Yes, I am awesome, thank you for asking.  The orcs come at me and they must die because I'm awesome.  I also don't want to massage corn so there's that too.

I have spinny-whirly dealies and spikey things and make things go BOOM! to make orcs go deader.  Because orcs being alive are not being dead enough.  They don't like it when you slice and dice them and shoot them and burn them and crush them and fling them and feed them to ogres and get other people to shoot them or slice them.  I suggest lightly steamed with a dip of tar as a good option, or maybe filled with bolts.  It's really up to you, who is me in this case, and awesome.

review:
Orcs Must Die is the only game I have told people to purchase in the last ten years. I have been abusive and relentless in forcing my friends and coworkers to buy the game, because it is the only game I have played where I had fun from the very beginning all the way through to the very end. It's well balanced, fun, interesting, surprising, has many options, and is in a great puzzle/action game.

If you're going to buy a single game off Steam this year, make it OMD!.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053556733', 'num_games_owned': 4417, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 1698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1698, 'last_played': 1351494000}
review:
TPSアクション+タワーディフェンスなゲーム。
単純な組み合わせだがこれが非常にアツい。
自キャラが操作出来ることでタワーディフェンスにありがちな退屈感を微塵も感じさせないし、その一方でタワーディフェンスの戦術性も十分楽しめる。
ボリュームもそこそこあり、最低でも10時間は遊べるはず。
手頃な価格で購入できることも相まって「これぞSteamのゲーム」という感がある。
ランキング要素もあり、ハマる人なら100時間ぐらいいけるのでは。
万人に向けて自信を持って勧められる一本。キャラボイスも含めて完全日本語化されているので、その意味でも人を選ばずおすすめできる。デモ版も用意されてるようなのでぜひ一度お試しあれ。

review:
Orcs must die is a fun whimsical seeming game that quickly turns into a tactical bloody slugfest with a tenacious and numerous foe.

a fun fresh take on tower defence that will have you playing for some time.

The only bad thing ive found is that like with tower defence games, you quickly grow tired and need breaks from the game.

But if your looking for 2-5 games of fast paced frantic defending fun, this game will fill that gap nicely


(FPS / Defence / Casual)

author: {'steamid': '76561198000305114', 'num_games_owned': 696, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1388252786}
review:
This game is fucking awesome. No, really. Try the demo. Awesome tower defense gameplay coupled with great hack 'n' slash, burn 'n' bash combat.

If you think the demo is awesome, wait until you hear this: a little less than one third of the way into the campaign, you unlock the Weavers, performance enhancing mages who let you choose a tree of enhancements: your weapons, or your traps (this includes guardians and soldiers). Personally I'm a fan of the combat enhancements. With the double ended bladestaff, and all the melee enhancements, you'lll tear through the orc hordes like a hurricane of blood. 

I've tried the Trap tree, but because both traps and the perks cost money, where as with the combat you only have to pay for the perks, I find that the trap tree often takes longer to upgrade, and even with the perks you'll often still have to depend on weapons a fair amount.

All in all, this game kicks ass. Buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043534983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1373689791}
review:
Rating: 4/5     "A very fun twist to tower defense."

Orcs Must Die is a comical game, and a unique hybrid of Tower Defense and Platform.  You play as a Sorcerer's Apprentice, who inherits his Master's mission after his most unfortunate (and oddly hilarious) death.  At your disposal is your late Master's spellbook, which provides you with the means to summon traps, guardians, and magical weapons which can all be used to single-handedly combat an army of Orcs...and luckily so, because that's exactly what your mission entails! Orcs Must Die features a simple control system, engaging gameplay, an overconfident, narcissistic main character, and orcs...lots and lots of orcs! An overall great game for almost anyone's video game repertoire!

review: This game is very well written. Your hero says a lot of great lines, all voice acted. Makes me feel like a hero, defeating all those monsters with style. The hardest difficulty is frustrating, FPS tanks way too hard when looking at portals and during the building period in between waves. I recommend skipping over these resting periods immediately and just building while the enemies come.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973969233', 'num_games_owned': 648, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1324454400}
review: Orcs Must Die gets a place right there next to my beloved Defense Grid and Sanctum! This isn't marketed as a Tower Defense game, but any fans of the genre will love this professionally developed defense game. This game evenly balances the importance of you being in the fray, and being thoughtful about your traps. You choose (and upgrade) your loadout before going into battle, and the options are so well varied that you can approach things with a variety of different options. The overall "feel" of the game from combat mechanics to funny storyline are all exceptionally fun. Plus, like the great aforementioned games, this game leave plenty for you to improve upon and goals to pursue. Oh, and the difficulty curve is a great match to my tastes which is rare (gets genuinely difficult).

author: {'steamid': '76561197962001763', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1456, 'last_played': 1349420400}
review: Incredibly fun, witty, and challenging.  Not your typical tower defense game; with gorgeous graphics, fun dialogue, and a soundtrack that sounds like Mastadon did a Gregorian Chant album.  Addictive gameplay that is absolutely worth the price!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014465484', 'num_games_owned': 1001, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 985, 'last_played': 1324368000}
review:
Slaying Orcs has never been more fun!

I still recommend this title, even when you already own the successor. The level-design is more straight forward and always adds an element of variety to the previous level. Every new item you unlock offers a very balanced and strategical approach to beat a level even until late in the game. It also offers a great replayability of levels in which you didn't have the item on the first run. 

The game is singleplayer only, but as it was designed to be so, it is far superior in the singleplayer-experience than its (still great) successor.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964143854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1446, 'last_played': 1343545200}
review:
I love tower defense games! 

Though this game is more about traps than towers, the concepts the same. Obliterate hordes of enemies before they can get  to a specific zone/s.

The gameplay is smooth, arcadey, yet tactical. You have to manage your money, abilities and traps. You find yourself more in the fray of the battle then your traditional tower defense game. Its easy to pick up and have fun if you're short on time. 

The better you do on levels the more "Skullz" you get, which in tern can upgrade your traps. So I find myself replaying levels just to get that extra Skull. Lots of fun.

However this title would be a whole lot better if it had multiplayer. I would get a real kick out of cooping some levels with friends.

Orcs Must Die has humour, traps, replayability and of course lots and lots of Orcs. Definitely worth buying

author: {'steamid': '76561198016520191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1324540800}
review: What do you get when you combine tower defense and action? Here it is - Orcs Must Die! An innovative twist to tower denfence genre is what you can look forward here. The use of a variety of traps and your action skills are a must to survive each wave of orcs. It's comical to watch how the orcs suffer from your well placed traps, flying through the air and meeting to their ultimate end with a lovely Ode to Joy BGM as the icing (BGM imagined in your head). And you can unlock gifts in Orcs Must Die 2 if you have Orcs Must Die. Surely a must have for those who love tower defence with a sadistic sense of humor. =)

author: {'steamid': '76561198005875224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2328, 'last_played': 1347260400}

review:
Nothing like a mass slaughtering of Orcs to make ones day complete.

Place 'tower' like defences and create 'kill boxes' to slaughter orcs by the hundreds.  And pick off the survivors with a crosbow or polearm.  Or go for the straightforward approach and slaughter them by hand.

In my opinion, this is possibly the best title for its genre I have seen yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960375849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1487333269}
review: If you like third-person shooters with a mix of tower defense, then "Orcs Must Die!" is something you'll probably enjoy. Play as the former wizard's apprentice, the War Mage, as you strive to protect magical rifts to the protagonist's homeworld. Those gateways set in various fortresses, you build a variety of traps or even fight head-on with various weapons/abilities to keep hordes of orcs and other monsters from reaching their goal. The game is so fun that will have you hecticly thinking on your virtual feet to plan the many ways to dispatch the onslaught. Replay levels several times after you manage to unlock all the traps, weapons and upgrades to see if you can make it to the top of the leaderboards amongst your friends or the rest of the world. Seriously, you'll have lots of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030437506', 'num_games_owned': 1449, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1344495600}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010179510', 'num_games_owned': 1776, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1340002800}
review: Not quite tower defense, not quite action game, but it is definitely awesome. It's fast-paced, quite replayable, very humorous, pretty challenging. Music's pretty cool as well. I love this game to pieces... with traps.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993653827', 'num_games_owned': 851, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1587, 'last_played': 1343631600}
review:
An action oriented tower defence game, where you are right in the midst of the battle, tossing down traps, casting fireballs and building crazy trap combos. Good mechanics, cheerful aesthetics, funny lines...
The comboing mechanic is cool, but a bit under used. Especially if you don't care about getting the high score and would rather concentrate on getting a perfect run.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961127667', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1202, 'last_played': 1408768243}
review:
I love the game for it's humor. Your alter ego is a dork and his victory dance over defeated enemies hilarious. When I saw it first time I almost died laughting.
The game itself is a tower defense variation in 3D where towers are replaced with traps. You will find malicous pleasure in seeing endless hordes of souless orcs being impaled, burned, squadshed, shattered, flipped, electrocuted, dissected and pummled to death. 
Thanks to the game comic style it's not graphic but hilariously funny.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978806930', 'num_games_owned': 1463, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 1339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1339, 'last_played': 1324368000}

review: You play from a third person perspective as you lay waste to wave after waves of orcs. Using a wide array of spells and traps at your disposal. Tower defense with third person aspects. It is a must buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967686701', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 965, 'last_played': 1342249200}
review:
Jedyny obok Plants vs Zombies tower defender ktory mi sie spodobal na tyle by go ukonczyc i chciec wiecej.
Klimat, humor i muzyka mialy z tym wiele wspolnego ale nie ma co ukrywac ze duzo wiecej frajdy daje wybijanie kolejnych fal glupich Orkow niz powolne i monotonne strzelanie z kwiatkow. Narzedzi eksterminacji jest sporo i starali sie zachowac ich roznorodnosc by nadrobic malo rodzaji przeciwnikow. Do tego kolejne levele sa roznie uksztaltowane co oznacza ze nie ma jednego zwyciezkiego zestawu i do kazdej komnaty trzeba podchodzic oddzielnie. Goraco POLECAM!

author: {'steamid': '76561197984306886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1760, 'last_played': 1628454745}
review: Muyyyyyyy entretenido ....

author: {'steamid': '76561198024960781', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1343372400}
review:
Orcs Must Die is an incredibly fun, fast paced tower defense game with emphasis on action. You play a War Mage just out of his apprentice training, who must stop orcs from reaching the rifts into your world.

With your old master dead, a cocky attitude, and not the greatest intelligence your kind has ever seen. The world is surely doomed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969237123', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2038, 'last_played': 1338274800}
review: With a sequel on the way in just a few weeks, it's a great time to play through the original Orcs Must Die! I'm not a huge fan of tower defense, but the fun traps that allow for clever combinations, along with the ability to back them up on foot, allows for much more interactivity and action than your typical TD game. It's one of my favorite games of 2011.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999681621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1360828800}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034635154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1614, 'last_played': 1628460949}
review: It's good for stress relief, and for serious "how do I score high" styles of play. The endless snarking is a great bonus. You almost have to feel sorry for the poor orcs though...except...NOT REALLY!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970291212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 2148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2148, 'last_played': 1343372400}
review: It's the kind of power fantasy your insecure ass could really use to help you get through the day! Buy it and feel like a man, manly woman, more manly mandroid, or other-gendered being with a sudden infusion of manity.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970690368', 'num_games_owned': 8511, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 699, 'last_played': 1343286000}
review: It's a physics-enabled third-person shooter and tower-defense mashup, and it's amazing. Setting traps to fling Orcs into pits of acid, shooting them with a crossbow as they trudge through a tar-pit trap, melting them with alchemical grenades (DLC only, but cheap and sooo worth it), using barricades to route the hordes right into your traps... it's brilliant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004702989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1353916800}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972809842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1331967600}
review: Fun tower defense game with smooth gameplay and an entertaining protaganist. Good time killer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021144421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 8450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5660, 'last_played': 1626522975}
review: It is rare that a game remembers what games are all about and remembers it the entire way through the game.  Orcs Must Die! keeps its eye on the prize: fun.  Every aspect of the game is designed around fun.  Orcs exploding: fun.  Death traps: fun.  The player figuring their own ways through levels, not being restricted to a certain type of approach: fun.  There's little in the way of plot, but just enough to keep it...fun.  Until this game, I never felt the need to get every achievement just to eek out more playtime, but this game was good enough that I did so.  It can be quite frustrating, but that mostly happens through challenges you make yourself - you don't have to 5 star every level, you don't have to play through nightmare mode, but you'll want to.  It's a fantastic game that is just long enough, with just enough plot, to make every single section fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971001249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1589, 'last_played': 1440831295}
review: Instant classic! All the fun of a Tower Defense game with just enough shooter to liven things up. Highly addictive.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996903623', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2556, 'last_played': 1336114800}
review:
Hey, you!  Yeah, you!  Are you killing Orcs?  NO?  What is wrong with you???  From the fun hacky-slashy-trappy gameplay, to the huge orc bodycount, to the fact that your character is inspired by the King Himself, Ashley J. Williams without being an outright rip-off (see: Nukem, Duke), you owe it to yourself, as well as the rest of humanity, and yes, even to the Orcs themselves, to check out Orcs Must Die!

No, really.  Go get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041834544', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1333177200}
review:
This game runs face-first into the same problem that Sanctum did - that success relies on one correct strategy from the beginning. Not only that, but you get to upgrade your traps, and if you mess that up by putting them in the wrong areas, there's no refunds - you actually have to start a new profile.

The graphics, music, sound and concept all receive an A, but the number of flawed tower defense games on this planet are as innumerable as the stars.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973207923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1510337541}
review:
You see those orcs? Yeah... You should do something about them. Conjure traps upon the floors, the walls, and even the ceilings! Use magical items and weapons, and the very hazards built into the corridors! Do what you must to make sure that the Orcs Must Die!

All around great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994527992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 1420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1420, 'last_played': 1339311600}
review: Orcs Must Die! is yet another take on the now ubiquitous action-tower defense genre. In many ways, it's similar to Dungeon Defenders (see previous review), but you play as only one character and there is no customization, other than what traps you decide to use on each level. That doesn't make it bad, however. In fact, it's a real plus in the game's favor... as the main character is, well, quite a character! I guarantee his goofy lines will bring a smile to your face. Gameplay is standard fare for the genre - progress through a series of levels in which you must set up traps and defend your magic rift from hordes of orcs. Every new level completed adds a new trap or ally to your arsenal, making for a smooth progression (though nothing is ever really a cakewalk). You will be challenged, for sure... especially on later levels. If you're looking for a new tower defense game (or maybe looking to try one for the first time), Orcs Must Die is about as solid as they come. Give it a look!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046126076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1339916400}
review:
Толпы орков,брызги крови,стоны,крики,"плач младенца".Орки ноют и рыдают,ты смеёшься и чихаешь.
Ну а теперь серьёзно,вы спросите -"Что предложит вам эта игра без мультиплеера и кооператива?"
-Весёлая игра в стиле Tower Defense.Красивая мультяшная графика,море мяса...Что ещё нужно для полного счастья?Конечно же хороший юмор.Юмор встречается буквально на каждом шагу,так что со скуки не помрёте.А вот от ваших врагов погибнуть не так уж и сложно.
Ставим ловушки,лучников,воинов,стреляем из арбалета,рубим мечом головы,швыряемся кислотой,и многое другое.
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198004624039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1337497200}
review: If you've played Dungeon Defenders, a single player DD is the perfect description for this game.  It is a tower defense and 3rd person shooter.  The down side(s)? (besides it being only 1 player) You can upgrade your traps and weapons... once each, they are unforgiving with the penalties when units get through, and death animations where you arent sure when the enemy dies, not to mention some traps knock down and enemies get back up a few seconds later. It is quite fun.  This game is well worth 5 bucks. For me, its not long enough to justify more than that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997740965', 'num_games_owned': 7957, 'num_reviews': 2015, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1336978800}
review:
[h1] For The Horde! [/h1]

[code] Robot Entertainment  умудрились создать себе имя исключительно благодаря одной серии игр. Orcs Must Die получилась настолько душевной и увлекательной, что обожатели качественных  tower defense сразу же вознесли серию на пьедестал жанра.   [/code]

Приветствую всех и каждого, предложу вам окунуть себя в мир зубодробительных сражений, школу бесконтактного боя, попутно вы обучитесь обустраивать замки уютным интерьером с зажигательными бра, да и в целом весело проведете время с целой толпой неожиданных гостей. Боже, до прихода гостей осталось всего пять минут, а вам нечем их накормить? Ничего страшного, товарищи, поджарим первую десятку вошедших, наколем на шампуры пяток других, а после отобьем зеленоватое мясо до идеального состояния. 

Orcs Must Die! - action - tower defense, рассказывающая о бессовестных нападениях орков. Игроку предстоит отстоять довольно приличное количество укрепленных замков, обороняясь от зеленой нечисти не только руками, но и богатой коллекцией доступных ловушек и иных сооружений. Игра обрадует истинных стратегов, воздаст эмоциями за креативное мышление, а если вы привыкли решать проблемы самостоятельно, то всегда можно ринуться в бой с мечом и арбалетом, терзая плоть многочисленной армии. 

[h1] И вилкой в глаз, и палкой в таз!  [/h1]
В игре нет привычных для жанра башен, но есть целая гора оригинальных ловушек! Железные шипы, смоляные ямы, деревянные баррикады, бочки с динамитом, паровые механизмы, устройства с пружинами, отправляющие врагов на другой конец карты, ловушки с огненной серой, приманки, грибные плантации, заставляющие орков идти против своих же собратьев, всевозможные лезвия и стрелы из стен, настенные трамплины и давилки, качающаяся булава,  падающие потолки и даже автоматические баллисты! А если вам и этого мало, то на помощь прибегут рыцари и лучники, которых можно расставлять по карте из соображений безопасности. 
Я даже не вам назвал, но согласитесь, друзья, выбрать есть из чего, а еще все элементы можно комбинировать между собой, устраивая настоящее представление из падающих и горящих орков. 

Главный герой вообще походит на смесь Терминатора и Инспектора Гаджета, посему и без всяких ловушек сокращает жизнь чумазым созданиям. Арбалет имеет несколько режимов стрельбы, мечом тоже можно махать по обстоятельствам, а еще есть умение замораживать неприятелей, поджигать нечисть огненными шарами, отталкивать врагов порывами ветра, а после еще и молнией расколоть пару черепушек. Ну и где ваши супергерои теперь, пусть встают на сторону орков! 

[list]
[*] Рабочие достижения. Идут в общий зачет! 
[*] Играть действительно весело. Каждая новая волна противников повышает уровень сложности на пару градусов. 
[*] Смешная цена. 
[/list]

[h1] Однушка в Балаково. [/h1]
Начнем с того, что на протяжении всей игры нам необходимо защищать порталы от орков. Порталы будут разбросаны по углам уровней, так что вы даже в теории не сможете оборонять их самолично! Уровни удивят вас интересными решениями, но для идеального прохождения следует перепробовать разные тактики, уловить тайминги наиболее агрессивных волн, делать ставку на наиболее проблемное место, защищая его собственными руками. В игре довольно много уровней, так что вы всегда будете чувствовать тревогу перед новизной, а не сидеть на однотипных локациях, расставляя однотипные турели.  

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xBrfeEg979I&list=PL1EC87790B237DE0F

В Orcs Must Die довольно типичная для жанра экономика и система прокачки талантов. После прохождения испытаний вам открывают новые ловушки и выдают определенное количество очков, которые можно потратить на улучшение оружия\ловушек. При желании можно проходить уровни по кругу, но даже без унизительного гринда и перепрохождений, друзья, вы сможете пройти игру с удовольствием и долей стресса, ну а как без него, верно? 

[list]
[*] Вариативность прохождения уровней. 
[*] Удобная система прокачки ловушек.
[*] Несколько устаревшая, но приятная для глаз графика.
[/list]

[h1] Хвала полуросликам! [/h1]
Визуально игра только радует, но не стоит ожидать от нее реалистичных спецэффектов и иных благ современности, ибо Orcs Must Die вылупилась ровно десять лет назад, выходя даже тогда под бейджиком *Инди проекта*, но даже сейчас локации выглядят крайне атмосферно и завораживающе. 
Музыкальное сопровождение обрадует любителей тяжелой музыки, а звуковые эффекты позволят вам распознать расположение даже самого проворного врага на карте. 

[quote=Гродд, Рантхерд Змеекус] "Жить. Уйти на война. Убить все. Древние обычаи- хорошо." [/quote]

В конечном итоге я с превеликим удовольствием могу советовать Orcs Must Die всем любителям башенной защиты, а если вы обождете распродажу, то умудритесь выхватить этот бриллиант за сущие копейки! Желаю всем приятной игры, до скорых встреч! 

Хочу поблагодарить всех за отдачу и лайки, берегите нервы и избегайте шлака в магазине.
Если понравился обзор, то приглашаю в свою новую группу:
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/39102887-Sad-Jelien/

author: {'steamid': '76561197963446504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2684, 'last_played': 1650964147}
review:
What you need to know about this game:

It's a mix between third Person Shooter and Tower Defence game, where you are up agains a army waves apon waves of orcs and other creatures...

The music is really good the grafics are cartoonie but well done, and the humor of the game is simply brilliant! (you get alot of 1 liners while playing the game) and the game have an insane amout of replayability, especially if you are the kind of person that loves to complete a map "perfectly" like me (a perfectionist) at that point the game becomes more of a puzzle game when you try and figure out how you can kill all the enemies in the most cost efficient way possible and even if you aren't a perfectionist the game is still well worth its price if you ask me.

I highly recommend this game :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198032021531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1388, 'last_played': 1342594800}
review:
Tower Defense på en helt ny måde, det kan klart anbefales, det er hurtigt, udfordrende og der er ikke én gylden løsning på en given bane.
Hvis du kan lide tower defense er Orcs Must Die noget for dig, det er en bonus hvis du er god til skydespil også.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043627942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 4194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4194, 'last_played': 1342422000}
review:
OMG this game is **king amazing.  

Not only does it remind me of the good ol'd days of Dungeon keeper, as u play as a stretegist and 'sniper' but it kinda feels like it was really designed to be a puzzle game.(i.e. DK was not only a stretegy game, it did have a hint of antagonist FPS) 
It works very well at both!

Whats more is if u feel like ur not so much a trap maker & plotter, you can go in wit special powers and Blow things up and head shot to your Black heart's content.  

Otherwise if u dont want any 'savage' fps mayhem, then you can sit back and trouble-shoot your way to creating a perfect 'keeper's dungeon' to ensnare any numbskull orc that saunters by.

The Art, atmosphere, the music and  the theme are also very well done, .

This is a great package; if u havn't seen it - look at the action packed teaser. If you havn't got it, buy it.  This is well worth a token 5 quid that I picked it up for, if not only to help the Developers make another blinder like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013282045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1141, 'last_played': 1327996800}

toi, des pouvoirs fabuleux, des armes et pièges attrocement efficaces ...et DES ORCS à tirlarigo !!!
fps+Tower defense ?? possible sa ? ET OUI ! Awwww Yeaaaah ! et en plus en 3D avec effets et différents niveaux de graphismes (mon pc c'est de la dope et le jeu tourne au poil !).

author: {'steamid': '76561198043365852', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1335250800}
review:
I remember this one time I went to McDonalds, and I got a "Full Pounder." There was so much grease that the bag was falling apart by the time I went to eat it. I should mention that I had consumed an entire case of Vodka Cruisers about an hour prior, so I thought this was going to be the best. And for about 10 minutes and 3 bites, it was the best thing I had ever eaten. 
Angels sang in a heavenly choir of cheese, fat, meat and fermented sugar water, as I continued to poud shots of Vodka with dissolved skittles in it between bites of this monsterous grease ball.
Mid way through my fourth and final bite of this abomination of nature, the tides turned. The angels became weird and grotesque beasts, they pulled at my intestines and laughed in the most shrill and terrifying voices.
I felt it rising, and with a violent push of force my stomache contents launched from my insides. At this point I passed out.
Orcs Must Die is like the 10mins of angel booze burger bliss. You should play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960747231', 'num_games_owned': 3030, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 975, 'last_played': 1397769118}
review:
The foremost trap defense & hack&slash hybrid, Orcs Must Die! provides a very gratifying experience to the gamer looking for something different yet familiar.

Following the traditional tower defense formula, you protect one or more rifts from a wave-based offensive by a large variety of baddies by placing traps on their path to said structures.

Following the not-traditional  tower defense formula, after placing your traps and/or NPCs, you're allowed to join the fray while the orc/ogre/goblin/otherwise offensive is raging. Add your bladestaff, spells and/or crossbow to the mix and help defend the rifts.

Add some very nice music and voicework, and you get one of the definitive games of 2011.

I'll add jokes next time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967259930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3082, 'last_played': 1342940400}
review:
Une véritable référence dans les Tower Defenses. Graphiquement réussi, style cartoon, notre héro totalement déjanté a vraiment une grande classe, on se met à notre insu à danser en même temps que ce dernier à la fin de chaque niveau :). 

Chaque map peut être joué avec plusieurs stratégies différentes, de par la multitude de pièges/sorts/talents, les choix sont très variés, Youtube contribuant à apporter d’insoupçonné tactiques. 
Jeu nerveux, addictif par son ambiance et son scoring (quel joie de battre sa friendlist au score), une durée de vie correcte avec la campagne supplémentaire et le mode Nightmare, dont certaines maps sont de véritables challenges (notamment la 5e map du DLC).

Orcs must die! est vraiment le jeu qui m’a le plus marqué en 2011. Pas de mode coop, c’est bien le seul manque à cette perle, heureusement comblé dans OMD2.

review:
Hate orcs? Then this is the game for you. Here you take on the role as a war mage, and defend 24 fortresses on 24 levels. Choose from a number of traps and spells to defeat the orcs rushing towards the rift. 
One of the funniest games I've played in a long time. Killing orcs has never been funnier!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999484371', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1737, 'last_played': 1327219200}
review: It is not often that an indy single player game comes along with such polish and satisfying gameplay. I was sceptical at first, as most sp games fail to capture my attention for long these days, but OMD is an extremely fun game that mixes fps, tower defence and puzzle elements seamlessly. Art style and music are great, and even the humor which I thought cheesy at first, grows to add very entertaining experince.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006120079', 'num_games_owned': 2347, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1334732400}
review: Отличнейший tower-defence! Чувствуется, что сделано с любовью, с юмором, в дизайне присутствует определённый налёт "олдскульности". Игра в меру хардкорна, но дружелюбна и к казуалам вроде меня. Ждём второй части.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979276096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1360, 'last_played': 1342594800}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966299813', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1446, 'last_played': 1671506713}
review: This game is pure fun. It strikes a tough balance between having traps that are underpowered making the player do all the work, and the traps being overpowered leaving the player with nothing to do but sit back and dodge the bloodsplats. It's always a frantic rush around the level picking off the few stragglers and strategically thinning the ranks with a crossbow or magic spell.

review: This was a really great game; dynamic gameplay, somewhat developed characters, and a variety of mobs to slice and dice. The traps are good, but I definitly fell into a pattern of which to use/which were the most useful. Definitly good, pick it up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007448950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1151, 'last_played': 1342940400}
review:
A interactive Tower Defense Game that doesn't have you standing around watching the enemies die to your traps. Countless traps are available, use your sword and bow for direct and ranged combat or use powerful trinkets that give you the ability to control certain elements. Examine your surroundings and build the best death trap possible to hold back the Orcish Horde.

Highly addictive and endless amounts of fun. Well worth the $15.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058467339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1460080849}
review:
様々なトラップを配置し、押し寄せてくる大量のオークたちを撃退するゲームです。
主人公が倒されるか、リフトと呼ばれる場所に何回もオークたちに到達されるとゲームオーバー。
主人公自身もクロスボウや剣で攻撃できますが、それほど強くないので基本的にはトラップでの攻撃がメインです。
いろいろと試行錯誤して、どうやって効率よく撃退していくかを考えるのが楽しいです。

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197960279742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1177, 'last_played': 1333263600}
review:
Orcs Must Die! ist ein herausragendes Spiel, das den Spielerinnen und Spielern viel Freude bereitet. Die Kombination aus Tower-Defense und Action-Gameplay verleiht dem Spiel eine einzigartige Note. Die große Auswahl an Fallen und Waffen bietet den Spielerinnen und Spielern viel Freiheit und Kreativität, um ihre eigene Verteidigungsstrategie zu entwickeln.

Allerdings gibt es auch einige Schwächen im Spiel. Die Kampagne ist relativ kurz und die Schwierigkeit könnte besser ausbalanciert sein, um eine stärkere Herausforderung zu bieten. Außerdem könnte dem Spiel etwas mehr Abwechslung in der Umgebung und bei den Feinden guttun.

Insgesamt ist Orcs Must Die! jedoch ein exzellentes Spiel, das stundenlangen Spielspaß bietet. Die humorvolle Darstellung der Orcs und die Möglichkeit, sie auf kreative Weise auszuschalten, machen das Spiel zu einem unvergleichlichen Erlebnis. Für alle, die Tower-Defense-Spiele lieben, ist Orcs Must Die! ein absolutes Muss.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978230672', 'num_games_owned': 1479, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1334300400}
review: Tower Defense done right. Well is it really tower defense? It's a yes and no. Towers in this case are traps and you can place them during waves as well if you have money. However you yourself can also defend (much like Sanctum, in fact these two are simliar in more ways then one). Some of the early levels you can beat without usinga  single trap but later you'd have a very hard if not impossible time (in my opinion) to beat the levels without using traps. Traps vary from simple floor spikes and wall arrows to flame spitting floor traps and tar pits. It's not your traditional tower defense but it fits enough for me to put it in this genre. Upgrades to the traps comes outside of the levels and are permanent. No need to worry about which one to upgrade, you do it once and it's for good. There are a lot of traps and weapons in this game, a great variety for many different strategys and plenty of replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976239816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1332658800}
review: I was genuinely surprised by this game.  I like killing Orcs, (thank you Warhammer: Space Marine) so I decided to pick this up.  It is simply a great game. The dialogue knows its place, the graphics are beautiful, the gameplay is absolutely solid.   A great balance between combat and defensive strategy.  The maps ramp in difficulty quite nicely, and the creators were smart to add enemies that will mess with tactics that worked a few maps ago.  Forcing the player to really think about each map is something that shows good game design and I really admire it.  If you like tower defense games and are looking for something a bit different, definitely check this out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011180343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6331, 'last_played': 1563988308}
review: В этой игре Вам предстоит отбиваться от полчищ орков, защищая портал магическими заклинаниями, ловушками и баррикадами. Двадцать продуманных и сбалансированных карт, 3 уровня сложности и система прокачки ловушек заставят Вас продумывать оборону и не дадут заскучать. Из минусов можно отметить излишне высокую чувствительность мыши, что можно исправить лишь понижением dpi вашей мыши, а так же невозможность переназначать клавиши, но к счастью раскладка в игре классическая.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995235326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1332054000}
review:
While OMD is a very cute game, it suffers from some fairly crippling design flaws.  Firstly, most of the levels' difficulty results directly from one decision the devs made; instead of allowing choke-points or open spaces or a single path, the people who made this game decided that each level be bifurcated, but provided portals to allow us to traverse the two.  Pick one, devs.  Difficulty or ease.
As well, barricades are among the most expensive single buildables.
In this vein, it is much more economically viable to murder all the monsters yourself, as traps are A) very expensive and B) reset much too slowly.  So why, for the love of Atheismo, is there only a 'cash bonus to trap kills' purchaseable!?  Why can't we simply rely on weapons?  Oh, right-- because the devs decided to split each level in two, so we can't simply use one route or the other.  You're forced to use both the (mandatory) crossbow and (shoddy, unreliable) traps.
Still, it's a fun romp, even for its faults and flaws.

review: Is there better way to spend night than slice hordes of orcs? Probably yes, but it wouldn’t be so fun. This is one of games which gave me most fun of all games I played. It has proper mixture of action, fun, creativity and humour. It is not too hard to finish, but same time enough challenging.  It has great replayability because offers almost endless possibilities to combine traps and spells to get better score. Game is cheap even at full price, and if you get it on sale as I was it is bargain.

このゲームの遊び方は二通りあって、

脳内シミュレーションが暴走し、
夢の中でもトラップを置くことになるでしょう。

review: If you're a fan of indy games and tower defense, this game is worth a go.  It's cheap, so you won't be out much if you won't like it.  There are plenty of acheesements, and it's got some nice humor about it (like Magicka!  go go!).

author: {'steamid': '76561197964397512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 769, 'last_played': 1340780400}
review:
Think Dungeon Defenders, but Single Player only, and more chaotic. Basically, you're this warmage guy that needs to defend these portals called Rifts, and you need to defend it from the orcs and other enemies that try to go through it.

You can lay traps, place guardians, use a bow or sword, or even use magic such as fire, ice, lightning, or even wind to defeat the orcs.

A pretty fun title overall, it has a good amount of replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970739339', 'num_games_owned': 674, 'num_reviews': 563, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 837, 'last_played': 1325404800}
review: I have played relatively few Tower Defense games, it being a genre that does not generally appeal to me. Orcs Must Die essentially said to me, "Okay, so you don't like sitting around watching towers kill things. How about if YOU get to kill things too?" And I was like "Okay OMD, I'm listening." And what fun I had. Orcs Must Die strikes an amazing blend of frantic third-person combat with the strategy of Tower Defense, creating a game that forces you to think and react with equal speed. It is challenging, occasionally frustrating but ultimately very rewarding, not every game leaves me feeling so satisfied when the credits finally roll. It's damn funny too, with its idiotic but endearingly determined protagonist and an Ork horde that's quite disenchanted with the whole marauding business and would rather not die horrible deaths in the service of their whiny sorceress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027947201', 'num_games_owned': 2568, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1455813730}

review: A unique twist of the Tower Defense genre of games using traps instead of towers and 3rd person action. You are encouraged to use a crazy mix of traps and spells to rack up ridiculous combos and kill streaks. With 24 Levels, plenty of trap, weapon and spells, 3 upgrade trees and a lot of orcs and other nasties to slay, for $14.99 you cannot go wrong with purchasing this game.

review: БЛИН до чего же сложная и увлекательная игра. Забавный юмор, во вселенной варкрафт, товер дефенс с большой буквы, много веселья и развлекухи вам обеспечено. Жаль только что нет кооператива.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980711712', 'num_games_owned': 441, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1588, 'last_played': 1636455233}
review:
There's so many positive things I can say about Orcs Must Die. It's a game which won't disappoint even the most hard to please gamer, as It's packed with so much fun, humour, and thought.

Orcs Must Die is more or less the same as Plants vs Zombies. It's a game where you must place traps in order to stop the horde of enemies from reaching their goal, and every new level brings a new trap. With every new trap of course brings a new enemy, so be prepared for this when organising your traps.
Aswell as traps you can also use magic, and choose upgrades through-out the various levels through a card system.

Being as this is the first game from Robot Entertainment, I give this game a big 10/10. There isn't many people who won't enjoy this game. It's pretty hard to find weak points. There's few bugs, has good graphics, and overall perfect gameplay.

Pick this awesome game up at any opportunity. You won't regret it.
