author: {'steamid': '76561197973368766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1351926000}
review:
Juego que le da una vuelta de tuerca al género tower defense, con un estilo más cercano a la acción cañera de un shoot'em up que a al formato rpg visto en, por ejemplo, Dungeon Defenders.

Tremendamente adictivo y a un precio asequible, su única y gran lacra es ser únicamente singleplayer. Hay que ser gili para no meter coop online (como mínimo a 2) en un juego de este tipo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028432338', 'num_games_owned': 1087, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1477153787}
review: Игра довольно таки необычна в своем жанре "tower defence". Очень смешная, драйвовая и кровавая + "пораскинуть мозгами" тоже придется в некоторых моментах. Купил на распродаже в стиме, нисколько не жалею. Отличная игра, еще бы кооператив для полного тотального хаоса :D  Игра создавалась для стёба и она действительно доставляет.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993388546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1324540800}
review:
Hello, Gamers.

Look at your Steam Library, now back to mine, now back at your Library, now back to mine. Sadly, yours isn't mine.

Why? Because if you stopped for a moment with all of your other games, you could be bisecting, stabbing, flaming and otherwise giving hordes of Orcs a very bad day, all while having an absolute blast of a time.

Okay, I'm horrible at copying Old Spice commercials... Orcs Must Die! is a game that describes itself right in its title, there's you, there's the Orcs, the latter must die. The fun is in how you have them die. The game is blindingly simple, the "plot" is idiotically brilliant, and it's fun all around.

Kind of like Warhammer Fantasy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008693173', 'num_games_owned': 965, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1875, 'last_played': 1342076400}
review:
An excellent single player indie game.

Has 3 game modes - warmage, nightmare and high scoring. Played within that order. Once you have completed the game on nightmare you can aim for the highscore tables, but high scores are achieved by getting combo kills, so require entirely different tactics. 

The traps are interesting, there are a handful that you will never use and others you will use in some levels. The swinging mace is one of the most deadly traps you can use.

2 DLCs - Lost adventures adds 5 maps, 1 is a map already in the game played in reverse (a very unique map and a very entertaining map, playing in reverse does make it harder). They also added a handful of new monsters, like the frost bat. Well worth getting. 
              - the second DLC is not as worth while, contains a few new traps and weapons. Accessable from the start of the game as well, which makes the first few levels extremely easy if used. 

However, both DLCs are worthing picking up when on offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970819060', 'num_games_owned': 1437, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 922, 'last_played': 1326182400}
review:
A variation of tower defense where you have to place traps to defend cores from invading monsters. While there's lots of toys (with new ones being thrown at you every level), some get left in the dust/unused (boom barrel, steam trap), while others get progressively more broken as the game goes on (archers, paladins, decoys). My biggest complaint is it's missing the stat tracking most tower defenses have to help you maximize your gold usage,  leaving you to guesswork if your traps are laid out properly. The maps are uniquely constructed, often requiring specific tactics to clear effectively, making each map tense and engaging. About a third of your arsenal are weapons for your character which keeps you in the action most of the time, unlike most games in this genre.

With 24 maps you're looking at a sizable tower defense game with plenty of crossbow-twitching, fireball-slinging, ice-shattering orc carnage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033572613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 2338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2338, 'last_played': 1323763200}
review:
Orcs Must Die's formula is simple, but what little it does it does very, very well and is a riot to play. The traps are a ton of fun to use and trap deaths look fantastic and satisfying. The later additions of simplistic spell trees and spells round the game up nicely and killing orcs was never this much fun xD.
If you get into the competitive nature of the game you'll find out how surprisingly deep it is as customizing your character and traps and selecting the 'right' ones can greatly impact your final stage score and the speed at which you move and place your traps can mean all the difference.

8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197977171864', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1330329600}
review:
This hate-speech-disguised-as-tower-defense is just another example of anti-orc racism to add to the ever-growing pile. The orcs as portrayed in-game are dull and dimwitted creatures who walk straight into spike pits right after seeing their fellows impaled before their very eyes, a disgustingly prejudiced parody of these noble souls. Additionally, you play a single human against waves of orcs, a design decision that encourages speciesist imperialism in a decidedly unsubtle way.

But I'm sure you'll agree the gameplay's a lot of fun, right Adolf?

review: Pretty fun game. It's a tower defense game, but it's also a 3rd person action game. I do not like regular tower defense games, as they are all about setting up a defense and then waiting for the wave to end. In this one, you get to pick various weapons to fight off the enemies, while setting traps and defenses. Definitely give this game a try, and buy it if it goes on sale again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017965579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 676, 'last_played': 1324454400}
review: An outstanding take on the tower defense genre. The game offers genuine choice as to how to complete levels, and the variety of levels as well as the decent challenge will keep you drawn in. It takes 8-10 hours to finish the campaign with good scores, and then there's Nightmare mode to contend with. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010201914', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 867, 'last_played': 1342940400}
review: Fun, quirky tower defense game that is simple to pick up, and allows you to defend your castle the way you want to. With all of the DLC(new weapons/traps), you are given a wide array of weapons and traps to set up to help you kill invading orcs. Just take a look around your map, learn the path the orcs are going to be taking to get to your Rift(the "main base" you're trying to protect, if you will), pick your arsenal for the map, and let it begin! Each Rift will allow only a certain number of orcs to be let through, but let any more than the maximum run through it and it's game over. Campaign lasts a good 7-11 hours depending on how fast you play and how good you become at the game, and then the rest is just playing the game because it is a fun way to pass the time. Recommended for those who enjoy strategical games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977718788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1497, 'last_played': 1335337200}

The humor is great (the Orcs have tons of bizarre lines they yell, and your hero's victory dances are awesome), but the gameplay gets old kind of fast.  I really enjoy playing it in short bursts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046611698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1479, 'last_played': 1658707085}
review:
Nota: 9.0/10

A sua simplicidade em entregar um bom tower defense faz com que Orcs Must Die! seja um dos melhores jogos do gênero. Sua localização para nossa língua, seus mapas variados e seu combate frenético são seus principais pontos positivos. O ponto negativo? Hum... Talvez o jogo, de tanto que te entretém, pareça curto. Mas cada centavo gasto vale a pena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010553208', 'num_games_owned': 1034, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 1693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1498, 'last_played': 1666711792}
review:
The tower defense genre has always been evolving over the years and seeing FPS games now entering this arena made me nervous at first , but after letting sanctum slip by I thought I would try this instead and......WOW!
Frantic gameplay that really makes you use the noggin about what types of traps should go where and how to lure the orcs into them.
Great level design and colorful crisp graphics.
The arrogant none-too-bright d-bag protagonist made me laugh out loud at times and the story was cute.
For the  $5 I spent (including all the DLC) I'd say I got one hell of a deal here , considering I would have paid full price had I known just how much fun this is.
If I had to rate it : 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197963562298', 'num_games_owned': 3346, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 884, 'last_played': 1324368000}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is an excellent blend of tower defense and third person shooter. You're cast into the role of a "War Mage", caught amidst turmoil from a beastly invasion. Poised with the duty to defend humanity, you must now prevent the orcs from entering the rifts that bind your world to theirs.

OMD is a joyous, albeit mostly mindless affair. It offers the delightful satisfaction of mowing down hordes of enemies and making you feel like an empowered hero (as most games should). There's room for strategizing, but not so much as to make the experience trying.

With over two dozen traps, variety is in no short supply. Players are encouraged to adapt to each map and pick traps that will maximize your deadliness. However, I found myself defaulting to the same half dozen traps each round, indicating that balance might be a slight issue.

Nonetheless, OMD is overwhelmingly enjoyable. For $15, it's a great buy, offering hours of fun. For under $5, it's a must have!

Grade: B+

author: {'steamid': '76561197963902299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1101, 'last_played': 1324454400}
review:
A very fun defense romp. It feels a little more "puzzley" than Sanctum or Dungeon defenders, as opposed to hectic and shootery. Very well-crafted, and quite funny to boot. It's very hard to pull off an arrogant, irreverent, wise-cracking protagonist who doesn't just come across as obnoxious; but in this case, I think they did a great job.

UPDATE: I found this game much more fun than the sequel, and if you're only going to play one of them, I recommend this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970512110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1324368000}
review: It's Lord of the Rings meets Sanctum in this brilliant action/tower defense game. From the moment you lay your first trap you will be drawn in by the distinctive characters. As the title implies there is only one objective, you must kill every last orc that charges into your keep. The myriad of traps at your disposal, as well as your keen sword and spells, get this task done with prejudice. It's wickedly entertaing and slightly demented watching the orcs hurl themselves into spinning blades and explosive barrels, all the while taunting you and laughing about their impending victory. I had childish glee when the hero started trash talking back. For a game with only one hero and a handful of enemy types it is dripping with charm and style. However it is not without minor issues. The animations could use a little more work and the single minded gameplay won't last forever, but these are barely worth mentioning. The dark sense of humor and the variety of death mark this as a must play8/10

review: Tower Defense game with lots of orcs in it. If you like tower defense game, give it a try. It is a surprisingly good game with tons of upgrades and traps (that are often funny to watch as they trigger various animations TO and ON the orcs). author: {'steamid': '76561198002510306', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1343631600}
review:
There are Tower Defence games, and then there are games like Ork's Must Die. I very action packed game with a major focus on letting the player getting some insane kill counts and the like along with some brutal animations to follow. It ramps up the challanges as you progress, and offers allot of tools for you to pick, choose, and play around with to figure out what stratergys go best with your play style. This game also never once holds your hand, expecting you to figure things out on your own and run with it. 

If there are any real flaws towards this game, it's base price at times feels a wee steep in my pocket for a 20 stage ( x2 if you count nightmare mode's alt mob waves ) single player experance with maxing out skulls, and climbing the leaderboards the only thing left once done with it. But admittily for $15, you are getting something that looks and plays like a full buget game as well, and that's pretty nice for a new devloper.

Regardless highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011237429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1878, 'last_played': 1615859171}
review:
Of all the recent first-person tower defenses to come out recently, OMD wins on variety and comic relief. A bit annoying you can't take your upgrade points back, though.

One note: Get the Artifact DLC. The poison satchel has saved my butt several times, and it alone is worth the price of the pack... well, the sale price anyways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012200220', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2006, 'last_played': 1336546800}
review: Innovative and fun. You can tell that the developers really put time into this, and that's a big deal considering that half the games that come out these days are just made to make a quick buck and lack a "wow factor." Just beating it is fun, but it has replay value in its Nightmare Mode. You might also try to get one of the coveted spots on the leaderboard. The leaderboard adds another fun, challenging aspect to Orcs Must Die. Robot Entertainment doesn't overcharge for the DLC, and it is also worth the small price. The game has been on sale twice in the past month, and I'm sure it will be again in the future. It's worth the price they put on it. When you get it on sale, you're getting an amazing deal. Buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962071163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 1180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1180, 'last_played': 1343545200}
review: The game blends 3rd person shooting and tower defence incredibly well. If you prefer playing it as a shooter it gives you a handful of ridicilous weapons that can throw orcs around or freeze them in place. If you'd rather play a tower defence game it gives you tons of traps and towers that let you turn orcs into gibbed bits in creative ways. Overall it's a colourful, energetic and all around great game. Buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975132018', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1434840342}
review:
I'm a big Bloon Tower Defense player, so I thought that I had the end all of tower defense games on my iphone already.  Oh how wrong I was.  This is a great tower defense game, with a nice bit of hack-and-slash thrown in.  I'm about halfway through the first act ( I think) and while some towers I have now seem to serve no purpose, and although I keep picking them when I first get them (eg steam trap without a combo for it) I'm sure later in the game they'll have a great combo (certain trap seem to be designed to be put together).

The only thing I wish is that I could choose from any trap/weapon whenever I want, instead of picking and choosing a certain amount at the start of a round.  It's just something I'm used to from playing Bloons, but I've gotten over it already.  Thats part of the challenge.

I'd give this a 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197961167439', 'num_games_owned': 1579, 'num_reviews': 720, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1636935074}
review:
This is a really clever and fun TPS tower defense strategy game. The dungeon atmosphere really makes it stand out from the growing crowd. Lots of weapon and trap unlocks give the right incentive to want to push further in the campaign missions. It does get quite difficult as a single player game because the monsters often attack from opposite sides of the map and it's hard to be fighting two places at once--they do provide portals to shorten the journey but they always seem to be poorly positioned (would have been nicer if you got to place the portals yourself). There is also a high dependence on your shooter skills because the trap reload times take forever in the heat of battle, although it is possible I haven't figured out the right mix. So far, I've only seen upgrades for traps, not weapons which is a bummer.

No coop is the game's major weakness, but it is enjoyable despite.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024495626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1323417600}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971115891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2339, 'last_played': 1355126400}
review: This game is seriously addictive and very fun.  If you enjoy tower defense games and always wished you could be down there to get that damn last straggler, this is your game.  Tons of replay value, and quite funny to boot.  Make sure you get the artifacts of power DLC though, that stuff is great!

review: Ótimo jogo. Se você gosta do gênero tower defense + action,  Orcs Must Die! é uma ótima pedida. Para mim foi uma ótima surpresa, não o conhecia e comprei somente por conta da promoção de Black Friday, e o jogo é bem melhor do que eu esperava, muito bem feito em todos os aspectos e divertido.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969300947', 'num_games_owned': 519, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 815, 'last_played': 1322985600}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996311925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 923, 'last_played': 1324368000}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is a real gem of an indie game. It offers a creative take on the tower defense genre with plenty of options to approach each challenge. The mixture of strategy and action game elements coupled with tight controls flow together very well, leaving you with one very satisfying experience. The game also has a good sense of dark humor that, while it may get repetitive at some points, has yet to come across as annoying.

All in all, I highly recommend this game. If you love the tower defense genre you shouldn't think twice about getting it. The game offers a great experience that is well worth the price and is still fun to play again and again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983586649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1337410800}
review: Não tem o que dizer, esse jogo é demais. Pessoalmente, o jogo que Sancturn devia ter sido. Isso aqui é PURO sadismo. Armadilhas que funcionam de maneiras totalmente únicas e permitem inumeras combinações. Levanto os orcs naquela ponte com geysers de vapor para meus arqueiros fuzilarem-os ou faço um labirinto de barricadas com espinhos na entrada e lâminas brutais na saída? Ou coloco uma plataforma no fim que os jogue de volta ao começo? Ou melhor, uma parede que os empurre para a lava! Um jogo que levanta a adrenalina enquanto você se certifica que nenhum Orc passou de seu plano brilhante,mas que que te dá uma quantidade de brinquedos e diz: faça como você achar melhor. O estilo artístico é bom, o personagem principal meio clichê mas divertidissimo. A história é fraca,mas não é esse o objetivo: só um exercício puramente sádico da sua criatividade.

review: This game is rollicking good fun.  For some reason, it reminds me of Plants vs. Zombies - the other game recently that's made me excited to play.  It's got humour, levelling up, strategy, and running around screaming while you try and shoot orcs.  Plus,  it's an indie game.  What's not to like?

author: {'steamid': '76561197987622717', 'num_games_owned': 494, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 840, 'last_played': 1331794800}
review:
Super splattriges, schräges Orcgemetzel

Hierbei handelt es sich nicht um das typische Towerdefence Game vom Spielemax um der Ecke, viel mehr ist es eine Mischung aus Fallen setzen und Shooter mit einer Priese Scharzen Humors.

Orcs must die! macht wirklich Spaß und wird im Laufe des Spiels echt fordernd.
Wer auf Comic-Gemetzel ala TF2 steht, sich gerne zu hause hinter tötlichen Fallen verschanzt und schon immer mal eine Orc von innen sehen wollte, sollte sich das game besorgen!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977980809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1458, 'last_played': 1380298587}
review: Nice game to waste some time. The challenges can be realy hard depending on the equipment you chose. I recommend you get the DLC "Artifacts of Power" as it contains 2 very powerfull items. Overall its a realy good tower defence game where you sometimes have to fight on more than one frontline at the same time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019945509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2445, 'last_played': 1351494000}
review:
Un jeu au départ sans prétention, mais un sacré défouloir !
On se prend vite au jeu du kikimeter en cherchant les meilleurs moyens de tuer de l'Orc. 
Qui plus est, le nombre de combinaisons entre les différents pièges, voire le développement du personnage simplement via les Tisseuses offrent une grande diversité du gameplay.
Il y avait longtemps qu'un tel jeu ne m'avait pas scotché devant l'écran sans voir le temps passer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980683930', 'num_games_owned': 610, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1322208000}
review:
Yet again, this is NOT a recommendation. More like a warning to steer clear and spend your money elsewhere on more worthy titles.

The game has some very nice video's that hype the game up to levels if completely fails to reach when you finally start playing the game. And while this is not appearant at first. It slowly start sinking in after about 2 - 3 levels of this non-stop ogre killing.

To be honest, it's trying to be a tower-defence game but utterly fails at it as there are worse looking titles out there that are more fun and more challenging.

The game runs on most computers, looks nice, has some funny animations at times, but utterly fails at delivering any type of gameplay that was promised. Well, to correct myself, fails to deliver any type of gameplay that is FUN and was promised.

Recommandation is to go buy warcraft 3 and play tower defence there.

Rating 9 of 100

author: {'steamid': '76561197988922281', 'num_games_owned': 3128, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1324368000}
review:
A really fun and frantic "TD-ish" singleplayer game.

Though it isn't really a TD game; I think it's safe to say that the game got quite the inspiration from the tower defense aspect but instead makes use of traps, utilities and whatnot to defend your fortresses. It's even possible to make use of "pathing" with well-placed barricades as to lure the waves into chokepoints.

I don't have much to say about this game except that I enjoyed it for what it was worth. The downside with this game is the rather short campaign/story and once you've got the right set-up it''s just a matter of adding stuff for overkill. In my opinion it would have a lot more replayability if it had some sort of survival mode or challenges with increasing difficulty.

This is however subject to change with possible DLCs but as for now, this is the verdict..

Definitely a fun game, worth a playthrough but unless you're obsessed with killing greenskins over and over again, it won't offer much replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994133145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2409, 'last_played': 1546981257}
review:
Quite possibly the most underrated game of the year, this gem is filled with fine-tuned and "always fun" values that I never see anymore. It combines the best elements of effecient defense strategies with TPS/beat-em-up gameplay. The variety in different ways you can play each level gives it immense replay value. Only downside is that the first playthrough might be a bit easy for experienced players of either genre. Fortunately, there's a Hard Mode included that can appeal to you.

Ever played tower defense games, and wished you were on the field to make up for the terrible micro happening before your eyes? This can put your abilities to the test if you use tactics that empower your own character instead of countless traps and guardians.

There's a goddamn demo, see the glory or yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009522868', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1342076400}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997290149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1320998400}
review:
Out of the.. 4 some odd dozen tower defense games to be out right now, buy this one if you want a supremely well made single player experience that rewards you for both being good at shooting, and using that pink wrinkled mound between your eyescopes!

I love the protagonist, I love the orcs, I love the traps, and you feel genuine satisfied for killing them, and killing them well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996656102', 'num_games_owned': 842, 'num_reviews': 335, 'playtime_forever': 1751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1751, 'last_played': 1355731200}
review:
Co można powiedzieć o produkcji, która na wstępie wita gracza komunikatem, ilu przeciwników do tej pory zabił? Gra typu tower defence, składa się ona z 24 etapów, na których zasadniczo robi się to samo: broni szczeliny przed falami orków przy pomocy czarów, pułapek oraz kuszy i miecza. Gra zyskuje z każdą kolejną chwilą spędzoną przy niej - im dalej tym trudniej: nowi przeciwnicy, więcej bram z których wylewa się więcej fal oraz nowe pułapki. I jeśli chce się grę po prostu zaliczyć - nie ma większego problemu. Jednak jeśli gracz jest ambitny i będzie chciał zaliczyć każdą mapę na 5 gwiazdek (a potem włączyć wyższy poziom trudności: koszmar), to przyjdzie mu odkryć mnogość przemyślanych pułapek, czary oraz taktyki na każdą mapę.

Na chwilę obecną mam nabite 17h w ciągu paru dni oraz ponad 25 tysięcy zabitych orków. I nadal mam sporo do zrobienia... 7+/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002391261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 2280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2280, 'last_played': 1343631600}
review:
You may think this game looks boring and is pretty one sided but the moment I saw the trailer this definately looked fun. And then I won the game and later bought the DLC on a sale.

This game is hilarious. I'm loving it. You pretty much have to fight against waves and waves of orcs but you get all these brilliant contraptions such as flip tiles, wall arrows, your own archers, floor spikes, explosive barrels so you can build up your defences and hold off against the enemy waves. It gets really challenging when you have a few entry points but if you think well and have a good defence structure, it's a breeze. Endless action, a very funny protagonist and visuals that make you feel like your in a cartoon, it's awesome. 9/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044915116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 1623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1623, 'last_played': 1324022400}
review:
Ostensibly a Tower Defense game, Orcs Must Die is a downright fantastic take on the genre.  With an art style reminiscent of Torchlight and a light-hearted sense of humour revolving around all the myriad ways to kill Orcs, OMD is as fun to watch and listen to as it is to play. The game offers a lot of options, and it does a good job of making them all viable.  You can be just as effective using traps to decimate Orcs as you can be wading in with Crossbow and Bladestaff.  You can use traps to deal direct damage, or take advantage of physics and fling the Orcs around like ragdolls.  You can also opt to be a weapon-wielder, lopping heads and shooting faces, or you can load up with spells and lay all kinds of elemental smackdown.  Or any combination of the above.  

Orcs Must Die is an aesthetically pleasing game that transcends its origins and does not disappoint in living up to its namesake.  This game is excellent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972230166', 'num_games_owned': 772, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1345618800}
review: Orcs Must Die takes the tower defense formula and tweaks it just enough to be something a little different; there's greater emphasis on both traps and your own combat abilities rather than just towers, allowing you to become more involved in the action. Combating the invading orcs and either watching them run through your stabbing, slicing, or smashing traps or dicing them up with your bladestaff and puncturing them with your crossbow bolts rewards you with some entertaining gibs, and the quips from both your character and the green brutes is good for a few chuckles. If you're looking to kill a short time with one or two rounds or fill out a boring afternoon with several more, Orcs Must Die is definitely an entertaining diversion worth looking into.

review:
I bought this game expecting to maybe play it for an hour and move on, but I ended up marathoning it from start to end. The gameplay is fun and innovative (you get a feeling of reward for creating complex traps and you really develop your own playstyle as you go), and the characters (that is, yourself, the mage, the enemy leader and the orcs) are easily likeable.
I recommend it to anyone who's ever liked a tower defense game.

review: Ohja hier ist durchdachtes denken (jaja doppelt) vonnöten die Level sind anfang sehr einfach zum eingewöhnen nach jedemn erflolgreich absolvierten level spielt man sich eine weitere Verbesserung frei. Die Wertung in form von schödeln ist auch gleichzeitig die Wöhrung für das auftunen der verschiedenen Gegenstände die in den späteren level und vor allem im Alptraummodus sehr vonnöten sind :). Alles in allem einfach ein unterhaltsames spiel wo man mal ein bissjen Grips braucht !

author: {'steamid': '76561198037344604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1324368000}
review: Orcs must die! - игра до предела веселая и увлекательная! Могучий маг, защищавший крепость многие годы и истребивший тысячи орков, пал, поскользувшись на крови, но у него остался ученик, не особо блеставший умом. Нам предлагают встать на защиту порталов в роли этого ученика. По ходу игры предстоит перебить не одну тысячу орков, используя ловушки, оружие, заклинания, артефакты, хитрость и смекалку. Наш подопечный наберется ума и к концу игры станет матерым воякой. Весь этот геноцид орков полон шуток и черного юмора, кстати и графика весьма симпатичная.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993829864', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 900, 'last_played': 1324454400}
review: A really challenging and rewarding game. It's looots of fun und until now my favourite TD-version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046224629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1500, 'last_played': 1342335600}
review:
Отличная, веселая, безумная игра!
Большое количество ловушек, заклинания, стражники - никогда еще уничтожение орков не было таким веселым. Все - геймплей, стилистика, реплики персонажей, музыка - на высшем уровне. Сюжет? А кого интересует сюжет в играх подобного рода?
В общем, такой интересной и затягивающей игры я давно уже не встречал.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970879744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1576261201}

review: Orcs Must Die! eccelle in tutto quello che propone, a partire dal design di mostri e trappole fino alla costruzione labirintica ed originale dei livelli, capaci di regalare un buon grado di sfida anche ai giocatori più esperti. Un acquisto consigliato dunque, che vede come unico grande difetto l'assenza di una modalità multiplayer, fattore che avrebbe permesso al titolo di fare un meritato salto di qualità.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044441900', 'num_games_owned': 465, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1690, 'last_played': 1422402165}
review: Wow this game is addicting! Part shooter, part tower defense, this game is AMAZING! Not to mention hilarious! The point of the game is to defend Rifts, and to do this you must place traps on the floors, use magic, and your trusty crossbow. But the funny part comes with the way you can defeat the opposing Orcs. One way is to place Spring Boards on the floor that launch the orcs whereever you aim the board. This can result in humorous and deadly outcomes. Another example is the dialogue, just plain goofy! Plus....drum roll please....ACHIEVEMENTS!!! Yup another game with achievements to keep the gamer coming back for more slightly-stoopid bragging rights! Pick this game up! Its unique, funny, fun, and OMG FUN!!!

review: A very fun game. It's kind of like Sanctum but with a fantasy setting instead of a science fiction setting. Build traps, unleash the horde and kill waves of orcs with your crossbow/sword and the traps you've build. At first I thought it was a little easy, but obviously the further you progress teh harder the levels become. I recommend this game to everyone that likes towerdefense-shooter hybrids. The only downside is the lack of multiplayer, but that's what Dungeon Defenders is for I guess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006840859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1391906115}
review:
Dont go into this game expecting a story or a overly contrived chracter.... The game is exactly as the title suggest... and boy is it satisfying 

It promises nothing more than orc slaying. 

To understand the game think of it in the "Tower Defense" genre. 

Its real charm is how it does not take itself seriously. 


For what it is the game is an easy 8/10 But as a TD game it is a 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198009068740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1319698800}
review:
Get this game. It's got a great art style, cartoony - but not excessively so, bloody - but not excessively so, and fun - excessively so (sic). 

The DLC is worth every cent as well, the few new traps and spells are great fun, and the new missions are challenging as heck. Turn it up to Nightmare for additional fun and frustration. 

This game makes me feel like the defense of Helms Deep, every single mission. It's you against hundreds, thousands of orcs. Cannot recommend this game enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997632863', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 1851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1810, 'last_played': 1429050576}
review:
An awesome FPS/Tower defense combo game which seems to be really in these days. A Single player worth every penny. Alas its graphic engine is comparable to Valve's Source engine... this means it's rather unstable and causes the "Graphic card not responding" bug on certain levels or using certain abilities. If you are farmiliar to that bug dont buy it unless on the discount rack.
Edit:
Using Nvidia's "Alternative rendering mode 1" resolves the problem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020938916', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1674949861}
review: Orcs Must Die - Увлекательная стратегическая аркада с интересной задумкой и неплохой реализацией. Малоизвестным разработчикам удалось выпустить весьма качественную игру. Будем надеяться, что Robot Entertainment возьмутся за продолжение, при этом уделив внимание недостающим мелочам и кооперативу!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000486674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1487769885}

author: {'steamid': '76561197965932492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 2836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2836, 'last_played': 1343890800}
review:
買うしかないね!
一人プレイ専用ですが、罠を仕掛け、自らも武器を取り、オークの攻撃を防ぐ。
日本語も入っていますし、軽快な台詞回しも気に入っています。
難しいと感じるところも多いが、クリアできたときは余計にうれしく感じます。
製作元は元々AGEofEMPIRESシリーズ作っていたメンバーなので、
バランス感覚が素晴らしいのかもしれませんね。

author: {'steamid': '76561197985686775', 'num_games_owned': 2177, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1882, 'last_played': 1343458800}
review:
Orcs Must Die is a dating simulator based on actual events, about a guy who lives in a castle and joins a shady online dating service. He then spends the rest of his life attempting to interview these would-be green suitors to find the love of his life. Sadly, his dates often rush the gates and fall victim to the castle's insanely jealous defense system. It's up to our fair prince to use his trusty Crossbow of Love and his Sword of Choosing to place that special touch on the suitors that meet his fancy, and who aren't grieviously injured by the castle.

All in all, I found this to be a very tragic tale, as well as a cautious reminder of the horrors of online dating. It's also a really great game, even if you don't usually happen to like historical-based dating simulators.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999469389', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2748, 'last_played': 1376697596}
review: Fuck me! all the money I waste on "big name" games. Sometimes i want to just have soe fun and not have to remember hundreds of buttons, tutorials, and every other dynamic in the book. Same time I may want something simple..but not low production indie crap(not saying all indie is crap). THIS game totally suprsed me..concept is simple..production values are very high and it is one of those games you play, you enjoy and you think it will soon pass....a few hours later there you still are. One of the best games i have played in a long time. It has the simplity of the 80's but it has some cool tricks up it's sleeve and is the perfect mix....fuck civ 5 lol get this and actually smile about your purchase!

author: {'steamid': '76561197976959988', 'num_games_owned': 680, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1330329600}
review:
Bellino bellino, è stato un vero affare per 2,75€, ne vale sicuramente di più!
Grafica leggerina, ci ho giocato benissimo sul portatile.
Da non sottovalutare! Il gameplay mi ricorda un po' Plants Vs Zombies ma con molta più azione.
E' anche un po' più difficile di PvZ...
Beh menomale, penso che siamo tutti stanchi dei soliti sparatutto da bambini menomati...
Peccato per l'assenza di modalità coop!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968399174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1345791600}
review: Highly recommended! If you enjoy tower defense or are a fan of Dungeon Defenders, this humorous game cranks up the difficulty accordingly as you go along and offers an abundance of towers and weapons to use. While the DLC is debatable (you definitely want the map pack, though), the grenade-like acid weapon in the weapons pack makes things a little easier and gives you a reason to use your mana. So, pick this up while it's still cheap!

review: Honestly one of the best indie game i have had the chance to play, simple premices and tons of fun, the closest thing u'll find to a dungeon keeper, one of the rare games i just play after a bad day :) just makes me laugth and relaxes me, only thing i would say agaisnt it would be it's too bad they didn't addedd a coop mode, many dungeons you play woulda been perfect for a 2 man team, also it's too bad they didn't added a loot system, the game lends itself to collecting loot to upgrade ur war mage but unfortunatly they didn't go for that aspect, oh well can't have everything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004303241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1330588800}
review: Selten soviel Fun mit so nem Billig-Game gehabt. Macht übelst Laune, für alle Fans von Dungeon Keeper und Tower Defense-Games ein absolutes Must-have. Grafik echt nice, Splatter-Effekte fürn so'n Comic-Abklatsch recht gut gelungen und im späteren Spielverlauf recht knackig vom Skill-Bedarf. Die 15,- sind definitiv den Spaß wert !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973444709', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1206, 'last_played': 1388449009}
review: Un mix entre tower defence et FPS mais surtout une vraie boucherie. Tout est dans le titre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995963811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1324454400}
review:
Great Tower Defence kinda game. 

You play a hero that you can upgrade/boost during levels, place traps on ground/walls or even roof.

It isn't only a "place so much towers as possible" kind of game. You can use tactics or even try to fight orcs away with your hero only.

I recommend this strongly.

review: 斬新なシステムも流行りのCo-opもないけど、作りがすごく丁寧なTD。ボウガンや剣で戦いつつも、基本的には様々な罠を使ってオークをザクザク仕留めてゆくバランス。罠といえば思い出す、PSの名作「刻命館」「影牢」とは…序盤は似て非なるもの、でも中盤以降でスコアアタックを考え始めると懐かしさが込み上げてくるかも。完全日本語化済み、地雷になりがちな音声吹き替えもハイクオリティで完璧！

review: Awesome, really addictive, FPS/strategy/combat/tower defense game. You wield powers and use traps to kill orc invaders! You can choose whether you want to upgrade your traps or abilities. Not to mention the comedy is pretty entertaining. The fact that you can actively involve your character in killing the orcs rather than just sitting there waiting for a wave takes out some of the tedium of a typical TD game. Great idea!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960567058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2301, 'last_played': 1324454400}
review:
Why do you not all ready own this game?

Orcs Must Die! combines 3rd person shooter with tower defense and wise cracking jokes. Highly addictive game that is enough fun that you might find yourself trying to acquire all the achievements!

Currently has 1 DLC that grants 2 new traps and 2 new spells. A new DLC will be released soon that adds 5 new maps, 2 new enemies, and 1 new trap.

For 15 bucks, you can't go wrong!

review: Slaughtering orcs en masse with the help of a snarky, albeit dumb, hero.  Simple mechanics and a visceral satisfaction make this game instant fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994949294', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1320390000}
review:
Orks und Kobolde Arbeiten zusammen mit den Trollen ?

Aber hallo, in dem Spiel "Orcs must Die" finden sich allerlei hässliche Genossen wieder die man aus Fantasie Spielen oder Filmen kennt.

Trolle sind natürlich auch mit der Partie dabei und zeigen auch mit weiteren Gegner Massen echte klasse.

Aber warum wie ein Hack´n Slash Spiel die Orcs mit jedem Maus klick via Schwert abschlachten oder dem Bogen abschiessen ? Wenn es doch Fallen dafür gibt.

Das geht von dem Standart aus PoP bekanntem Stachelboden bis hin zu abzösen Pilzen die aus Feinden gleich  Freunde macht.


+Grafik
+Spielspaß
+Viele Fallenarten
-mehr Levels
-Multiplayer :(

5/5 Sterne

Fazit:
Für jeden Tower Defender Liebhaber ein "must Have" Game !
Ich bin sehr zufrieden für den Kauf von 15,- €uro und durch den kleinen DLC gibts gleich 4 Neue Waffen wie den Vampirhandschuh oder dem Brenner aus dem Boden ;)


Kaufen, Downloaden und Viel Spaß wünscht euch
euer SrgMartin

author: {'steamid': '76561198034389778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 830, 'last_played': 1364972400}
review:
An over the shoulder shooter / tower defence game. Brings you right into the middle of the fray as you try and stop orcs from entering the rifts to your world. Slice em, dice em, burn, em, freeze em, and a whole lot more with your varied arsenal of traps and spells.

Some of the earlier levels might be a tad boring, however as you progress you unlock more toys to decimate your foes with, and you can go back to older stages with all your unlocks. 

Fun for hours on end. Come forth young Warmage, defend your homeland, and remember ORCS MUST DIE!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024452362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 11009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7708, 'last_played': 1620606639}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005554700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1482, 'last_played': 1320912000}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000625372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1159, 'last_played': 1324368000}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is a beautiful game.  That's not just the graphics, though the art is highly stylized and very fitting of the game's comical atmosphere.  OMD takes the addictive mechanics of the tower defense genre and the fast-paced gameplay of an action RPG and creates a hybrid that works far better then would be expected.  At first it just gives you a new tower every level, but then you get magic gauntlets and paladins and skill tree and meta-upgrades; there's a tremendous amount of content in OMD, and a tremendous number of orcs waiting to break through your defenses and charge your portals.  If only you had aimed that fireball a little more accurately or placed those tar traps a bit further apart...

Oh well, "Retry Level."

author: {'steamid': '76561197969417125', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 376, 'playtime_forever': 1954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1954, 'last_played': 1342767600}
review: Orcs Must Die! is one of the most enjoyable games I've played this year. The combination of tower defence and third person combat gives a perfect mix of strategy and fast paced action. There's an interesting variety of enemies and traps which allows for good tactical depth. Some traps seem weak by themselves, but when combined with other traps, prove to be very effective. The map layouts are filled with opportunities to take advantage of, such as chokepoints and lava pits, and then you can use your avatar to plug the gaps in your defences. The hard rock background music adds to the intensity, and there's a nice Plants vs Zombies style sense of humour. There are hours of fun here even after finishing the campaign, as you can try to complete the maps on higher difficulties or go for 5 star ratings and high scores. The low purchase price equals great value for money. Its also very stable and bug free. Buy this game NOW.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002255438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1325750400}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044862282', 'num_games_owned': 461, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1324454400}
review:
Das Spiel "Orcs Must Die!" ist ein Lustiges Tower Defense Game mit Action Elementen. Das Gameplay ist schnell erzählt,  man muss als ein Mächtiger Kriegsmagier verschiedene Festungen vor einer Horde Orcs Verteidigen und hat dabei verschiedene Waffen und Fallen zur Auswahl. Es gibt genau 24 Missionen, und für jede Erfolgreich beendete Mission schaltet man eine neue Falle oder eine neue Waffe frei. Die Spiel dauer beträgt ca. 7 Stunden bis man alle Missionen beendet hat. Dann kann man entweder vorrige Missionen wiederholen um die Maximale Punktzahl zu erreichen die man vorher nicht geschafft hat oder Spielt den zusätzlichen Modus "Albtraum", mit dem man alle 24 Missionen auf einem Schwereren Durchlauf absolvieren kann.

Fazit:

Wer Tower Defense und Action nicht gerade Öde findet, kann bei Orcs Must Die! sorgenlos zugreifen!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973593062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 4006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4006, 'last_played': 1324368000}
review:
タワーディフェンス+TPSという、Sanctumに似たゲームですが、
こちらのほうがずっと良くできています。
トラップにかかったオークがミンチになる様は見ていて爽快感があります。
本作では特定の強力なコンボ以外では敵を全滅させることが難しく、
漏れてきた敵を迎撃するというシューター要素も大きいので
結構忙しくなります。特に、ノーミスクリアを目指すと難易度が跳ね上がります。
せっかくの良作だからマルチで遊びたかったですね。ちょっと残念です。

author: {'steamid': '76561198008905080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1212, 'last_played': 1465021340}
review: This game is well worth the 14.99, its all about stopping the orcs (And additionally cobolds and ogres) from reaching the rifts, which are the source of magic. The plot, while slightly lacking, is well written and ties the game together nicely, with a good ending. The only downside to this game is there's no multiplayer, but for 14.99, it's still more than worth it. Enjoy expermenting with combinations of traps, magic and crossbows, while watching countless orcs die. Once you've completed the game on War Mage difficulty (normal), play nightmare mode for some added difficulty and fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969519712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 3605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3605, 'last_played': 1336978800}
review: I'm hooked on this game. It has the right blend of puzzle solving and shooter gameplay to keep me coming back for more. There are variable solutions (aka trap combinations) to deal with the endless orcs, gnolls, kobolds and hellbats which keeps me coming back trying to get that last elusive skull. The main character apprentice war-mage is great; it's like Charlie Sheen playing Harry Potter (he even says "Winning" in the game). The difficulty curve does get steep about 3/4 of the way through the game, where it starts to feel impossible to get perfection on a level. Would be cool if there was some form of co-op multiplayer on this, but I'm hopeful that this game will have DLCs in the future to include new traps, levels, player-characters.

review: Orcs Must Die takes the classic Tower Defense formula and flips it on its head by allowing you to take control of a protagonist, the War Mage, and let's you take control of combat. There are ~25 traps, spells and weapons at your disposal to take out the Orcs any way you can. The most fun part is mixing and matching between the different combinations of traps, spells, weapons and skill trees to find the best way to tackle each map. Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989117548', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 2158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2158, 'last_played': 1324454400}
review:
Its been years since ive played a game as entertaining as this!! the large amount of traps(allowing many combinations) and the large variation of fortresses(where in each you can find a certain advantage) allows one to play them over and over,another bonus is that every trap you unlock and every upgrade you buy is persistant so you can go to an earlier level to experiment with the new traps. the "Nightmare" difficulty also picks up nicely where the war-mage dificulty ends. this game is all about making facing hordes of orcs fun and they have done a excellent job with that!!

the Quotes that the orcs spill are also funny.
the Normal difficultty campaign took me about 8 hours to complete.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970482178', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 3142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3142, 'last_played': 1333868400}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009288616', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1343631600}
review:
It's fun, but personally I prefer Sanctum.

In orcs must die, there's no coop, which I find really saddening. The paths are also pretty much set, and my hand's going to die from carpal tunnel from the amount of clicking I have to do with my crossbow at times D: (no hold LMB to fire; you have to repeatedly click, and your crossbow fires like a submachine gun).

It's difficult at times, but overall I sort of dislike the lack of path freedom. Sure you can build barricades, but those don't hold up to well. In sanctum, you can actually build the path that the enemies are going to take.

However, it has alright graphics, and seems like it will have an adequate campaign length; I haven't finished yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015757079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1154, 'last_played': 1321344000}
review:
攻めてくる大量のオーク達を、ボウガン・剣・魔法やトラップを駆使して撃退しよう。

このゲームは予想外の、日本語音声・日本語表示だった。
操作は一般的なアクション系ＴＰＳ。
面数、難易度、罠の種類等、組み合わせがいろいろあるのでかなり遊べる。
それで１５ドル切る価格が嬉しい。
マルチはないけど。気にならない。

資金で自分を強くするか、罠を買うか自分の得意なプレイスタイルを確立しよう。
トラップ関係のアップグレードは慎重にね。

なんて、偉そうに言ってるが、オイラ下手すぐるｗｗｗ

あっ、あとこのゲームのジャケットは映画　キャプテンスーパーマーケット　に似てるような。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970740383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1977, 'last_played': 1324540800}
review: Enorme.Ce jeu est tout bonnement excellent. Il ne dispose pas d'un système de jeu novateur en soit mais il est tout bonnement un pur bonheur à jouer.Je pense à lui comme un concept un peu comme sanctum de tower défense ou ici la vue est à la troisième personne.Vous placé des pièges digne d'un bon vieux jdr papier ainsi que des pièges plus dans un esprit de délire comme le leurre explosif ou la trappe qui lance un ennemi dans les airs,etc... Le jeu n'est pas d'une durée de vie sans pareil dans son mode normal la durée de vie est plutôt dans la possibilité de refaire les niveaux avec des pièges débloqué que vous n'aviez pas la première fois. De plus, le débloquage d'amélioration des pièges demande pas mal d'effort afin d'avoir des pièges plus performant ou moins cher et donc les niveaux n'en sont que plus drôle à jouer. Le mode cauchemar porte,lui,très bien son nom.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979084213', 'num_games_owned': 4492, 'num_reviews': 1009, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1324368000}
review:
Wow, the tower defense titles these days actually improve on what is already a fun game genre. In Orcs Must Die you control a warmage, in third person view. So instead of building traps in an isometric sort of  view, you now run around setting up traps and actively killing enemies with your character. There's never a dull moment and the fact that you gain new traps after finishing a level gives incentive to keep playing. You'll want to come back for more, it's THAT fun.
Other than that, the game mechanics are pretty much the same as any other tower defense game; you kill enemies, earn cash, upgrade traps, and try to prevent enemies from taking over your rifts.
Only downside, in my opinion, is that it's a single-player affair. I'm sure it would've been more fun when played in co-op mode but maybe that's something for the sequel.
Don't let that stop you from buying it though !

[Rating: 87/100]

review: First off: Play this, even if its just the demo; don't be fooled by how easy the demo is --this game gets fairly difficult pretty quickly. And when you finish the story mode, you unlock Nightmare Mode, which involves hard versions of every level with more, tougher enemies, next-to-no downtime between waves, and no breather "Unleash the Horde!" events. Great art, fantastic gameplay, witty dialogue. Completely worth its low price point.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979987597', 'num_games_owned': 2176, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1342335600}
review: This is a fun and interesting twist on the tower defense genre. The graphics are really great a mix between WoW & Dragon's Lair. The difficulty ramps up, but it never feels impossible. I would recommend it to anyone who likes the genre. It is almost as enjoyable (but right up there in quality) as Plants vs. Zombies. I am interested in seeing what the DLC will be like and how it will be priced.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986236936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1124, 'last_played': 1369589207}
review:
Cost of spring loaded trap? 500 coins. Hearing an Orc mention he was going to retire the next day right before he is catapulted into a pit of lava? Priceless.

Best $15 I ever spent on Steam. Do yourself a favor and buy it if you haven't already. Funny dialogue, interesting levels that let you get creative, and a great soundtrack with a fun art style have kept me replaying levels just for the lulz.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982462145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1099, 'last_played': 1342249200}
review: Beautiful indie game, if a indie company can make this and charge only 15 dollars, it proves the mass market gaming industry is fucked up. This game plays smoother, looks better, and is more fun than most of the crap being released today. did i mention its only 15$ compared to what? 60$ for a average game? 9/10 (-1 point cause they say infinite replayability, but thats only cause of a leaderboard, if it had a survival mode it would be 10/10 definately)

author: {'steamid': '76561197995731610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1142, 'last_played': 1342940400}
review:
If you like tower defense and strategic action games, this is the game for you. Build clever arrangements of traps and upgrade your weapons to fight endless hordes of monsters, with different strategies required for each stage.

The graphics are beautiful and cartoony, the music is fabulous, and the plot is simple and unintrusive but still fun. It's all wrapped up in a presentation that is amusing and charming, and honestly, I can't get enough of it.

It is easy enough that, with some persistence, even a casual player will be able to complete the story. For those of us who like a challenge, there's trying to get five skulls on every stage in nightmare mode!

The game comes at a low price, has 24 stages, three difficulty settings, and will likely have expansion DLCs in the future with more monsters and stages. So what's not to like about it?

author: {'steamid': '76561197999043186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1320998400}
review: If you're reading this, give Orcs Must Die! a try. I'm serious. I love the protagonist and his one-liners, and even without that the music is great, the gameplay is great, it's just not your usual run of the mill tower/traps defense. You have to plan, be smart, diligent, and slaying orcs is always its own reward.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972092514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1985, 'last_played': 1624063745}
review: Definitely try the demo first. If you grin and chuckle at all like I did while playing it, you'll enjoy the full game. Priced currently at $15, I've already gotten my money's worth with 7+ hours invested and more on the way. There is enough replayability to go back to earlier levels and refine your trap setting and weaver upgrades. My only problem with the game - no coop. This game is just crying for it. I've paid 50 bucks for games that I've only enjoyed 1/4 as much as this one. 8.5+ rating.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985998458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1357545600}
review:
While writing this review, I have not yet beaten this game.  In fact, I'm pretty sure I still have ways to go.  However, after quite a bit of anticipation, I'm glad to say that this game is worth its weight.  Its a unique spin to a genre that is getting more popular and offers a ton of variety.  Without having to due any calculation whatsoever in terms of placing down this or that, I simply go with what I prefer.  There is plenty of choice and strategy. 

 The flow of the game goes quite well with its style of humor and aesthetics.  It reminds me a bit of Heretic/Hexen in terms of weaponry/magic and the music strikes a resembling similarity to Warcraft 2.  

My only complaint is the lack of multiplayer.  While a great game on its own, having the ability to play with someone else would make it much much more entertaining.  However, one can only hope that it will be future content... otherwise I'll just get Dungeon Defenders when it is released.

5/5 Rating

author: {'steamid': '76561198006437466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 909, 'last_played': 1688493712}
review:
A hugely entertaining solo tower-defence/RPG hybrid which doesn't take itself too seriously.
(Also a contender for most self-explanatory game title ever!)

The game has a healthy mix of personal combat and summoning of minions/traps to prevent the orcish horde from reaching the portals that lead to our world.

A rating system which allows you to improve your kit, along with an online scoreboard are a worthwhile addition to a fun and in places challenging game.

Worth checking out :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198039362011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1513462396}
review:
Very easy to get into. EXTREAMLY FUN!
As casual games go there few that can offer you this much fun. Killing the hordes of orcs and vile creatures that storm your castles never gets old. The maps gets very interesting as you move truought the campaign and your unlocked traps and upgrades are persistent so you can use them all the time anywhere.

ORCS MUST DIE 
MUST BUY!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993876381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1013, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1013, 'last_played': 1322553600}
review:
Its fun, its cheap, its slaughtering loads of orcs :D

This game has a great feel and is quite challenging.  The humor is quite good and it presents an interesting take on the first/third person lane defense gametype. Except... in this game there are no towers, just traps... lots and lots of traps. They all feel very satisfying and you can upgrade your favorite ones by completing levels.
Your own weapons arn't too shabby either, ranging from a kick ass crossbow and bladestaff to powerfull magic spells.

If your looking for something to waste short bursts of free time on, get this game ^^
